And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.  There is more to come....
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Friday 12 till 5 PM  Saturday 12 till 7 PM  Sunday 12 till 5 PM

name: EPIC Brewing Company
description: EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.      In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 10:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Fenton Winery & Brewery
description: The Fenton Winery & Brewery just relocated to a new, beautiful, 5 acre property in Fenton Township. At over 1 acre, the beer garden is one (if not the) largest in the state. The taproom is located right alongside the brewery and is around the corner from the winery - all in full view of patrons. The FWB specializes in crafting balanced wines and beers that maximize flavor and originality. Food is available - from tasty specialty meat & cheese plates, to    delicious sandwiches and specialty pizzas. Definitely worth a stop (or three). Cheers!

name: Full Tilt Brewing
description: In this time of exploding craft brewing around the country you really need to step up your game to stand out in the crowd. No shortcuts. No easy way outs. When we brew, we brew with the best ingredients, the best equipment, and complete devotion to making the best beer we possibly can.    We believe in the exploration and advancement of all things craft brew. We refuse to cut corners and are always looking for new ways to improve on our products. We strive to be the best and until we are we will never stop attempting to blow your minds!

name: Ghost River Brewing
description: In 1887, Memphis first tapped the now famous Memphis Sands Aquifer. Recharged by the Ghost River's fragile wetlands, the aquifer has supplied Memphis with a steady and consistent supply of excellent drinking water ever since.    Ghost River Brewing knows that "great water makes great beer." And some of the greatest drinking water on earth is available right here in west Tennessee.    Brewing locally guarantees that every handcrafted, full-flavored Ghost River Ale is the freshest beer available . . . and when it comes to flavor, freshness means everything!    Ghost River Brewing supports the Wolf River Conservancy by donating a portion of the proceeds of every barrel sold.    Help Ghost River Brewing and the Wolf River Conservancy protect our local, natural resources and the quality of our famous drinking water

name: Great Crescent Brewery
description: The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.  We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.    We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.
hoursOfOperation: Friday 1PM to 6PM  Saturday Noon to 6PM  Closed Sunday through Thursday

name: Greenport Harbor Brewing Company
description: The idea began a long time ago over … well … a pretty terrible beer.  You see we (John from NY and Rich from Boston) met in college and had to drink what beer we could afford in those days.    As the years went by, the better the beer we consumed, the more we were consumed by it.  We tried every beer imaginable.  We read about beer. We talked about beer. We began making our own beer.  And finally we started talking and dreaming about opening a brewery on the North Fork.    In the Spring of 2008 the dream became a reality when Rich heard about an old firehouse for sale in the Village of Greenport.  Driven by thirst more than brains, we bought the building in the middle of what has been called a Global Economic Meltdown.  Next we started the renovation.  Did we mention Global Economic Meltdown?  We tried to do most of the work ourselves and luckily got a lot of help from some good friends and family.   The promise of beer can be powerful. Our luck continued when on a snowy January day, with no roof on our brewery, we got a visit from DJ Swanson and his 2 young children. No one in their right mind would have joined us. DJ did and agreed to be our new head brewer. In April with roof replaced, windows installed, and drains dug, our brew house arrived and the idea of making Greenport Harbor beer began. Four months later in July of 2009 we were officially shipping (hand truck and family cars) our beer.    Today our beer is served in over 200 places on Long Island (thank you Justin) and NYC.    We’re proud to say that since summer of 2009 we have been singled out for nearly every beer we have brewed from the Village Voice to the Tasting Table to TimeOut NY to Newsday to NY Examiner to Wall Street Journal to countless beer and food blogs.  We have a total of 13 employees if you include our forklift and delivery truck, which we do. We hope to add to this number in the next few months when we grow by 66 and 2/3’s percent by adding 2 new tanks. We are the only local brewery that brews 100% of our beer. We are small but hungry…we mean thirsty.
hoursOfOperation: Open for Tastings/Growlers/Retail:  Fri & Sat 12-7pm  Sun 12-6pm

name: Holy Brew Brewing Company
description: The inner battle of good and evil was never more apparent than when one takes that first cleansing sip of HolyBrew. While your "good" nature will definitely be aroused by this cool, spirit-raising refreshment, your inner evil will soon begin to feel less inhibited, allowing initial laughter and fun to soon require an internal battle of self-restraint.    History - Since the dawn of mankind, we have struggled with the battle of good and evil. To drown in guilt or sorrow is unhealthy and seen by some as wasted emotions. In opposition, to live our lives completely without impure influence and to be seen by all as “up-tight” without the ability to cut loose on occasion is viewed in equally a negative fashion. Until now, there has never been a respectable or enjoyable solution to this life long struggle.  HolyBrew is a positive channel for cleansing one’s mind, body and spirit of unwanted or unnecessary guilt, doubt or unhappiness. Through a recently discovered magical formula, believed to be created from the gods themselves, HolyBrew has formulated the “Liquid Confession”. What better way to cleanse one’s soul than to partake of this succulent brew, confess one’s sins and erroneous ways and let the weight of their guilt be lifted and their thirst quenched simultaneously.  Join the movement in guilt-free pleasure and refreshment. Have your liquid confession today and enjoy life to its fullest.

name: Golden
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Matthews
hoursOfOperation: 11am - 11pm daily

name: Littleton
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Alexandria
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Hopworks Urban Brewery
description: HUB is Portland's first Eco-Brewpub to offer all organic handcrafted beers, fresh local ingredients, and a sustainable building with a relaxed and casual atmosphere. Brewmaster Christian Ettinger has spent the past year and half constructing his dream brewpub.  HUB incorporates all aspects of sustainability.  From composting to rain barrels, and from pervious pavers to hand dryers, we have made every effort to protect our future with a thoughtful alternative.  Hopworks has four distinct areas including a family friendly restaurant with play area, a vibrant bicycle bar, banquet mezzanine, and outdoor beer-garden.  Our 20 barrel brewery produces 3000 barrels a year and provides our restaurant with ten different HUB organic beers on tap and two cask ales at all times. We have parking for seventy cars, eight motorcycles and up to fifty bikes.  Our world-class beer, New York style pizza, and wonderful staff are some of the best you will find anywhere.

name: Intercourse Brewing Company
description: "May your spirit be light and may you always enjoy Intercourse."    Affectionately named for the town in Lancaster County, PA Intercourse Brewing Company began production in June 2008.

name: Jailhouse Brewing Company
description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.
hoursOfOperation: Saturday's 2-6pm

name: Liberty Street Brewing Company
description: Liberty Street Brewing Company began in concept back in 2006, and finally became a reality in the fall of 2008.  We provide an elegant atmosphere where people can enjoy a fine, hand crafted beer in Plymouth, Michigan’s historic Old Village.    Our focus is to provide a large assortment of crafted, small batch ales and lagers through an exceptionally service oriented waitstaff.  We also offer a short list of regularly available food items during all hours of operation, and have special food items to be served during happy hour, weekends and special occasions.  Several local restaurants  deliver other fresh meals right to your table – just ask us for their carry-out menus.    The Upper Hall at the brewery can be reserved for private parties for up to 70 people.  It is a large area with separate restroom facilities, and a small service bar.  The Upper Hall has a sound and video system that can be used for business presentations, home movies, etc.  Inquire for details.

name: Lucky Bucket Brewing Company
description: After years of working a local brewpub and experimenting in the garage, three guys decided to take their know-how and passion for great beer and bottle it.    Lucky Bucket Brewing Company is Nebraska's newest craft brewery, growing almost as fast as we can brew it. Our first release, Pre-Prohibition style Lager, is getting some welcomed praise for representing the true character of beer, reminiscent of a time when beer actually had flavor. Keep an eye out for our latest releases including a very floral and flavorful American IPA and our first barrel-aged release, Certified Evil.

name: Mother Earth Brew Company
description: In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County.     Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!
hoursOfOperation: Retail Store	  Sun: 12pm to 5:30pm  Mon: Closed  Tues: Closed  Wed: 11am to 7pm  Thurs: 11am to 8pm  Fri: 11am to 8pm  Sat: 12pm to 5:30pm    Tasting Room  Sun: 12pm to 5pm  Mon: Closed  Tues: Closed  Wed: Closed  Thurs: 4pm to 8pm  Fri: 4pm to 8pm  Sat: 12pm to 5pm

name: Napa Smith Brewery
description: We create our beers using proprietary recipes developed by our Master Brewer Don Barkley, with his 30+ years in the craft brewing industry. Only the finest domestic and European hops, two row barley, and malted wheat are used in the beer that we make
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: New Planet Beer Company
description: New Planet Beer specializes in great tasting craft ales, that are 100%gluten-free, offering a range of beer styles that can be enjoyed by any craft beer drinker, but especially by those that gluten-free is their only option. Unrivaled in flavor, quality, taste and care, New Planet is everything a craft beer should be.    The brand is grounded on what’s good for the earth and for the individual, and is about discovering something better. That’s why New Planet is dedicated to donating a portion of their proceeds to help make the planet better for all of us.

name: Old Forge Brewing Company
description: Old Forge Brewing Company is a fun, casual, comfortable brewpub, specializing in healthy pub fare and fresh brewed beer.    Our country was built on the skills and labor of old-world artisanal craftsmen. Woodworkers, carpenters, stonemasons, ironworkers, blacksmiths, tileworkers, and many others came here and employed the knowledge and skills of their craft in building their farms, homes, and towns.    Nowadays, it is so easy and convenient to purchase generic products from big-box stores, that we sometimes neglect to appreciate the uniqueness and quality of a hand-crafted product.    At Old Forge Brewing Company, we strive to honor personal craftsmanship. Our hand-crafted beer is made in small batches to ensure quality and peak freshness, while the healthy and delicious menu has ingredients sourced from local farms and markets wherever possible. Take the time to notice our bar, furniture, and fixtures which were all handcrafted by local wood and metal worker Keith Kocher (Lightstreet Custom Woodworking). Check out our unique tap handles carved and forged by local artist/sculptor J. Mark Irwin (Irwin Sculpture Studio), and our plates, bowls, and beer mugs, all hand-made by local potter Mike Hart (M. Hart Pottery).

name: Prison Brews
description: Prison Brews is a unique brewpub located in the historic east side of Jefferson City two blocks from the old Missouri State Penitentiary. Our nostalgic, relaxed environment soothes your mind while enticing your senses with a diverse food menu and large selection of handcrafted ales. The large outdoor patio and bocce courts provide a great way to enjoy a beautiful Missouri day. Break out of the ordinary and escape to Prison Brews!

name: Red Eye Brewing Company
description: Our craft beers are produced in small batches, by experienced brewers, using only the highest quality ingredients. Our brewers view these beers as a painter would his "palette", through which they manipulate grain, hops, yeast, and brewing techniques. We also encourage our brewers to add a little of their own creative flair.

name: Rifle Brewing Company
description: All of our microbrews are brewed on premise with the highest quality of craftmanship. We offer four core brews year round.  Our brewer is constantly switching up our selection so make sure to come in often for his newest creation.  You'll leave happy every time - guaranteed.
hoursOfOperation: Monday thru Thursday: 5 PM - 9 PM  Friday thru Saturday: 5 PM - 9:30 PM

name: Rocky Point Artisan Ales
description: Brewing artisanal lagers and ales in Rocky Point, Long Island.

name: South County Brewing Company
description: South County Brewing Co. is located in beautiful southern York county PA.   Brewing handcrafted Ales and lagers on a production system with an onsite taproom for retail sales.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri:	5:30 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: Southern Star Brewing Company
description: Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse.     Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF.     Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.
hoursOfOperation: We hold tours every Saturday at 1pm

name: Sun King Brewing Company
description: Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers.     Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 21,000 barrels of beer in 2013. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.    Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.
hoursOfOperation: Retail Hours (Carry-out Only)  Tuesday - Noon - 6  Wednesday - Noon - 6  Thursday - Noon - 4    Tasting Hours  (Carry-out and Sampling)  Thursday - 4 - 7  Friday - 12 - 7  Saturday 1 - 4

name: Swamp Head Brewery
description: Founded in 2008, upon the foundation of our great state, we raised our roof to brew world-class beers and establish ourselves as Florida’s brewery. Having travelled through lands far and close, and finding inspiration along the way, we are proud to be here, proud to be Inherently Floridian.    It has been our mission since day one to be Florida's brewery. We love our neighbors, but we're focused on providing our state with the beer it deserves.    That's only a small part of it.    Have a look around, from our brewery, to our logo and branding, to our beer, you can see that we live, love and are Florida. From now until the horizon, Swamp Head Brewery is Inherently Floridian.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday: 4pm to 8pm

name: Triangle Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned craft brewery situated in downtown Durham, North Carolina. Triangle Brewing Company is dedicated to producing well balanced, full-flavored, yet highly drinkable Belgian and American style ales.    Triangle beers are made with the finest hops and barley malt. Flavors harmonize, not fight for individual attention. Triangle beers are not pasteurized nor do we add preservatives (except for a healthy addition of hops). Seeing beer as equal to, if not superior to, wine, Triangle beers are designed to complement food. Because of this effort, soon one will be able to walk into any fine restaurant and pub in the Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill region and be pretty sure of finding a Triangle beer available.
hoursOfOperation: Tours every Saturday 1pm to 2:30pm

name: Lee Hill
description: Located in Boulder with two tap rooms (Flatiron Park & Lee Hill), Upslope taps into Colorado's active lifestyle by offering superior quality, hand-crafted ales & lagers in cans for the on-the-go beer enthusiast.    Ascend to New Heights.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: Vallensons Brewing Company
description: Vallensons Brewery    Our small home brewery located in Pearland Texas just South of Houston was founded in December 2008. We have been brewing great beers for over 14 years and one day aspire to have our own Nanobrewery. Since any start-up is always tough, we feel starting small and expanding later is the best way to go.     As a Nanobrewery we brew 1/2  barrel of beer at a time which means we can afford to brew different styles of beer in smaller quantities (less cost) while focusing attention to traditional styles with a creative twist. At Vallensons we like to experiment and thus far our beers have been very successful.     Vallensons plans to be different then the standard brewery by carving a niche out of the craft brewing industry. Vallensons Brewing Company plans to build its reputation on quality, character and consistency and the best part of it all is that we plan on having fun along the way. We believe that if you put passion into what you love then you will yield success.

name: Vertigo Brewing
description: The early seeds of Vertigo Brewing were sown back in 1995 when Mike Haines and Mike Kinion began experimenting with brewing at U-Brew in Tigard, Oregon. But what began as a light hobby soon developed into a deep passion. They quickly outgrew the offerings of U-Brew and expanded their operation into a homebrew setup. Fifteen years later, the two Mikes have a lot of batches, awards, and experience under their belts. Starting in May of 2008, Vertigo Brewing was christened a fully-licensed brewery in a Hillsboro warehouse.   Vertigo Brewing is currently operating a one barrel system, producing eight to ten barrels a month. But as demand takes off, the two Mikes are eagerly looking forward to an expanded business operation. Vertigo prides itself on producing a unique blend of beer offerings that manage to stand out in the beer-saturated market of the Northwest.

name: Waterway Brewing Company
description: Great People! Great Fun! Great Beer! Private, exclusive brewpub. Not open to the general public. Admission only to members and their guests. Membership by invitation only. No exceptions, ever. Trespassers will be shot. Survivors will be shot again.

hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: 16 Mile Brewing Company
description: 16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.    The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)

name: 192 Brewing Company
description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.

name: Asher Brewing Company
description: At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power!    Chris Asher decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009.      On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.)    USDA Organic Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 12:00am Fri:  2:00pm - 12:00am  Tap Room Hours:  Sat-Wed  2pm-10pm  Thurs/Fri 2pm - 12am

name: Back Forty Beer Company
description: Back Forty is a micro brewery based out of Gadsden, Alabama. With 2 offerings currently distributed throughout the state, Back Forty is the only Alabama based brewery that can be found anywhere from Muscle Shoals to Mobile.    The name Back Forty Beer Company is basically a reference to the back 40 acres of the farm. Tradionally the "Back 40" of a farm is the most challenging to maintain, but also produces some of the best yields due to the rich content of the earth. Likewise, Alabama was one of the last States in The Union to update it's outdated beer laws (MS is the only one left), and now it's time to reap those yields.    The craft beer market in Alabama has a lot of room to grow, and we plan on doing everything we can to make that happen. Our main goal is to focus on the local community and support other small business owners while offering up our tasty flavors for the people of Alabama.     The company is founded in Alabama, and just about every aspect of this business is supported by Alabama based suppliers. We've worked with a Design firm out of Athens, AL on our label and logos, our attorney is in Birmingham, our accountant is in Dothan, AL, our shirts are printed in Huntsville and our Brewmaster is out of Montgomery, AL.     We've been working with Jamie Ray (A nationally recognized Brewmaster who has won several medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, CO), for over a year on our first offering, "Naked Pig Pale Ale". And we have several ideas in the works for additional year round offerings in the coming months. We're looking forward to producing some great beers that Alabamian's have never tasted before. Once things get up and running, we'll start releasing some seasonal offerings, one-time offerings, limited edition batches, etc. That's what we're really excited about.    The only aspect of this operation that isn't planted firmly in Alabama soil, is the production and packaging. We had to go to another craft brewery in a neighboring state for our first production batches. This is partially due to the enormous start-up costs associated with building a complete brewery operation from scratch. But it's also given us the opportunity to support another regional micro-brewery while we get up and running.

name: Backlash Beer Company
description: It’s time to stand up against the predictable, old beer establishment and craft beers the way they were intended: flavorful, gimmick free and not produced in ridiculous quantities. We’re a Boston company with a Boston attitude, here to reclaim beer by recruiting people to fuel the craft beer movement.    Join the Backlash.

name: Barrier Brewing Company
description: Barrier Brewing Co. is a 1bbl brewery operated by Evan Klein and Craig Frymark located in Oceanside, NY. The focus is small scale production of a breadth of styles and flavors brewed for the local market. The first batches were released to the public in June 2010.    "Brewing For Quality Not Quantity"

name: Becker Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily Noon to 6 pm, Saturday 11am to 6pm

name: Big Bay Brewing Company
description: At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor.     The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Wed: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Big Muddy Brewing Co
description: All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.  Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.  Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.  It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.  Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.  Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.  The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).  Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.  The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.

name: Black Raven Brewing Company
description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a small retail taproom. We are the Eastside’s home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers. We also feature a continually changing hand-picked selection of other notable Washington State beers. And most importantly, home to local beer lovers who want to be a part of a community that enjoys great beer and great friends.

name: Blue Heron Brewing Company
description: From Pale Ale to Stout and from Porter to Pilsner, brewing beer  is our passion and as a family we're dedicated to bringing  New Mexico the finest brews.

name: Boylan Bridge Brewpub
description: The Boylan Bridge Brewpub has a bright and open atmosphere conducive to conversation, business, and social interaction. The architectural millwork and cabinetwork built downstairs in the shop has made the Bridge a beautiful, durable facility using fine woods, ceramic tile, and canvas covered tackboard on the walls.    The brewing operation is visible from the bar through glass doors, offering an industrial connection with stainless steel tanks and copper piping throughout.    The most popular feature of the place is the outdoor deck. It offers an expansive view of the downtown Raleigh skyline. A wood post and beam pergola structure enclose the space and provides mottled shade without trapping sound, making conversation easy.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday  4:00pm - 11:00pm  Friday-Sunday  11:30am - Midnight

name: Cathedral Square Brewery
description: Founded in March 2009, Cathedral Square Brewery is located at 3914 Lindell Blvd in Mid-Town St. Louis. With over 200 accounts in Missouri, Illinois, and Kansas, we offer our beers in both draught and 22oz. bottles. Head brewmaster Brian Neville has over 15 years of experience in the industry. Brian has been with the likes of Spanish Peaks Brewing and their flagship Black Dog Brewery. Brian also helped build O'Fallon Brewery & Trailhead Brewery among others.

name: Chicago Beer Company
description: Chicago Beer Company is in persistent pursuit of producing the finest quality craft beers that will be deemed worthy of their Chicago namesake. Such was the destiny that led to the creation of Chicago Beer Company’s flagship release, Chi-Town Windy City Wheat! On draft and in bottles!

name: Colorado Brewing Company
description: New Brewhouse/Micro-Brewery in downtown Boulder, CO. What was the Redfish Brewhouse location, the Colorado Brewing Company/Boulder Draft House opened its doors February 20, 2009. We are a Boulder brewhouse serving amazing comfort food that is regionally and globally inspired along with perfectly balanced handcrafted beers for the everyday beer drinker and the micro-brew enthusiast, all served in a friendly and comfortable setting that is enhanced by quality live music several days a week

name: Cool Springs Brewery
description: Brewpub with a focus on innovation and unique brewing styles. We utilize multiple yeast strains and techniques to develop traditional sours, and Belgian style beer. We also love the hops, and most of CSB's pales represents a PNW hop characteristic.

name: Craggie Brewing Company
description: Our passion is to locally produce quality craft beers and to foster community involvement with commitment and integrity.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: Wednesday-Thursday: 4-9p  Friday-Saturday: 4-10p

name: DC Brau Brewing Company
description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.
hoursOfOperation: *Hours are typically 1-4pm, Saturdays. Follow us on Facebook & Twitter for schedule changes.  Tours will be held at 1:30, 2:30, & 3:30.

name: Doubleheart Brewing
description: Doubleheart evokes the love of all things that come in pairs in our life, Tara and I, our two dogs Jake and Shay and our love of both Chicago and Harbor Springs. Doubleheart’s beers are a reflection of these dualities.

name: Elk Mountain Brewing
description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.

name: Evolution Craft Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to produce the finest local ales in the Mid Atlantic Region. We are a Craft Brewing company focused on producing well balanced handcrafted ales.

name: Figure Eight Brewing
description: Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.    Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.
hoursOfOperation: Wed & Thr 5-8p   Fri 3-8p, Sat 12-6p   Sun 12-6p   Sunday Carryout

name: Finger Lakes Beer Company
description: Finger Lakes Beer Company was established in the fall of 2009 by Partners, Wayne Peworchik & Mark Goodwin. Both Wayne and Mark were avid homebrewers for many years. Mark continued on with his brewing education by completing the Web-based Concise Course in Brewing Technology at the Siebel Institute of Technology World Brewing Acadamy from which he obtained his Certificate.   We selected our location nestled in the heart of the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of upstate New York for its close proximity to Keuka Lake and the availability for lake water for brewing. Our building offered a spacious workable layout, ample parking and room for future expansion. We began our building renovations and equipment installation in early 2010,  received our license in the fall of 2010, and on November 11th, 2010 opened our doors for tours, tastings, and growler fills.     Our Brew Room features a matched Ripley 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Brewing system. The Brew House includes a Boil Kettle, Mash Tun and Hot Liquor Tank. The Brew Room also features 3 double wall digital temperature controlled fermentation tanks, grain mill, filter, and other assorted brewing equipment. Adjacent to the brew room is a walk-in cooler containing 8 - 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Serving Tanks and assorted keg filling and dispensing equipment.     The entrance way and tasting room offer large windows for great views of the Brew Room  as well as a large comfortable area for you and your friends to relax and visit while enjoying your favorite brews offered fresh daily. We offer tastings and growler fills of fine crafted ales and root beer all brewed on premises as well as guided tours on non-brewing days. Have your own growlers, we fill your clean growlers. Don't own one yet, no worries we have 1 and 2 liter in several styles with our logo on them.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday 12:00 - 5:00                                         Monday 12:00-6:00                                    Tuesday       CLOSED                                  Wednesday 12:00-6:00                                       Thursday 12:00-6:00                                            Friday 12:00-6:00                                             Saturday 12:00-6:00

name: Fire Island Beer Company
description: Fire Island Beer Company has emerged from the handiwork of two brothers and a cousin who developed their taste for craft beer and home brewing during the summers they spent on Fire Island, the naturally beautiful barrier island just off Long Island's south shore. The relaxed island has attracted families, artists, partiers, weekend beach-goers and outdoor sports lovers for generations, yet it refuses to allow cars, pretention and the frantic pace common to NY-metro area culture. This led us to coin it “The Other New York”, a concept we find very refreshing.

name: Freetail Brewing Company
description: #1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".    Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.    We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.    Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: Noon-Midnight  Monday: 4pm - Midnight  Tuesday - Saturday: 11:30am to Midnight or Later

name: Fulton Brewing Company
description: The Fulton Brewing Company is a local craft brewery located in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Brewing professionally since 2009 (and out of a garage since 2006), this small team of brewers have created a line of beers that has been in high demand among bars and pubs in the Minneapolis/St. Paul area. Since moving to a new location in 2011, the Fulton Brewery is the only production brewery operating in Downtown Minneapolis. A taproom at the brewery is currently under construction with a planned opening in March 2012.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 3 - 7  Saturdays Noon - 4

name: Funkwerks
description: In 2007 Gordon Schuck’s recipe design and brewing skills resulted in a gold medal-winning Saison at the National Homebrew Competition. Brad Lincoln first experienced craft beer while working as an accountant in Portland, OR. The two met during the winter of 2009 while attending the Siebel Institute and studying brewing science. After being immersed in beer for the better part of five months, the two graduated and shared a desire to open a brewery. This resulted in the Saison-focused brewery that is now Funkwerks, opening December 9, 2010.     Saisons originated as Belgian farmhouse ales- brewed during winter months for the farm workers during the summer months. Usually having a dry profile and complex fruity aromas, Saisons today are brewed year-round and generally have a higher alcohol percentage than their original versions.     Funkwerks’ two flagship beers, Saison and Tropic King, are produced year round. Also brewed annually are four seasonals, a number of small experimental batches, and select barrel-aged releases. Funkwerks flagship Saison was awarded a gold medal at the 2012 Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and a silver medal in 2011. Deceit, a Belgian-Style golden strong ale, was also awarded a gold medal at the GABF in 2012. In addition to receiving two gold medals in 2012, the GABF named Funkwerks the 2012 Small Brewing Company of the Year.     Funkwerks is located at 1900 East Lincoln Avenue in Fort Collins, Colorado. The tasting room- complete with an indoor bar, retail area and spacious outdoor, dog-friendly patio- is open 7 days a week: Sunday through Thursday from 12pm-8pm; Friday and Saturday from 12pm-9pm. Brewery tours are given Saturdays at 2pm.     Funkwerks is currently distributed in:  Colorado:  American Eagle Distributing and C.R. Goodman     Nebraska:  Quality Brands of Omaha and Double Eagle Beverage     Arizona:  Hensley Beverage Company

name: Great South Bay Brewery
description: GSB is a Craft Brewery in Long Island, NY, Specializing in American, Belgian & German Beers, with much added creativity.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Hofbräuhaus Pittsburgh
hoursOfOperation: Sunday 12p-12am  M-W 11am – 12am  Thursday 11am-1am  Fri & Sat 11am – 2am

name: Hometown Beverages
description: Hometown Beverages’ mission is to create traditional American lagers with flavors that are unique to the palate of beer drinkers in their respective area. Try new Hometown Light, Pennsylvania Lager, New Jersey Lager and New York Lager!    Hometown Beverages is America’s best new brewer of what they call "specialty" session beers. You know the kind you can drink one after another - after another - and not get filled up.     Hometown currently brews four different beers, namely - Hometown Light, Hometown Pennsylvania Lager, Hometown New Jersey Lager and Hometown New York Lager.     Chris Curylo and Bob Selsky, aka The “Hometown Boys,” are the owners of Hometown. They brew their beers in beautiful Wilkes-Barre, PA.

name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.
description: Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the State of Oregon.  Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley has just opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.  Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.  The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Huske Hardware House Restaurant and Brewery
description: Fayetteville North Carolina's only downtown brewery with live entertainment!  Enjoy first-class Custom Brewed beer in a casual, sophisticated atmosphere!    Huske Hardware is proudly brewing 6 unique Custom Craft Beers - never filtered and always using the highest quality import and domestic malts and hops.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	 11:00am - 10:00pm  Wed - Thu:  11:00am - 12:00pm  Fri - Sat:  11:00am - 2:00am  Sun:  11:00am - 9:00pm

name: Kinney Creek Brewery
description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:30 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Ladyface Ale Companie
description: Ladyface Ale Companie was established in late 2009 along with its restaurant Ladyface Alehouse & Brasserie. Named LA Weekly’s 2013 Best Brewery in LA, and an international RateBeer.com Best Brewpub, Ladyface is known for their award-winning Belgian, French and American style ales.  La Blonde, La Grisette, Blind Ambition Abbey Ale, Trois Filles Tripel, and seasonal ales such as La Trappistine® Belgian Dark Ale, Bluebelly Barleywine and Dérailleur® Bière-de-Garde are brewed onsite. Ladyface is one of Los Angeles County’s first modern day microbreweries, and the first brewpub in the Conejo Valley. Visit www.ladyfaceale.com for more information on Ladyface beers, tours and special events.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Lavery Brewing Company
description: Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!    By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

name: Lonerider Brewing Company
description: We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.    "Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

name: Lucid Brewing
description: In July 2010, over a craft beer at a local restaurant, Eric Biermann and Jon Messier had a Lucid thought – “Let’s throw away the ties and the corporate ladders.  Let’s start a craft beer brewery!”  That Clarity in Thinking, led to the successful launch of Lucid Brewing.    In June of 2011, with a year of planning already completed, they realized jumping headfirst into the brewery was the only way they could make their dream a reality.  They quit their day jobs.      With that leap of faith – and a ton of support from many friends and family – they started building their brewery from the ground up.  Through the sweltering heat of the 2011 summer, many friends labored side by side with Jon and Eric.  They did it all, start to finish, from digging trenches to assembling the last tank.  So of course they needed a refreshing and light drink to quench their thirst while they toiled away.  They found just the right recipe and brewed their first beer – AIR.  A beer made to get the job done.  Its slight citrus aroma and flavor, lower ABV and crisp dry finish made this their favorite “go to” beer.      By October the brewery was complete and cooking.  And in the spirit of the season, Eric and Jon gave thanks to the Brew gods when they made their first deliveries to their first three customers the week of Thanksgiving… in Jon’s car.  Lucid was on its way!    Always keeping an eye on the demand for high quality while quickly catching the craft beer lover’s attention, Lucid assembled a team of dedicated employees and introduced brews to quench their customers’ demands.   AIR, DYNO, FOTO and DUO, along with seasonal and small-batch brews, are quickly becoming Minnesota favorites at local bars and restaurants.      Great success has followed them after throwing away the daily grind for the daily brew.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Manor House Brewing
description: Historically, beer has been brewed on premise at Manorhouses because it was difficult to transport. This led to a great diversity of beer in both taste and style. Manorhouses brewed to seasons and used beer as both sustenance and social lubricant. Manorhouses and the beer they produced were unique to families and the communities of which they were a part. We will fulfill all those same criteria.     Manor House Brewing represents an alternative to conventional beer, we are prideful in our local roots and want to inspire pride in our local community. Our beer is an output of a thoughtful creative process and we view what we do as art, not commodity. We experiment with new things, but try to predict the outcome in advance. Every so often, we accidentally stumble upon greatness.    Why do we want to brew beer? To satisfy a longing for the simple pleasures and a simpler time. Happiness, joy, and relaxation is our goal.    How are we different from every other craft brewer? The very same thing that makes us the same. We are creative, innovative and different. We do not feel compelled to brew to style as we may create our own, but when we do brew to style, we do so with passion.

name: Milwaukee Ale House
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:  11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun:  11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: New Jersey Beer Company
description: New Jersey Beer Co. is dedicated to crafting quality beer for all; from the occasional beer drinker to the beer aficionado. We believe that good products come from good people, and strive to do our very best for our community and our customers. We believe we can provide happiness through doing what we love, and that a good beer can make the good times great

name: Noble Ale Works
description: Noble Ale Works is a microbrewery located in Anaheim, California at the Stadium Plaza Business Park in the Platinum Triangle. We are conveniently located between the Angels Stadium and the Honda Center.     Our goal is to create and maintain high quality full flavored craft brews for those who can handle it. "We are not here to convert light or non-beer drinkers; our beer is for people that already appreciate craft beer" We will never skimp on quality or freshness of ingredients, so that we can maintain the high profile flavor of brews that we at Noble care about.

name: The Brewpub
description: The highest quality ingredients and passion of our head brewers Ron Jeffries and John Walsh help to insure every bottle of North Peak beer is brewed to perfection. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Every beer is brought to life through labor and love. We strive to create beers to lighten the spirit and soothe the soul.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11a - 11p  Friday - Saturday: 11a - 12a  Sunday: 12p-11p

name: O'Dempsey's
description: O’Dempsey’s *Beer To Die For* is the creation of Atlanta homebrewer  Randy Dempsey.  A passionate beer aficionado Randy began all-grain homebrewing in 1984.  He was always focused on adjusting and perfecting his craft and sharing his creations with friends. In 2009, after much persuading he made the decision to "go pro" and share his beers with the rest of the world. He'll continue perfecting his craft and sharing his new brews with his friends.  You know who they are.  Enjoy.

name: Old World Brewery
description: We are a local brewery in Phoenix at the old Capital Station Post office 334 N 25th Ave., selling fresh local craft beer to retail, bar, and resort accounts throughout Metro Phoenix and Az.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am	-	7:00 pm

name: Original Gravity Brewing Company
description: Original Gravity Brewing Company is well worth the trip to Milan! This brewpub features unique handcrafted beers and pub sandwiches and snacks. Great atmosphere with an outdoor beer garden in the warmer months. See website for featured small batch beers.

name: OysterHouse Brewing Company
description: The Oyster House is a small micro brewery devoted to producing high quality, unique ales for beer and seafood lovers.

name: Payette Brewing Co
description: Our brewery currently runs a 15-barrel brewing system and offers four year-round beers: Payette Pale Ale, Outlaw IPA, Mutton Buster Brown Ale and North Fork Lager. In 2012, we made Idaho brewing history when we introduced Payette Pale Ale and Mutton Buster in cans. Be on the lookout for even more choices of canned beer in the future. In the meantime, you can find our beer in bars, restaurants, and retail locations including grocery and specialty stores throughout Idaho.    We chose the name Payette because it fits the way we live and work. Francois Payette was a French Canadian trapper whose name and memory is enshrined among numerous Idaho landmarks. The name has since become synonymous with an adventurous spirit that pervades Idaho's year-round outdoor lifestyle.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: 3-10pm  Tues, Wed, Thurs: 3-8pm  Friday: 3-10pm  Saturday: 12-10pm  Sunday: Closed

name: People's Brewing Company
description: The People's Brewing Company provides high quality hand-crafted beer and education of the craft beer industry to the people of Lafayette and the state of Indiana while providing community leadership with environmentally friendly business practices. We offer a taproom and tours of our facility. Our staff is fully trained on the brewing process, beer styles, and beer production. We encourage our customers to become educated in craft beers and local beer history.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room Hours of Operation:  Wednesday - Friday             2pm - 8pm  Saturday / Sunday              12pm - 8pm    Brewery Tours:  Wednesday - Friday by Appt.  Saturday / Sunday 12pm - 5pm    Every half hour • Free of charge

name: Pipeworks Brewing Company
description: Pipeworks began, as many breweries do, in the stove top kettles and plastic-bucket fermenters of the home brewer. Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis met while working at Chicago's famous West Lakeview Liquors, a haven for beer geeks in search of new and exciting brews from around the world. While working there, the two got to thinking it was time to turn their passion in to a business.     The first steps in that long journey  took them to a the small town of Lo in the Belgian countryside. It was there that the Pipeworks boys lived and worked with Urbain Coutteau owner and brewer at the De Struise Brewery. While working there the boys honed their craft, learned the ins and outs of running a brewery, and had the opportunity to create their first commercially available beers. The success of these brews fueled their passion and prepared them for the work ahead of them.     Upon coming back to the States the two began experimenting with pilot batches, formulating a business plan, and developing an image for Pipeworks.     Now we are ready to bring what we've learned to the craft beer world!

name: Prism Brewing Company
description: Prism Beer Company was started in 2009 by Rob DeMaria, a Philadelphia native who found artistic expression in making beer. Having studied film in his early college years, he always had an eye for seeing things differently. In fact, that creative thinking enabled his career in technology, but his artistic expression was still missing. So one day he decided to try his hand in making his own beer. Of course, he couldn't allow himself to follow the recipe

name: Gem & Keystone
description: True to nature, true to the craft    It's the motto of ShawneeCraft, a summary of our philosophy, and the ideal to which we aspire. We call it the fidelis philosophy.    We’re true to nature because environmental impact is a consideration in every decision we make. We honor the nature of materials that we work with. No shortcuts, no artifice. We’re true to the craft because we honor traditions of workmanship perfected by centuries of well-trained hands.    The Fidelis Philosophy took root in the fertile soil of Shawnee-On-Delaware, Pennsylvania. Our village, bounded by wooded hills on one side and the Delaware River on the other, enjoys a mild and varied climate, plenty of water and sun, abundant plants and wildlife and friendly, talented people. We are captivated by this nature and its possibilities. And our location- less than 100 miles from both New York City and Philadelphia- makes it only natural for us to broadly share the Fidelis Philosophy.    In a world of mass-production, our products are handmade. In a world of homogeneity, our products represent a defiant individuality. In a world without roots, our products embody a tangible sense of place. We aspire to eat what we grow, to drink what we brew, and to build what we use. And we’d like you to experience a taste of this lifestyle yourself- in the form of ShawneeCraft beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: ShawneeCraft Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room Hours:  Wednesday - Sunday: 12:00 - 5:00 and Thursdays until 10:00    Tours:  Wednesday - Sunday: 12:00

name: Old Plant No. 1 Pub
description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed:11:30 to 9:30  Thu:11:30 to 10:30  Fri:11:30 to Midnight  Sat:Noon to Midnight  Sun:Closed

name: St. Francis Brewery
description: Saint Francis Brewery opened in the Spring of 2009 to great popularity and success.    Known for our hand-crafted beers,  Brewmaster Scott Hettig has built upon our foundation of five beers:  Kolsch, Amber Ale, Nut Brown Ale, Weiss and Oatmeal Stout to feature a Bohemian Pilsner, Double Red Ale, Belgian Triple and many more.    These wonderful beers are complimented by the great food Executive Chef Ron Wolf creates.  When you stop in, make sure you try our ribs!  They are made with our signature Oatmeal Stout BBQ Sauce

name: Straight to Ale
description: Located in the historic Lincoln Mills, we are working hard to provide our hometown of Huntsville, Alabama with top quality, full flavored beer in styles ranging from English brown ales to American Imperial IPA’s and everything in between. You can find our beer on draft at many local restaurants and bars. If we’re not already on tap at your favorite hang-out, please ask them why not!    Straight To Ale’s products are distributed throughout our great state of Alabama by our friends at Alabama Beverage.
hoursOfOperation: The Tap Room is open Wednesday through Saturday from 3pm until 8pm.    FREE brewery tours are given on Saturdays at 2PM.  Weekly tour is limited to 20 people and you must be 21 or over. Reservations are required.

name: The Blind Pig Brewery
description: An English style pub with it's own built-in brewery. Four kinds of beer brewed just a few feet from where it's served. Plus hundreds of local and craft beers on cask, tap or bottle.

name: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery
description: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery (OMB), located in the heart of south Charlotte, produces premium, all natural beer and delivers it fresh weekly to bars, restaurants and retailers in the region. OMB uses only the finest ingredients available worldwide and employs traditional, intensive brewing methods to transform them into world class beer that’s full-flavored yet amazingly refreshing. Although our methods are more costly, we think you’ll agree the results are worth it. Look for OMB on tap throughout the Charlotte region, in growler bottles at your local retailer or just come straight to the brewery and taste the difference.

name: Triton Brewing Company
description: Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana.     Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.    Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.    Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.

name: Union Ale Brewing Company
description: Union Ale is Santa Barbara's sports bar and ale house. We specialize in Burgers, Flatbreads and Craft Beer. We have Santa Barbara's best onsite beer selections with 24 taps of craft beers from across the nation. We have a bottled beer list that will make you drool. We smoke our meats in house and bake our breads in house. Showing every NFL game, Lakers and Clippers game, and all of your favorite March Madness, Union Ale is the place to be. So come on down and fill up a boot. Cheers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:30 am

name: Von Scheidt Brewing Company
description: VonScheidt Brewing Co. is Twin Falls' home town pub & brewery. Featuring the best live music in the Magic Valley and local beers brewed in house by brewmaster Pat VonScheidt. Delicious food is served daily and we're open till the last cat leaves!

name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company
description: Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew.  	  On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion.    The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!

name: 3 Stars Brewing Company
description: 3 Stars Brewing is a DC based production brewery founded by Mike McGarvey and Dave Coleman to provide the community with great, fresh, local craftbeer.     We are looking forward to opening our doors in 2011. In doing so, we will proudly brew beers that push the limits of conventional brewing while still providing our customers with great, fresh, local craft beers...contact us at info@3starsbrewing.com

name: 4th Way Brewing Company
description: Microbrewery with a cafe to feature our wide range of beer styles matched with local organic eats.

name: 50 Back Brewing Company
description: Our entire purpose is to say "Thank you" to all of the active Troops and Veterans in our Country who have served so selflessly to protect and preserve our dear Nation and precious Freedom! Of course, our gratitude began close to our hearts with our own fathers, grand-fathers and uncles, and quickly spread to friends, neighbors, and colleagues.    We searched for a way to carry out our goal, we decided to find an avenue that would facilitate wide-spread reception and the ability to give back repeatedly. What better way than a great tasting lager? As predicted, the reception to our mission has, indeed, been overwhelmingly positive and dynamic. As we share our idea, everyone invariably expresses their gratitude for the fact that we are providing a manner in which they can give back on an individual and personal level. Surprisingly, Troops and Veterans have said "Thank you" back to us!

name: American River Brewing Company
description: NESTLED near the American River in Rancho Cordova, CA and located in a revitalized warehouse along Trade Center Drive is American River Brewing Company.    The dream-come-true of founder/brewer David Mathis and Head Brewer Andy Armstrong, American River Brewing Company encompasses the life-long passions of beer and the art/science of brewing.    Plans for the brewery began in 2010. After more than 15 years in the commercial brewing industry, we embarked on locating a useable location to house a production level brewery that would include a tasting room and space to grow. After an exhaustive search a home was found and construction began in the summer of 2011.    The original scope called for a modest 7 bbl brew house with tanks enough to manage 2000 bbl of production per year. After much re-thinking and soul-searching the brewery was increased in size to 15 bbl and room to grow to 10,000 bbls production per year. By October 2011, we started to formulate the first recipes.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm  Wednesday-Friday 4:00pm - 8:00pm

name: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company
description: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company where we are passionate about making beer and work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a very small manufacturing brewery located in Grant County, just north and west of Quincy, Washington. Founded in August, 2010 by three families from the Quincy area, the Ancient Lakes Brewing Company currently has one brewer.    Our 2/3 barrel brewhouse produces small batches of beer that take about three weeks from brew-day to packaging-day. We hand-fill our Cornelius and 1/6 bbl kegs and hand-bottle/hand-pack each case of 22 ounce bottles.

name: Andean Brewing Company, Inc.
description: Imagine a place where ancient knowledge meets modern concepts, where tradition meets the distinct, a place where two elements fuse as one, a place so exhilarating it escapes the imagination. This union is only possible because of the long-standing tradition of the Andean people committing themselves to the Pachamama - Mother Earth.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm  Fridays: 4:00 - 7:00 pm

name: Armadillo Ale Works
description: Our mission is to give Denton, TX fresh, handcrafted beers that are as unique as it is. We believe that bigger is not necessarily better, and good things come in small packages: like babies, puppies, and kittens. We believe our beer should be no different. By staying small, we’ll be able to devote the time, care, and love to each beer.

name: Ass Kisser Ales
description: Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA.     The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit.     Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!

name: Bad Ass Brewery
description: My name is Matt I have been home brewing for 23 plus years.  A friend of mine Allen O’Brien introduced me to “real” beer when I tried to offer him a Keystone.  I’ve been hooked on making and drinking real beer ever since.  My wife enrolled me in a home brewing class in Durango Colorado.  Over the past 23 years I have only made three bad beers out of thousands of batches.  I ended 26 years of the construction trades February of 2010 to fulfill my dream of opening a micro brewery.  Welcome to BAB short for Bad Ass Brewery.  My beers are hand crafted personal recipes sometimes extreme gravity.  I invite you to come on out and sample some of my latest creations.  No less than 20 beers on tap from Girly Pale, fruited beers to award winning stouts and over the top barley wines.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 10:30pm Tue:  4:00pm - 10:30pm Wed:  4:00pm - 10:30pm Thu:  4:00pm - 10:30pm Sat:  3:00pm - 12:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Monday - Thursday  4pm - 10:30pm  Friday and Saturday 3pm - 12am  Sunday 12pm - 8pm Fill Growlers for Football  Thursday Football Nights $3 Regular Pints  (Closing Hours Subject to Change According to Flow of Business)

name: Baranof Island Brewing Company
description: Baranof Island Brewing Co. is owned, operated, sampled and sold by Sitkan beer lovers, Rick and Suzan. When they opened the brewery in 2010, enthusiastic townspeople drank up the supply so quickly, they immediately had to ramp up the capacity of their operations.  Now that they can keep the thirsty locals satisfied (look for BIBCo. on tap at local restaurants), they are ready to share with you their passion for really good hand-crafted beer.    Brew nerds will appreciate that every unfiltered 55-gallon batch is a combination of pure, glacier-fed Alaskan water and a blend of gourmet malts and hops, lovingly selected by master brewer, Sam.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Barhop Brewing
description: Barhop Brewing: Like many native Californians, Tom struggled with the all the rain in the northwest until he figured out what to do with it: start fermenting it! And so Barhop Brewing was born. On brew days, you can hear Tom brewing to the tunes of Pearl Jam, Bob Marley, The Grateful Dead, Led Zepplin, and so on. Tom’s California beer-drinking youth provided him with a strong affinity for the pioneers of micro-brewing, back when Sierra Nevada, Pete’s Wicked, and Mendocino Brewing were small craft brewers. Decades of drinking beer – and specifically micro-brews – have contributed to Tom’s brewing pedigree. (Or so he says.) Currently he is a big fan of Elysian and Russian River Brewing, and these companies have influenced his brewing style which he calls “aggressive California-style ales, with a Northwest twist, using fresh Northwest ingredients”.

name: Barley and Vine Brewery
description: Since 2003, family and friends have come to know that initials on the bottle caps along with names of classic cars designate beers from the Barley and Vine Brewery.   Barley and Vine is becoming known for great quality ales, and at times going to extremes to provide the very best in beer.    From the first batch of beer, Rambler Red, brewing was destined for the garage or outdoors because of the huge mess and bad smell made in the kitchen. So, for the first four years Barley and Vine was making 5-gallon extract batches.  Barley and Vine began sharing the beers with friends and family looking for input and making corrections and changes when needed.  As time went by the brewing skill level and quality of the beer continued to improve.   Changing from 5-gallon extract batched to 10 gallon all-grain batches made a huge difference in the quality of the final product.    Barley and Vine is a nano brewery in the planning.  As we continue to build our business plan, determine a location, and perfect our recipes and processes we will do our best to keep people up to speed through this website, Facebook, and our blog.  The ultimate dream is to have a brewery and a brewpub.

name: Barrage Brewing Company
description: Barrage Brewing Company is a 1 BBL capacity Brewery, but soon to become a 3 BBL Brewery. The Brewery was Started in 2010 with it's roots in Nassau County. Distribution will only be through out the Long Island and Manhattan areas.     Quality Brewed Craft Beers for the common person as well as the Beer Connoisseur.

name: Beach Brewing Company
description: We are a craft brewery, located in sunny Virginia Beach, Virginia. When we say 'craft', we don't just mean small; we mean our beer is made with great care, using only the purest ingredients and smartest techniques. We don't just aim to create beers that satisfy, but rather to craft brews that inspire. We love what we do and that passion is inherent in every ounce of what flows out of our brewhouse.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun:	1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Bellevue Brewing Company
description: Bellevue's first production brewery specializing in small-batch, handcrafted ales and lagers! We will be utilizing a 20BBL brewhouse with 160BBLs of fermentation capacity.    Although we don't intend to be an organic brewery, we will use organic ingredients whenever possible and, once food service begins, our menu items will feature organic ingredients as well. A children's menu will also be offered.    Our goal is to showcase the wonderful flavors of Washington with local food and brewing ingredients...keeping it local is good business!    We'll also feature a new Washington State wine each month and provide two guest taps for our craft brewing colleagues to showcase their beers.

name: Benny Brewing Co.
description: Providing great quality hand crafted ales and lagers to the surrounding area.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Tuesday  Closed  Wednesday:  3:00 PM-  7:00 PM     Thursday: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM  Friday: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM  Saturday: 1:00 PM - 7:00 PM        Sunday: 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM

name: BierWerks Brewery
description: German Style Brewpub with a great outdoor patio.  Always the place to stop on the way back from a day of skiing.

name: Big Beaver Brewing Company
