description: We are committed to brewing the best beer possible following the Germany purity law which states only water, malted barley, hops, and yeast can be used to make beer. To ensure maximum flavor, our beers are never filtered or pasturized.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Black Acre Brewing Company
description: Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.    Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:	4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri:	4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: Black Couch Brewery
description: The concept for Black Couch Brewery was developed in late 2008 by three close friends, William Cook, Travis Morgan, and Dave Svec. After sampling one of the earliest batches of our flagship product, American Homecoming Pale Ale, we realized very quickly that it tasted better than even the most popular beer brands available in the regional marketplace. We were sure that others would enjoy our beer, and the positive responses from tasters everywhere have reinforced our belief in the quality and taste. We are committed to developing unique and flavorful beers, using the finest ingredients available. We are currently in the planning stages of the brewery and hope to have it up and running in the Washington D.C. area in late 2010 or early 2011.

name: Blatant Brewery
description: Blatant beers are exceptional. That much is clear from the taste alone.   Here’s what makes us world class:    Blatant beers are forceful, but never forced.   These beers are dynamic and creative.   We work with the brew on its own terms, nurturing and developing its unique personality.   Anybody can throw together an average brew.   Only a true artisan can craft a flavorful and vibrant drinking experience.   No shortcuts. We pay extra attention to what goes in.   We smell, taste and study each of our choice ingredients.   Our brews are born of passion.   Obviously, a love of brewing is the first ingredient in a brew worth loving.     Blatant is new. We aren’t.   We have been in the brewing business for many years—this experience, time and energy spent has earned us a reputation as talented brewers and true artisans.     Yes, our beers are handcrafted.   Yes, we are brew artisans.   And yes, we've got well over 20 years experience in every keg, bottle, and can. But let’s face it: In the end, all that matters is the taste.     Be Blatant!

name: Blue Pants Brewery
description: Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can.     The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room Hours  Thursday 3-8pm  Friday 3-10pm  Saturday 3-10pm

name: Blue Republic Brewing
description: Blue Republic Brewing Company is a production brewery located in Shelby County, Indiana.    The brewery is currently in 'start-up' mode, but hopes to be operational in the near future. You can follow our progress here as we take the long journey to that first drop of pure deliciousness. And you know it will be something hoppy!!!

name: BBC 3rd and Main
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11 AM – Midnight  Friday - Saturday: 11 AM – 1 AM  Sunday: Noon – 9PM

name: Bonfire Brewing
description: Based in one of the coolest mountain towns of Colorado, Eagle, Bonfire Brewing makes beer (by "coolest" we mean, "neat," "nifty," and/or "fantabulous," not cold. It's actually fairly warm for the most part). We wouldn't describe our beer as face-meltingly good, maybe just face-warmingly delicious. It certainly encourages the use of non-existent adverbs. We started making beer because we needed more friends. Now our friends need more beer. So it goes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Tue:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Wed:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 12:00am Sat:  4:00pm - 12:00am Sun:  3:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Wed: 5:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu:4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Bosque Brewing
description: Bosque Brewing Co. has a very simple core value system. Brew beer with flavor and craftsmanship... Three home brewers with an affinity for crafting quality ales and crazy enough to wade into the business of their passion.

name: Brainerd Lakes Beer
description: Brainerd Lakes Beer. Giving you a taste of the laidback lifestyle found only in Minnesota's lake country. It has long been said that a beer is only as good as the place it was born. (Okay, so we made that up...but that doesn't make it any less true.) So we (and by we, we mean a couple of local guys) set out to create a Minnesota beer that embodies the laidback lifestyle of one of the greatest places on earth. We want this page to be all about you. We welcome your input, thoughts, feelings, tips on fishing hotspots...whatever you feel inclined to share and discuss. Talk to us about beer, Minnesota beer, Brainerd beer, beer making, beer brewing, IPA, wheat beer, lager, stout (can you tell we like to talk shop?) or anything else that comes to mind.

name: Breakside Brewery
description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: 12-10ish  Monday: 3-10ish  Tuesday: 3-10ish  Wednesday: 3-10ish  Thursday: 3-10ish  Friday: 12-11ish  Saturday: 12-11ish

name: Brewery Vivant
description: Brewery Vivant is the realization of years of dreaming and much discussion of what a great brewery can be. What makes our brewery different from the rest is the way we approach our craft and operate our business. The core of Brewery Vivant can be found at the crossroads of three passions:    1. Our love of the tradition and artistic approach of the Belgian & French styles of beers    2. Devotion to using local sources for ingredients and running our business according to the three pillars of sustainability; Environmental Integrity, Social Equity, and Economic Viability    3. Sharing the experience of how beer and food can be paired to uplift the enjoyment of both

name: Bridge Brew Works
description: Ken Linch and Nathan Herrold founded Bridge Brew Works to bring quality craft brewed beer to restaurants and pubs in West Virginia and beyond. They have 32 years of combined experience in home and commercial brewing and enjoy creating full flavored beers that honor tradition.    We have a goal to make a lasting connection with everyone in West Virginia who enjoys craft brewed beer.

name: Broad Brook Brewing
description: Founded in September 2010, Broad Brook Brewing is a new micro-brewery located in East Windsr, Connecticut. By hand crafting our beer, using the finest ingredients available, we produce well balanced, high quality ales with a focus on drinkability.    Along with our award-winning lineup, we continue to develop new recipes on our 15 barrel system.
hoursOfOperation: Wed: 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Burnside Brewing Co
description: Burnside Brewing Co is a production brewery & pub located in the central East side of Portland. Founded in 2010 Burnside is a creation of years of experience in the fermented beverage arts. Look for Burnside Brews to be available around Portland in early 2011 at your favorite beerstablishment or at our rustic pub. We're bringing Brewing back to Burnside!

name: Burnt Hickory Brewery
description: Small package brewery located in NW Atlanta. We are in the development stages. Building recipes, working on brands... and getting out there with a deliverable "hype".  Brewing is a great craft. We love doing it... coming up with the best beers. Lovers of craft beer for over 25 years, We know good beer when we see feel and taste it. Taking that philosophy into mind when designing recipes, brewing beer,picking styles and brands, We are very proud of what we are doing.    We believe in a regional base with a national eye. Our brewery is named for a road that goes right thru the nearby Kennesaw Mountain Civil War battlefield. Head of the BHB, Scott Hedeen, was a mass comm major at Towson State in MD with a history minor. Lover of the Civil War, Scott decided to come up with beers with stories. Stories not based on "who was who's" side... but more of the drama,the guts and the lifestyle of the soldiers on both sides. Not to make someone feel as though they are getting whopped over the head with history and facts... the beers...such as "Old Wooden Head" (our Imperial IPA... named for Confederate General John Bell Hood...who was a principal player in the battle.. and nicknamed that by this troops for his tenacity)... are made more for the spirit and the feel of the time...mixed with a modern cool feel.

name: Butcher's Brewing Company
description: Butcher's Brewing™, located in Barrio Logan near the Padres ballpark and trendy East Village, is scheduled to open in September, 2010. We are focused on our own unique interpretation of historical styles as well as creating innovative new styles such as our Hawaiian Style Pale Ale. Butcher's™ beer will be available locally through regional distribution and internationally in Japan, and will also develop proprietary brands for SoCal based restaurants and pubs. As an independent local brewer we are committed to innovation, involvement with our community and the integrity and independence of our products.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday 4-9 PM  Monday Closed  Tuesday 4-9 PM  Wednesday 4-9 PM  Thursday 4-9 PM  Friday 2-10 PM  Saturday 2-10 PM

name: Chameleon Brewing
description: With the start of a new decade, beer lovers are demanding something new. Not another new flavor of a mass-produced, foreign-owned beer, but something local that is new and exciting. That is why Chameleon Brewing is here.    Chameleon was founded by Randy Sprecher of Sprecher Brewing, a local company that Milwaukeeans have grown to know and love for 25 years. Just like Sprecher, Chameleon Brewing supports the local economy and recognizes that innovative American brewing styles are now setting the bar in the international beer world. Chameleon is a company focused on taking brewing to the next level by producing beers that are guaranteed to impress the savviest critic, yet also appealing to a widely diverse group of beer drinkers. Our brews are light bodied and refreshing, complimented by a fine balance of complex flavors and aromas.    Staying true to this principle, Chameleon would like to introduce its flagship beer – Hop On Top extra-pale ale. This aromatic non-bitter brew features a complex bouquet of dried flowers and hops. Easy to drink, Hop on Top has a toasty pale malt finish.

name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 5:00pm  Growler Hours  Thursdays: 5PM - 8PM  Fridays: 5PM - 8PM  Saturdays 2PM - 5PM

name: Chick Brewing Co.
description: Chick Beer is America's beer for women!    Chick Beer is a premium craft-brewed light lager that tastes like a full-bodied lager, yet has just 97 calories and 3.5 carbs per bottle, about the same as half of a carrot.

name: Cismontane Brewing
description: Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.    The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.    The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.    (cis-mon-tane)    “This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Tue:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 5:00pm  Mon - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Clown Shoes Beer
description: Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.    Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

name: Core Brewing Company
description: Every great community needs a local flavor and Core Brewing & Distilling Company is out to be Arkansas’ hometown beer. Our brews are big and innovative rooted in tradition.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: Closed  Tue-Friday: 3-9  Sat-Sun: 1-9

name: Cosmic Frog Handcrafted Ales
description: Nanobrewery in Buffalo NY currently in the licensing phase of start up. We look forward to serving handcrafted ales that we feel are both creative and a solid contribution to the craft beer renaissance.     To enhance the culture of craft beer and quality of life of our community and customers by providing handcrafted, artisan ales created with thought, passion and attention to detail provided in an atmosphere that aspires to create mutual engagement.

name: Crazy Mountain Brewing
description: Crazy Mountain Brewing Company was founded in January 2010 by Kevin and Marisa Selvy in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.  After a chance meeting in the Anchor Brewing Tasting Room, Kevin and Marisa decided to follow their crazy dreams and move to Colorado, Kevin's home state, and brew.  With a combined passion for craft beer, Kevin and Marisa founded the Vail Valley’s first production brewery.  Crazy Mountain was built with love from the ground up in a gutted warehouse, shipping in tanks and equipment from around the globe. Their first beer was poured at a beer festival in Vail in January 2010.  Using the highest quality ingredients, Crazy Mountain handcrafts each brew for beer enthusiasts across the United States, Japan, Hong Kong, and Sweden.  We say crazy is as crazy does, so drink up and live the life you want!

name: Barrel Cellar & Taproom
description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 4:00pm - 8:00pm  Sat: 12:00noon - 8:00pm

name: Brewery & Restaurant
description: If you could be doing whatever you want right now, what would you be doing? For Ken Landin and Janine Bennett the answer to that question would always be "listening to live music and drinking craft beer." Fueled by their outrage over the political and corporate disaster that unfolded on the nightly news, and frustrated by the thought that their lifestyle may contribute to the problem, they were at a crossroads. And so began the plan for Crossroads Brewing Company.     There was many years of discussion, research, paperwork, rejection, and searching for the perfect property.  After having deals fall through and the economy taking a turn for the worse, their hopes were fading. Then, in December of 2008, the Brooks Opera House in Historic Athens was discovered by accident. After leaving a restaurant just 2 miles from home they noticed a for sale sign on the deteriorating building and it's just like the old saying goes............when you know, you know.     It was quickly realized that when a community believes in what you are doing and puts it's support behind you, great things can happen. So they were off and running from the first turn of the key. Restoring a Historic Opera House from 1893 was not part of the original plan but with hard work and their secret weapon, Janine's brother Jimmy, things are coming together. Ken, Janine, Jimmy and Janine's Dad, Jim, have had their hands on just about every square inch of this 15,000 square foot building. Little by little, this grand and unique property will be restored to it's former glory.      Everyday seems to bring a new challenge but the ultimate goal remains clear. This building was once the hub of this sleepy riverside village and Ken and Janine intend to return it to the community. The second floor, where the Opera House once was, will get a new stage for plays and musical performances of all kinds. Athens is surrounded by hard working farmers so looking any further for meats and produce just doesn't make sense.  From organic menu items to earth friendly building materials the environment is a factor in every decision that is made along the way. They hope to eventually have the brewery running "off the grid" as well.     Ken, Janine, Brewer Hutch Kugeman and Chef Paul Parillo invite you to come visit the pub in Athens, NY.  There's 10 craft beers on tap and a menu that showcases the small farms of the Hudson Valley.   Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon, Wed & Thurs.: 4:00 pm-9:00 pm  Friday: 4:00 pm-12:00 am  Saturday: 1:00 pm-12:00 am  Sunday: 1:00 pm-9:00 pm  Closed Tuesdays

name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co
description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.

name: Draper Brewing

The original Draper brews were done on a one barrel system which has since been replaced by a 5 bbl system. All current brews are fermented in an open primary fermentor in old world tradition. All bottled beers are naturally carbonated by means of a secondary fermentation in the bottle. Every bottle is  sanitized, filled, capped and  packaged by hand.

name: Dry County Brewing Company
description: Hand tossed pizza and hand crafted beer. What could be finer?
hoursOfOperation: Wed/Thur/Sun  4-9 pm    Fri/Sat  Noon-9 pm

name: Eola Beer Company
description: Welcome to Eola Beer Company! We are located in the mountains of North Carolina in the beautiful and artistic city of Lenoir. Eola Beer Company features handcrafted artisanal beers made with local ingredients of the highest quality using malted barley, fresh whole cone hops, Appalachian Mountain waters and fresh cultured yeast. All Natural, Organic Beer with No additives, No extracts, and no shortcuts to provide you with the finest, freshest beer . We are also a Gastropub , Chef Stephen Loe uses local and seasonal ingredients to create an ever-changing menu of exciting , flavorful dishes from around the world. Influenced by many chefs, and culinary styles Loe focuses on Southern American, French, Cajun -Creole, and Indian. Stephen Loe has won many awards for his cooking and beers and is a graduate of the prestigious Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park NY. He has worked at many fine restaurants in New York , Emerils, Sonoma California Bistro, Barringtons, and Artisanal before starting his own. Eola is a great mountain destination with great food, great beer, souvenirs,gifts,live music and a fun , friendly atmosphere with outdoor seating in the historic downtown area. Please come make Eola your North Carolina Mountain tradition! Cheers

name: Equinox Brewing Company
description: The most common question we get is, why Equinox Brewing? The equinox, and the intrigue of equal night and day, has deep roots in history and ritual. But, at the same time, the equinox marks the changing of the season, and forces us to look toward the future. We find it interesting that the two days out of the year that have perfect light and dark balance also show the balance between the past and the future, tradition and innovation. Beer contains similar elements. Sure, there’s the balance of flavors in a beer; sweet and bitter, rich and simple…    We find another aspect of beer’s balancing act fascinating. Historically, beer styles have developed because of limitations in local ingredients and the necessity to make do with what you have. However, due to global trade and modern shipping methods, limitations on ingredients have been removed. We can get any ingredients we want. While most modern brewers recognize the importance of beer styles and learn from the brewers who made them, they certainly don’t limit themselves to making beers that fit into traditional definitions.    On one level our beers fit into some traditional styles, but we put our own twist on them. We want our beers to capture elements from the past and incorporate new ideas, ingredients and techniques into them. We’re not afraid to try new things.    As a brewer, its playtime and work, balanced.

name: Evil Genius Beer Company
description: The Evil Genius Brewing Company is an Independent Craft Brewery located in Pennsylvania, owned by Luke Bowen, Trevor Hayward, and Mark Braunwarth. We are committed to making great beers which anyone can enjoy. Each beer is designed by Mark, our Master Brewer, using the highest quality ingredients and locally sourced water to ensure that you, our customer, will experience the same great taste over and over again. Our company is committed to supporting the local craft brewing movement in the tri-state region.

name: Fairport Brewing Company
description: We're a small brewery providing hand-crafted beer in small batches. We sell our variety of beer in growlers from our brewery in Fairport, NY.    We're located in the business park at 1000 Turk Hill Road, right on the historic Erie Canal. After you enter the business park, drive past the buildings and park in the lot in the back. Walk back between the buildings, and look for Building 8 on the right. Use the “Classroom Entrance” and take the stairs or elevator on your left. You’ll find us on the second floor down the hall and to the right.

description: Regional Craft Brewery and Tasting Room.  Central Coast Brewery based in the Santa Ynez Valley. Capturing the essence and taste buds of the region.

name: Flat Tail Brewing Co
description: Started in 2010 in Corvallis, OR, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Flat Tail Brewing started with a small 6 barrel system. 4 years later Brewer/Owner Dave Marliave is creating some of the best beers in Oregon.  From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 11am - 11pm

name: Flat12 Bierwerks
description: Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety.     Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.
hoursOfOperation: THURS 4 pm – 7 pm  FRI Noon – 8 pm  SAT Noon – 6 pm  SUN Noon – 4 pm

name: Florida Avenue Ales
description: Brews that can be enjoyed rain or shine...from hot summer months to mild winters on the beach....  During hurricane season we bring the party...no matter what walk of life or Noreaster that brought you to the Sunshine State...once it hits your lips all you can think is: "Gotta Have A Florida Ave"©

name: Foggy Noggin Brewing
description: We are brewers of great English Styled Ales on a very small 1/2 BBL system. We are one of the world’s smallest production breweries. We take great pride in every batch to bring you consistent high quality brews year-round. You are able to get our fresh beers at our tasting room, located at our brewery in Bothell, WA and at several accounts that rotate our beers thru their line-up.
hoursOfOperation: Most Saturdays 1-4pm

name: Founding Fathers Brewing Company
description: Did you know that the best selling beers in America are produced by foreign-owned companies?    As Americans we believe the values and ideas that motivated our Founding Fathers are worth conserving.    By developing a brand name that is associated with these same principles and beliefs, Americans will be able to pave the direction of our great Country with the purchase of the New American beer, Founding Fathers Lager and Light.    50% of all profits will be donated back to the families of our troops. Better Beer, Better Cause.    When you see a Founding Fathers label in your local grocery or watering hole, you will associate it with the level of excellence that has made America the greatest Country in the World.

name: Four Horsemen Brewing Company
description: Micro-Brewery producing handcrafted Ales and Lagers. Four Horsemen Brewing Company offers a tasting room opened to the public weekly on limited hours/days.
hoursOfOperation: Friday & Saturday: 4PM - 11PM

name: Fullsteam Brewery
description: Fullsteam is a Durham, North Carolina brewery inspired by the agricultural and culinary traditions of the South.    Our mission is to craft a distinctly Southern beer style using local farmed goods, heirloom grains, and Southern botanicals. Like what, you wonder? We're making beer with sweet potatoes, corn grits, summer basil, and malted barley house-smoked over hickory. Other successful "plow to pint" experiments to-date include beer brewed with scuppernong grapes, persimmon, paw paw, rhubarb and more.     Ultimately, our vision is to craft a year-round, sustainable, scalable, and distinctly Southern beer brewed 100% with local ingredients. That's the quest. We're a long ways from realizing this vision, but we hope you enjoy the adventure as much as we expect to. Interested? Read more about Southern-style beer.
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY: 4pm to 10pm  TUES, WED, THURS: 4pm to 12am  FRIDAY: 4pm to 2am  SATURDAY: 12pm to 2am  SUNDAY: 12pm to 10pm

name: Good Nature Brewing, Inc.
description: GNB is a startup nanobrewery located in Hamilton, NY. We handcraft fine-quality ales made from local hops and other fresh ingredients. Check out our website and our Brew Blog! www.goodnaturebrewing.com

name: Good Vibes Brew
description: Good Vibes Brew is a local micro brewery locally owned and operated in Carolina Beach, North Carolina.

name: GoodLife Brewing
description: Located on Bend's Westside. We take our name from the lifestyle that most Bend-ites live. With tons of recreation, sprinkled with hard work and friends make living in Bend truly the GoodLife. The 30 Barrel Brewhouse and fermentation area are the focal point of the huge viewing windows looking out from within the Bier Hall (our Tasting Room) where you can grab a pint of not only our delicious brew but some of our favorite breweries as well. With 5-7 rotating guest taps you’re sure to find a brew to make your GoodLife. Hope to see you for a pint soon ~ Cheers
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sun: 11:00am-10:00pm

name: Granite Mountain Brewing
description: Granite Mountain Brewing is what happened when two couples - the Stangersons (Michael Stanger and Amanda Richardson) and the Swaffamotos (Damon Swafford and Audra Yamamoto) - got together (perhaps all-too-frequently) to enjoy good food and Michael's homebrew. Our shared love of food and beer propelled us to start an underground beer tasting movement during which we hosted a series of 7 beer tasting events over the course of a 13 months. We may be the new kids on the Prescott scene, but GMB brings ten years of brewing experience to the table. From the farmlands of Vermont to the mountains of Alaska; the homelands of Idaho and now the high deserts of Prescott!     GMB opened the doors on the brewery and taproom in August 2012. By small operation, we mean SMALL. Not micro. We're talking about nanobrewing here, folks. We're a grassroots endeavor that began in a garage and garnered fast support from the community.     We pride ourselves on high-quality unpretentious beer. We like to brew traditional styles as well as creative twists on the traditional. Inspired by the local landscape and community, we look forward to experimenting with local ingredients (wheat berries, juniper berries, prickly pear fruit) and becoming part of the local flavor of Prescott. Beer education is part of what we do: styles, processes, ingredients, and the magical pairing between beer and food. Why? Because this is all part of celebrating the simpler things in life: good food, good friends, good beer.

We have a kids menu with lots of goodies and hand crafted Root Beer and Orange Cream Soda.Get Brewed!

The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation.

Our tasting room overlooks our craft brewery where our head brewer, Dean Priebe has masterfully combined the pristine waters of the Icicle River with only the freshest ingredients to craft fresh and flavorful ales and lagers for your enjoyment.

name: Idle Hands Craft Ales
description: Based in Everett, Massachusetts, Idle Hands Craft Ales is the Boston area’s only nanobrewery.  We hand craft our beer with a nod towards belgian styles mixed with new world ideas. Founded in 2010, we recently received our federal license only days before the new year and are currently planning to produce our first commercial beers by late Winter/early Spring 2011.

name: Indian Joe Brewing, Inc.
description: Welcome to Indian Joe Brewing. We are a taste experience pushing the boundaries of flavor and limitations on our beer. We brew a variety of handcrafted beverages such as Ales, Witbiers, Stouts and Hefeweizens. We are continuously changing our line up. So, stop on by and check us out!

name: Iron Fist Brewing Company
description: Iron Fist Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in Vista, California, smack-dab in the middle of the exciting San Diego craft beer scene. Our passion for the best hand crafted beer prompted us to make a lot of it. However, we quickly realized we were making a bit more than we could drink ourselves, so we decided to sell whatever we don't drink to you. So do yourself a favor; start a little revolution. It's ok. We won't tell on you. Put the 500 pack of light lager back with all its buddies and rule your taste with an Iron Fist!

name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
description: La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.     The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.     Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.     Well, this is the beer he drinks.     And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Lexington Avenue Brewery
description: Good times await in Asheville at the Lexington Avenue Brewery. Relax a while on our open air patio. Enjoy a craft beer and an incredible meal at the 92’ curving bar or a custom built dining table. Our historic downtown Asheville building provides the perfect atmosphere. The front stage regularly entertains LAB guests during dinner hours.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	11:30 am - 12:00 am  Wed - Sat:	11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Hickory
description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer.  Cheers- The Loe's Brewing Team
hoursOfOperation: Our taproom hours will be Fri, Sat, Sun  2pm -10pm.  Longer hours available on request.

name: Low Brau
description: Low Brau LLC is a Washington, DC based nano brewery created by Steven Sorrell in response to the current American Craftbrewing atmosphere. After visting breweries around the world, Steven noticed a lack of crisp refreshing session style beers brewed here in the US, so in 2010, the seeds of Low Brau were planted.     With a background in the food industry and many years of beer research, it was only natural for Steven to start brewing at home, and wasn't long before he started creating his own recipes. Now a year later, Low Brau continues to move forward, with plans to open it's doors within the District in the next year.     Low Brau's beers are German inspired, following the guidelines set fourth by the Rheinheitsgebot Purity Law and high quality ingredients. Each beer is hand crafted and brewed in small batches to maintain quality over quantity.     Low Brau strongly believes in "Embracing Simplicity".

name: Brewery & Restaurant
description: Mad Fox Brewing Company offers a dining experience unique to the Washington, DC, area: upscale casual dining in an English-style gastro brewpub with an emphasis on high-quality food to complement our house-brewed beers.    Mad Fox features a chef-driven, seasonal menu and frequent specials including pizza, panini, salads and vegetarian friendly foods; fresh, locally grown seasonal produce, cheeses and other ingredients; locally raised lamb, bison, beef, chicken and game; and house-cured meats.    Mad Fox has a 63-foot long bar showcasing our seven to ten standard, house-brewed beers on tap as well as a rotating selection of seasonal brews in German, English, Belgian and American styles. Also, don’t miss our cask conditioned proper Real Ales served through water jacketed Angram beer engines, ensuring that every pint is served at properly conditioned cellar temperatures.
hoursOfOperation: 11am - 11pm, Monday - Wednesday  11am - Midnight, Thursday - Saturday  10am - 11pm, Sunday, Brunch 10am-3pm

name: Mankato Brewery
description: Our goal is to bring craft brewing to Mankato Minnesota. Brewing great beer consistently and with the highest quality. Our plans are to have the brewery ready for production in the fall of 2011.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 7:00pm

name: Millking It Productions
description: MillKing It Productions (a.k.a…MIP) was founded in 2010 with a singular mission: To strip down all pretensions and preconceived notions of the craft brewing industry and create a truly memorable and focused catalog of fine beers. MIP does not have a sampling room or bar. We brew a limited number of stylistically and historically accurate beers. We will not jump from marketing wave to wave. We will not brew unbalanced fad beers. We will never put fruit, vegetables or other gimmicks into our beer. Finally, all beers will be packaged in draft, cask and what we see as the most responsible and best individual container…Aluminum Cans.

name: Mimbres Valley Brewing Company
description: Our beers are all hand-crafted and have a unique personality to them that sets Mimbres Valley apart from other breweries. We use hops from all over the world and take great care in our selection of hops and grains.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Mother Earth Brewing Company
description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..

name: Nantahala Brewing Company
description: Nantahala Brewing Company is a microbrewery that was founded in Bryson City, Western North Carolina’s outdoor adventure capital, in the spring of 2009.  We officially started selling beer in May 2010.  If you are in the area, stop by and check out our progress.
hoursOfOperation: 2011 Summer Tap Room Hours: (Memorial Day – Labor Day)  Tuesday – Saturday: Noon  – 10:00pm  Sunday: Noon – 8 pm    2011 Fall Tap Room Hours: (Labor Day thru October)  Thursday & Friday: 4 pm – 10 pm  Saturday & Sunday: Noon – 10 pm  Monday: 4 pm – 10 pm    2011 Winter Tap Room Hours: (November 2011  thru January 2012)  Thursday & Friday: 4 pm – 10 pm  Saturday: Noon – 10 pm  Sunday: Noon – 6 pm    Call for 2012 Winter and Spring Hours

name: New Boswell Brewing Company
description: The New Boswell Brewing Company started business on St. Patrick's Day, 2010. The brewery, owned by Rodrick and Kiera Landess began as a project at the IU East Center for Entrepreneurship. While majoring in Fine Arts at IU East Rodrick took classes in the Business Department studying Entrepreneurship and participated in Students in Free Enterprise. After completing his degree, the project took on a life of its own, slowly inching its way towards becoming a reality. In 2010, with the help of a matching funds grant from the Eastern Indiana Regional Workforce Board and the GrowthStart Project, New Boswell Brewing Company was able to purchase the required equipment to begin operations and work towards becoming a functional brewery. After a couple of months of practice and creating procedures, New Boswell hosted their Grand Opening at the 4th Floor Blues Club.
hoursOfOperation: Tues-Thurs: 3pm-12am  Fri-Sat: 12pm-1am  Sun: 12pm-8pm

name: New Republic Brewing Company
description: An Aggie owned & operated nanobrewery. Distributing to Bryan & College Station.

name: No Label Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to create exceptional hand-crafted Ales and Lagers that are unique to Katy and Texas.    We are a family owned and operated brewery in Katy, TX. Our roots are from Panama, Texas and Philly. Our family heritage is also very different. We have Germans, Czechs and Panamanians in the bunch. So to say all four owners are different is an understatement.
hoursOfOperation: We offer Saturday tastings from 1pm-3pm every Saturday but the first Saturday of the month. You must bring your ID.

name: North Sound Brewing Co
description: Like many small brewery owner's, Kurt Ahrens started as a homebrewer. He enjoyed brewing a variety of fresh, flavorful and unique beers and he loved sharing them with friends and family who liked the beer so much they encouraged Kurt to start his own brewery. Kurt had a day job in the insurance business but started to dream of someday opening his own commercial brewery. After years of resisting the temptation, he finally succumbed (with support from his wife, Lori) by buying a building in 2009. Previously owned brewing equipment was acquired in July 2009 in Anaconda, Montana and moved to the Mount Vernon location. Building permits were finally obtained and brewery construction began in October 2009. Federal and state brewery licenses applications were submitted March 1, 2010 and approved by July 2010.  Brewing operations commenced later that month and on August 27, 2010 the first kegs of North Sound Brewing Co. ales were sold to local pubs in Mount Vernon, WA. A week later on September 3, 2010 the tasting room at the brewery was opened and Kurt's dream had become a reality!

name: Notch Brewing
description: There is a myth born of the craft beer movement that flavorful beer is synonymous with high alcohol. The art of brewing great beer in the US without a debilitating ABV had seemed all but dead. Not anymore. Myths are simply myths, and beers of great flavor and quality have been brewed for hundreds of years in every great brewing nation except ours. Chris is not out to change the US craft beer world, but to simply brew the beers he loves to drink, and he thinks he is not alone.    Chris has been brewing professionally since 1993, first as an apprentice at Kennebunkport Brewing, then at the Tremont Brewery in Boston MA starting in 1994. Today, Chris is an independent brewer – he owns no facility – instead brewing and collaborating with other breweries. He currently brews his beers at two locations, the Ipswich Ale Brewery (Bottles & Draft) and Kennebunkport Brewery (Cask).

name: Odd Side Ales
description: ?Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Old Bisbee Brewing Company
description: Serving up seven premium craft beers in a comfortable atmosphere. By the pint or by the growler (to go), we have a beer for every palate!    Bring the kids! We serve natural artisan sodas, sure to please.    We are dog friendly, so bring your well-behaved, furry best friend along.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 12:00 pm - 10:30 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:30 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:30 pm

name: Old Black Bear Brewing Company
description: Our decision to start brewing beer and sharing it with the public came from our desire to create a great beer that real people can not only enjoy, but also relate to. Some beer companies try to market their beer as being able to bring you a life of leisure; others may try to convince you that higher alcohol content automatically means better beer; others may simply try to sell you beer of poor quality and claim, "It's a craft beer." People know better than that, and our goal is to make great beer and sell it at a fair price without using silly marketing gimmicks.    Old Black Bear is not able to bring you a carefree life. If we could, we are undercharging for our product. However, what we can do is this: Provide you with a beverage that you can enjoy with your friends after a hardworking day, and assure you that every Old Black Bear Beer you drink will be of the highest quality and offer you drinkability and refreshment that is unmatched by any other small craft brewery ~ a real life beer you deserve.

name: Ore Dock Brewing Company
description: As a microbrewery, our focus is on providing a wide variety of beer styles in addition to fostering the local interest in the brewing of craft beer. We consider brewing to be a craft and, whether you are brewing in your garage or on a huge production system, brewing a good beer and sharing it with others is a great way to bring together friends or even an entire community. We are proud to live in a town that is currently supporting two brewpubs and a nanobrewery, and look forward to doing our part to be a leader in the craft brewing revolution.    People in the U.P. work hard, take great pride in what is produced locally and have answered the call in supporting and improving the local economy. The name "Ore Dock Brewing Company" was chosen because we see our local ore docks as grand and iconic reminders of Marquette and the U.P.'s past, present, and future identity. We hope to provide a product and establishment that our community can be proud of for many years to come!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Pacific Brewing Laboratory
description: Pac Brew Lab started in a garage as a place for Patrick and Bryan to experiment with new beer flavors, styles, and brewing techniques.  What started out as a place to share new creations with friends grew into a bi-monthly, totally free event with hundreds of our “new” friends and great local street food vendors.     Patrick and Bryan brew small batches which allows for constant beer experimentation.  They have been known to create exotic beer styles such as their Hibiscus Saison, Squid Ink Black IPA, Chamomile Ale, Lemongrass IPA, and Szechwan Peppercorn Red ale, wine soaked oak aged Brown Ale.  Pac Brew Lab is always on the lookout for new ingredients and inspirations that will help them create new and tantalizing yet pleasing and palatable beers for the public.

name: Paw Paw Brewing Company
description: Paw Paw Brewing Company set out to bring the best brew to the area possible using the best ingredients. Putting people and community above all others Paw Paw Brewing Company will strive to integrate culture and local products while developing hand crafted brews.     Paw Paw Brewing Company was established in January 2010 by brother-in-laws Ben Fleckenstein and Ryan Sylvester.

name: Pensacola Bay Brewery
description: Once upon a time, two guys who had never met, had a glass of beer.  Who knew that years later, their love of beer would bring them together.    Elliott Eckland and Mark Robertson started this journey in 2009, and in October 2010 opened the doors of the Pensacola Bay Brewery. Focusing on local Pensacola landmarks and lore, the Pensacola Bay Brewery mixes a little Florida history in each pint.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Thursday: 12:00 PM – 9:00 PM  Friday – Saturday: 12:00 PM – 11:00 PM  Sunday: 12:00 PM – 6:00 PM

name: Percival Beer Company
description: ercival Beer Company was discovered in 2010, but wasn't launched until 2012. After home brewing for over three years, we felt compelled to share our great beer with other beer drinkers and our community.  ?  Our desire was to brew and distribute quality Craft Beer Brands that can be enjoyed and appreciated by all, not just a few. In addition, we wanted to help showcase the diverse personalities of Boston. Thus, PBC set out to develop brands which directly represented  the diverse neighborhoods that make up Boston, Massachusetts. In particular, we focused our efforts at spotlighting the multi-ethnic neighborhood of Dorchester.

name: Piney River Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2010, Piney River Brewing Company is a microbrewery dedicated to making distinctive craft beers that celebrate life in the Ozarks. Joleen and Brian Durham, owners, have lived and farmed in Texas County for many years, and they have enjoyed craft beer for a long time, too.    Today, Joleen and Brian live up the hill from the Little Piney River that flows into the Big Piney.  They benefit from multiple fresh water springs and a waterfall on their farm, and they continually find themselves drawn to the rivers that flow around their farm and throughout the Ozarks.    Joleen and Brian first made beer on the kitchen stove, fermenting it in the basement of their 100-year old farm house.  In July 2010 they partnered together to revive a 70-year old barn made from red and white oak trees harvested off the farm, and Piney River Brewing Company was born.    The barn, rechristened BARn, is home to Piney River Brewing Company.  Joleen and Brian began the craft brewery as a “nanobrewery”, brewing on a 10-gallon Sabco system.  In the fall of 2011, a 7-barrel brewhouse with an automatic canning line was put in place for the microbrewery.    Insane?...No, we're having the time of our lives!

name: Ocean Beach
hoursOfOperation: Sun – Thur: 11am – 10pm  Fri - Sat: 11am - Midnight

name: Railhouse Brewery
description: Raihouse Brewery was officially founded Dec 1, 2010, in the historic town of Aberdeen, North Carolina. Started by military veterans Brian Evitts (U.S. Navy), and Mike Ratkowski (U.S. Army). They met as managers of the same company and were drawn together by the same home brewing passion to make excellent beers. Brian has been an avid home brewer for almost 15 years, while Mike has always enjoyed the culture of breweries. They both felt there was a lack of their style of beer--beer focused on the malted barley and not so focused on the hops.    Railhouse Brewery currently offers seasonal and year-round beers, including the following: Mastiff Oatmeal Stout, KA-BAR Brown Ale, FCA IPA, Vanilla Porter, Barleywine, and Pale Ale. The brewery and pub is located at 105 East South Street, Aberdeen, NC.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: 4PM to 11PM  Tuesday: 4PM to 11PM  Wednesday: 4PM to 11PM  Thursday: 11AM to 2AM  Friday: 11AM to 2AM  Saturday: 11AM to 2AM  Sunday 12PM to 12AM

name: Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling
description: Ranger Creek is a combined brewery/distillery proudly located in San Antonio, TX. We make beer and whiskey in our “brewstillery”, and we make it by hand one batch at a time with lots of love and attention. As a combined operation, we use much of the same equipment to make both our beer and our whiskey, and we can do this because there are a lot of similarities between the two processes. It’s actually a really cool process to see, and we invite you to come take a tour and learn about it for yourself.

name: Red Hare Brewing Company
description: Situated in an 11,000 sq. ft. warehouse, Red Hare Brewing Company has a 20 barrel brewhouse with a 120 barrel fermenting capacity. Making every day beer for beer fans everywhere, Red Hare’s flagship beer is Long Day Lager. Other year round Red Hare beers are Gangway IPA and Watership Brown. Keep an eye out for our Rabbit’s Reserve Series, limited edition, one-off batches that will be released four times a year.
hoursOfOperation: Our taproom is open:  Friday: 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm  Saturday 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm

name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
description: We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.    All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.    We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

name: Riley's Brewing Company
description: A bunch of guys and gals that have been brewing for years together decided to go for it.  They brew like true craft brewers on what would seem like a giant home brew system.  You can tell its all made with love and hard work.
hoursOfOperation: The Brewery is open from Monday to Thursday 7am to 5pm.

name: Rock Art Brewery
description: Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!    Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!
hoursOfOperation: 9:00 until 6:00 Monday-Saturday    TOURS: We have a wonderful viewing area upstairs and are happy to bring people up for a tour at 2:00 & 4:00 daily with a special tour at 11:00 a.m. on Saturday.     TASTINGS DAILY until 5:30

name: Roth Brewing Company
description: Founded in December of 2008, this company has been working hard to develop beers that can take the world by storm. Before there was a Roth Brewing Company, the guys started as most new breweries do, with homebrewing. After hearing endless rave reviews of their beers, they decided to jump in head first and open this amazing company. It might be said that prophecies were fulfilled on the day that they took up brewing, but only time shall tell..
hoursOfOperation: 4pm - 10pm Tuesday through Saturday, 1pm - 5pm Sunday

name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.
description: Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery which is expected to open in Fishtown, Philadelphia in 2011. Look for our beer on tap at beer bars in Philly then.

name: Slippery Pig Brewery
description: A small brewery with an outdoor tasting area specializing in odd beers. Each beer features an ingredient grown either at the brewery or from a local farmer. Best known at this time for their rhubarb IPA, stinging nettle pale, and dandelion bitter. A truly unique experience!

name: SoCal Beer Company
description: Hand crafted California beer by using quality ingredients and traditional European methods, while striving to promote health and wellness of humanity in our world.    We strive to produce top quality craft beer by using traditional European methods merged with the California flare and style; beers that Californians would be proud to call their own and to be enjoyed by all around the globe. As the core mission of our company, we also plan to contribute to local, regional, national and international organizations involved with preventive care and promotion of human health and well-being.

name: South Austin Brewery
description: South Austin Brewery was established in January of 2014. Currently South Austin Brewery has three flagship beers. We introduced the line up to the market in early May of this year  Texas Pale Ale, the state’s first Texas-style IPA is an everyday IPA. Kol’ Beer is our Kolsch style beer and quickly becoming a local favorite and go to beer for Texas craft beer drinkers. The Luckenbock is our traditional German style bock beer and is an alternative to Shiner and Zigenbock in the Texas marketplace. We will be  adding two additional beers, Six-String Saison and Crossroads Coffee Stout, to the line up in both cans and kegs.  The Saison is a Belgian-style brew and helps round out our portfolio.

name: Spiteful Brewing
description: Spiteful Brewing was founded in January 2010 by Brad Shaffer and Jason Klein. While the brewery is new, we have known each other since we were kids. It was a friendship that started instantly following a spiteful incident during a hockey game on the pond. Initially home brewing in the kitchen on a stove, we’ve slowly upgraded our system as we gained experience and understanding of the brewing process. We now have a Brew-Magic system by Sabco, which is a 13 gallon semi automated pilot brewery.     As a nanobrewery our goal is to supply a few great bars in Chicago with kegs that we will hand deliver. Our beers are made with the freshest malts, hops, and yeast purchased locally. This provides much more flavor compared to typical light beer massed produced today. We have moved into our new commercial space located just south of the Ravenswood neighborhood and have approval from the federal government. We are currently working towards our state permits.

name: Strange Craft Beer Company
description: Strange Brewing Company, opened in May of 2010, was Denver's first successful nanobrewery, brewing on a one-barrel homebrew setup. Though we have expanded to a 10bbl system, we kept our original setup and brew a 1bbl experimental every Wednesday. With 12 taps in our Tasting Room, you're sure to find something you like.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:  1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Susquehanna Brewing Company
description: Susquehanna Brewing Company delivers prosperity and enjoyment to our Northeastern Pennsylvania (NEPA) customers and consumers through our quality, craft beers made locally in an environmentally responsible fashion.    We’re beer people. It’s in our blood. 6th generation and going strong. Back before it was hip to brew beer, our grandfathers’ grandfathers spent time crafting the perfect, drinkable beer right here in northeastern Pennsylvania. The beer brewing torch has been passed down, and now it’s our turn. To make the kind of beer you can enjoy all day long, if you’re so inclined. And we have to admit, someti...See More
hoursOfOperation: Free Daily Tour Monday- Friday 3PM and 5PM, Saturday 2PM

name: Tap It Brewing Co
description: Here at Tap It Brewing Company, located in SLO Town, USA in the heart of the Central Coast, we’re true to our roots and true to our word. We like to take a laid-back approach to almost everything we do. But there’s one thing we’re absolutely serious about – our beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: The Phoenix Ale Brewery
description: The Phoenix Ale Brewery is Arizona's newest craft brewery.  We brew unfiltered, English style ales.  Currently, we have three beers to choose from.  Fretzy's Unfiltered Ale, Camelback IPA & Watermelon Wheat.  Come see us on the northeast corner of 30th Street & Washington in Phoenix!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
description: Pendleton, Oregon. A small agricultural town located at the foothills of the beautiful Blue Mountains. And now home to some of the best beers in the state. We’re passionate about fermentation and it shows in our brews. Whether it’s a dry-hopped Northwest IPA or a malt-heavy Porter, the Prodigal Son is dedicated to exploring the possibilities of grain, hops and yeast. Creativity is something we value in our Ales and it’s our goal to incorporate regional ingredients into beers that go beyond convention. Brewing to style is not our objective; we prefer to focus our explorations on the potential of beer.    But we’re more than just brewing, we’ve got good food to boot. The Prodigal Son features a menu that combines traditional pub fare with scratch cooking. Here you will find regional ingredients incorporated into handcrafted cuisine. We have a bona fide chef with an artist’s muse- and his work is truly the product of inspiration. Our food is unique –you might even say it has character.    We’re proud to be back home, here in Eastern Oregon. Come visit anytime, and stay as long as you like. We hope you will join us on our journey to beervana. Lucky for you, your efforts will be rewarded with good beer.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Thimble Island Brewing Company
description: Thimble Island Brewing Company was established in Branford, CT in 2010. Our founders are beer enthusiasts who set out to create well balanced, traditionally crafted beers.    Prior to Prohibition, the United States was home to over 2,000 craft breweries; by the 1980s barely 100 breweries remained. Thimble Island Brewery seeks to recreate the American tradition of having a local brewery that the community can enjoy. Our American Ale is full-flavored yet refreshing enough to be enjoyed year round.    Thimble Island. Serious beer for serious beer lovers.

name: Thirsty Planet Brewing Company
description: We at Thirsty Planet Brewing believe our purpose is multi-faceted. It begins with just good, old-fashioned passion. Beer is our passion. We enjoy the history of beer, its humble, but amazing beginnings, the way it brings people together, and it’s unbelievable versatility. We truly believe you should follow your passion and enjoy life. How better to do that than open Thirsty Planet Brewing Company.    Our purpose then morphs into doing the right thing. For us, this includes being environmentally conscious. We have laced filters in our drains for run-off water, so we can use that water to irrigate our lawns and plants. We also plan to purchase solar panels for our brewery. We recycle, and you will quickly learn that after visiting our beautiful tasting room. Check out our bar, you will see what we mean.    Another important aspect of doing the right thing is through charitable donations. We have been truly blessed in life and want to give to those who are in need of a blessing. A portion of our Yellow Armadillo Wheat sales will go to a local cancer research/support foundation, and a portion of our Thirsty Goat Amber sales will go to help purchase farm animals (maybe goats?) for needy people in third world countries. So, not only can we feel good for helping people, you can feel good every time you purchase Thirsty Planet beer. It’s a win-win situation!!!
hoursOfOperation: Sat:	11:00 am	-	2:00 pm    The tasting room is open from 11-3 every saturday by reservation ONLY.

name: Tighthead Brewing Company
description: Tighthead Brewing Company was founded in 2010 by Owner and Master Brewer, Bruce Dir. Like most brewery adventures, the dream goes back many years and has uncountable iterations. The final version came down to one man finally finding the heart, with a little shove, to drop out of Corporate America and follow what is every brewers dream...opening your own brewery!

name: Toasted and Tapped Brewery and Restaurant Flowery Branch
description: Toasted and Tapped began as a challenge to a group of friends.  The challenge was to take our combined skills and create a brewpub that excels in providing tasty beers, inspired food, and excellent customer service.  After meeting in college, the group entered the work place to refine the skills required to create and operate a successful brewpub.  In January of 2010, with inspired council from family, Paul Coggins relocated to Georgia to focus the group on one purpose.  With the help of God, the group was charged to create the best dining experience for the community.  After many months of construction, permitting, setbacks, and discoveries; Toasted and Tapped opened its doors to the public on November 26th, 2010.  We at Toasted and Tapped are excited to offer the best food, beer, and service we can to the community which gives us so much.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Closed  Tuesday - Wednesday 11:00am - 10:00pm  Thursday 11:00am - 10:00pm (Team Trivia at 8pm)  Friday - Saturday 11:00am - Midnight  Sunday - Starting March 6th - 1pm to 9pm

name: Twisted X Brewing Company
description: Tex Mex Beer - Mexican style Lagers with a Texas twist.

name: Valhöll Brewing
description: Just come check us out. You never know what you might find. We have a fun loving environment and we love to see new people.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat:	4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Valiant Brewing
description: Valiant Brewing Company is a craft brewery in for Orange, California which serves the Southern California area with an exceptional line up of craft beer.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Venice Beach Beer Company
description: The VBBC was started in 2010 by two friends living in Venice that share a love for great beer. In June of 2012, their "VENICE" Amber Ale and "JUNE GLOOM," a Belgian White, hit the market with an overwhelmingly positive response.

name: Wedge Brewing Company
description: The Wedge Brewing Co. is located in the lower level of the Wedge Studios situated in the River Arts District of Asheville, N.C. The building is a classic brick warehouse adjacent  to the railroad tracks. The original use of the structure was probably as a food warehouse. The space the brewery is in at onetime stored slaughtered hogs.    We chose this location because it is in the last frontier of Asheville.    We chose this specific space because it is a perfect fit for our brewing system and gives us great outdoor potential.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thurs:  4pm - 10pm+  Friday: 3pm - 10pm+  Sat + Sun: 2pm - 10pm+

name: Westbrook Brewing Company
description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.
hoursOfOperation: Thursdays 4-7  Fridays 4-7  Saturdays 12-4

name: White Bluffs Brewing
description: Opening November 2010 in Richland, WA, White Bluffs Brewing has been creating great brews since day one. You're thinking, "Well, of course they would say that about themselves"! Don't take our word for it, come and in taste what our fans are talking about or read what they're recommending on Yelp!    Our love of beer, quality ingredients, and 25+ years of experience gives us more than one reason to serve Richland, Kennewick, Pasco and the Northwest with great beer.    Stop in and say hi, we'd love to give you a tour and hang out while you enjoy our humble brewery!    We say "we brew beer with character for people with taste,"  Check us out and find out why.
hoursOfOperation: Tu-Th: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Heaven Craft Beers
description: Wild Heaven is a Georgia company created by lifelong Georgians - founder Nick Purdy (also Publisher of Paste Magazine) with beer recipes designed by Trappeze Pub owner Eric Johnson. Our core year-round portfolio is focused on world-class beers designed to offer something new to the beer landscape—not simply creating our version of what everyone else is doing.

name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co
description: Currently a homebrew shop and nano - brewery serving growlers of beer and rootbeer. We offer homebrew demonstrations every saturday at noon!     Look for our Pub coming later this fall

name: Wolverine State Brewing Company
description: We are the proud brewers of Michigan's Most Drinkable Beers. We are the only microbrewery in Michigan that specializes in making lagers for everyone. What does this mean? It means that from light to dark, every beer we brew is designed to be a beer you can love.

name: Yellow House Canyon Brew Works
description: YHCBW is a production brewery, sitting on the edge of our namesake, bringing craft brewing to the plains in an exciting way. Saddle up and help us bring this new ride to West Texas. Drink deeply and enjoy!

name: Yellowhammer Brewery
description: Launched in late 2010 in downtown Huntsville, Yellowhammer Brewing seeks to bring Belgian and German tradition to Alabama. That means Euopean styles, but with a slight Southern interpretation.  Thanks to Free the Hops and the change in Alabama's formerly restrictive beer laws, creativity in brewing has come to Alabama.    At Yellowhammer, head brewer Keith Yager draws inspiration from both Belgian and German brewing traditions. An accomplished home brewer since 1995, Yager has designed numerous seasonal and specialty batches, from the Dark Hammer Belgian Quad to the UberAlt sticke ale. Other recurring ales are more experimental, blending styles, as with Tobacco Road, an imperial amber designed to complement a good cigar, or the occasional Lonesome Hop series, which spotlights the character of an individual hop. Yellowhammer is Yager's first commercial undertaking.    Yellowhammer Brewing opened on Oct. 16, 2010 with the best-selling Belgian white ale and the IPA. Other staples sold throughout the year include a German style altbier and the Miracle Worker, a potent Belgian tripel.

name: Zio Carlo Magnolia Brewpub
description: We're a small, local brewpub working to get our brewhouse up and running. In the meantime enjoy the finest craft beer available in Texas and beyond. To make it even better, we have a stone pizza oven and will throw a gourmet pizza your way for the total craft beer experience!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 10:30 am - 12:00 am

name: 14th Star Brewing
description: History books tell us that local Vermonter and beer enthusiast Ethan Allen was a leader inthe effort to make Vermont the fourteenth star on the U.S. flag in 1791. And those textbooks are right; especially about the 1791 part.    Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.    14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.    Nanobreweries make less than four-barrel batches, and as of your eyes hitting this paragraph, there are still less than 100 nanobreweries in America.    What makes 14th Star stand out? Well, it’s about the only brewery in Vermont that’s located above Burlington. Period.    But that’s not it. Not entirely.    You see – this is your beer. Oh, sure, Steve plans on starting you off with one-barrel batches of pale ale, brown ale, and Belgian white. There will be more, of course, but that’s up to you. So tell Steve what style beer you want in your 14th Star growler at: steve@14thstarbrewing.com.  On our end, we are readying to open our doors. Our goal is this July. (Check out our Pint of Progress on our home page.)    We can’t wait to watch you let your hair down and lift your glass, Vermont. We’ll enjoy that. And remember – this is your beer. You enjoy it.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  9:00am - 12:00pm

name: 4 Hands Brewing Company
description: 4 Hands Brewing Company, located in the LaSalle Park neighborhood, will provide the craft beer enthusiast a handcrafted portfolio inspired by the American craft movement that pushes the limits of creativity. Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.

name: 4 Paws Brewing
description: 4 Paws Brewing LLC is a microbrewery established in Chicago, IL. The brewery will be located in the Uptown/Edgewater neighborhood at a site to be determined. 4 Paws is hoping to be fully operational by 2013!    We believe in our company, what we stand for, and most of all the beers we serve. We would never make anything we wouldn't drink just to turn a profit and we would never say anything or do anything to compromise our core beliefs. We hope that our supporters and friends join us in believing in 4 Paws too!    So why 4 paws you might ask? The short answer is our little dog Sadie. Sadie is a rescue dog that we adopted over Memorial Day weekend of 2010. She's a big part of who we are and what we're all about. So that's how we got our name, but what are we all about?

name: 5 Rabbit Cerveceria Inc
description: The first Latin microbrewery in the US, 5 Rabbit is all about making the best beer. At 5 Rabbit we celebrate the centuries-old myth behind Latin drinking culture with an innovative concept that revolves that uniquely Latin attitude towards life that has so captured the imagination of the world. It additionally sets out to become an integral part of the local Hispanic community and aid in its advancement. 5 Rabbit is locally brewed in Chicago, Illinois.

name: 53 Peaks Brewing Co
description: In dedication of the great state of Colorado, 53P takes its inspiration from the highest peaks in the state. We hand craft all our beer with unparalleled passion to provide you with a brew worthy of Colorado's indescribable natural splendor.     Welcome to 53 Peaks Brewing Company!

name: Adelbert's Brewery
description: Adelbert’s Brewery is committed to brewing Belgian-style, bottle-conditioned ales for people to seek, savor, and share with others.  We believe quality beers require quality ingredients and a painstaking attention to detail throughout the brewing process.      Adelbert’s uses Bohemian old-world floor malted barley, low alpha Noble Czech hops, and fresh yeast propagated at the brewery. In our seven vessel brewhouse, we use a time consuming, multi-temperature decoction mash technique which extracts a more complex flavor from our grains.    We produce a gambit of hand-crafted Belgian style ales right here in Austin, Texas. With our vast array of beer styles, you're sure to find a brew that suits you.     Our Belgian-Style Ales include:  Naked Nun Wit  Black Rhino Black Ale  Scratchin' Hippo Biere de Garde  Philosophizer Saison  Dancin' Monks Dubbel Ale  Tripel B Tripel Ale  The Traveler Belgian IPA  Flyin' Monks Quadrupel Ale     Also, look for our Barrel-Aged "Vintage Series" where we age one of our eight ales in oak barrels for an extended period of time.    Although our selection of beer is great to enjoy by itself; each of them also pair perfectly with just about any food. From spicy Thai food to a backyard barbecue with ribs and brisket, to a formal dinner with steak or seafood and a dark chocolate dessert; our artisanal Belgian-style ales go with pretty much everything. Please share pictures and recipes that you've either used our beer to cook with or have enjoyed right alongside them!
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Adroit Theory Brewing Company
description: Adroit Theory Brewing Company is the newest nano-brewery in Loudoun County Virginia. We make esoteric beers with an emphasis on barrel aging.  CONSUME LIFE / DRINK ART

name: All Saints Brewing Company
description: All Saints Brewing Company is a new craft brewery in Greensburg, PA. Our mission is to build a brand focused on selling locally manufactured craft beer, for beer people, by beer people. Consistently good tasting craft beer, brewed locally and with Western Pennsylvania pride and passion.    Our brew house is a 7 bbl system which was originally installed at the Red Star Brewery in Greensburg, PA. The system was expanded when brought to All Saints Brewing Company. This expansion allows us additional capacity in addition to providing the opportunity to brew a number of diverse craft brews along with seasonal specialties and Jeff’s world famous barley wines.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  12:00pm - 5:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  3:00pm - 6:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 1:00pm  Wed:12:00 pm - 5:00 pm  Fri:5:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:3:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Sun:11:00 am - 1:00 pm

name: Arcade Brewery
description: Arcade Brewery is a prospective production brewery. We want to create a deeper connection between our customers and their beer. Our goal is to create amazingly delicious craft beer with the help of our customers. With design challenges posted on our website, our customers will create and choose most aspects of beer creation from packaging/label design to even the ingredients that go into some of our seasonal beers. We want our customers to have greater control over the beer that they drink. Plus, we like to have fun and want to deliver you an amazing experience through your beer.    Arcade Brewery is also collaborating with amazing comic book artists and writers to bring label and packaging design to a whole new level of awesomeness. We are currently working with the talented Tony Moore (The Walking Dead), Eisner-nominated writer Jason Aaron (Scalped, Wolverine, PunisherMAX), and graphic artist Seibei.  Arcade Brewery is fun. We don’t believe in pretentious brews, but we do believe in great beers that satisfy our customers educated palette.     Arcade Brewery is only limited to your imagination. Make the next beer your beer.

name: Area 51 Craft Brewery
description: Area 51 Craft Brewery was founded by Mike Hawkins of Rialto, California.  His vision of becoming a unique brewer in a competitive business is a success story in the creation of "Alien Head Beer", which is now known worldwide.
