He started very small, but is now growing at an unbelieveable pace, thanks to a lot of hard work finally paying off and a lot of prayers being answered.   Says Mike: "Initially, I decided to make everything from scratch because I couldn't afford to buy whatI needed.  Once I made a 1932 yellow deuce coupe in my garage and it became a beautiful running hot rod.  A buddy of mine told me "If I could do that, then I could make a brewery come true!"  That really stuck with me.  Little Area 51 Craft Brewery takes a chance in a worldwide market and it was a good choice according to an ever growing popularity.  Why Alien Head Beer? Earthly beers are brewed somewhat similar ways and have a common process.  Alien Head Beer is actually brewed in a special process that is unlike other breweries and delivers a taste that is out of this world!  "We're already thinking ahead and out of the box of what may come next.  Maybe one day soon, we'll think of something crazier!" says Mike.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  1:00pm - 6:00pm Thu:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 6:00pm  Wed: 1:00pm to 6:00pm  Thurs & Fri 1:00pm to 9:00pm  Sat 1:00pm to 6:00pm

name: Arkose Brewery
description: We are a microbrewery in Palmer, Alaska offering fresh, locally-brewed beer in our tasting room “The Growler Cache.” Enjoy a flight of tasters or a pint while we fill your growler. Logo pint glasses, logo taster glasses, and U.S. made apparel in 100% organic cotton and recycled environmentally-friendly fabrics also available.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Tuesdays - Fridays: 2 - 8 p.m.  Saturdays: Noon - 8 p.m.  Closed Sundays, Mondays, & Holidays

name: Ass Clown Brewing Company
description: We are a small handcrafted Brewing Company that specialize in unique flavors. We use only the best ingredients, and use organic whenever it is available.    We believe in making a product that is NOT based off of a profit model, but uses the best local organic ingredients (when available).                                 We also believe it is important to know what is in the beer you drink and that it is made in an environmentally responsible way.  Ass Clown Brewing strives to be  a "green" brewing company that uses alternative energy and finds uses for brewing waste. For example, our warehouse will have recycled items, lights, furniture and equipment.     Local ingredients will also be a focus for Ass Clown Brewing Company. We grow our own hops.  As our production expands we will be looking for North Carolina hop growing farms, malting farms, spices and fruits.
hoursOfOperation: 9:30 - 5:30 Monday to Friday

name: Austin Beerworks
description: Austin Beerworks is an owner-operated Texas brewery hell-bent on excellence. Our beers are canned for quality. We brew for two reasons: to make consistently exceptional craft beer, and to build community in the town we love.

name: Avondale Brewing Company
description: Combine the charm of a historic town, the passions of several good friends, a rooted respect for the craft of brewing and you have unearthed the beginning of what Avondale Brewing Company is all about. A byproduct of the collaboration between Coby Lake, Hunter Lake and Craig Shaw, ABC is a locally owned and operated brewery in the heart of the Deep South with an unmistakable affection for hand-crafted brews.    As you'll discover throughout our website and branding, Avondale Brewing Company is rooted in layers of rich history. We are a young brewery built on years of knowledge, experience, and family bonds. We brew from the heart and pour from the hip. We are confident that you will fall in love with the beer we brew and the stories we tell! Cheers to good beer!

name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery
description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.

name: Badger Hill Brewing
description: A family united by a hankering for travel and craft beer. In our blood: A melting pot of European heritage. Our passion: The singular love of beer. Our mission: Sharing what topped our taste-o-meters. We do hope you like them—and our promise is that we’ll keep coming up with new recipes while staying true to the brew. Mostly.    Wondering about our name? Badger Hill is a rough translation of the two brothers’ names in Old English and speaks to the influence of their European heritage. Plus, they liked how it sounded.

name: Bantam Cider
description: Modern American Cider. We are committed to making creative and distinctive crafted cider using fresh pressed apples and high-quality, all-natural ingredients.

name: Bare Hands Brewery
description: A small batch brewery specializing in hand crafted Ales.

name: Battenkill Brewing Company
description: Battenkill, or the Battenkill River, is a 50-mile river rising in Vermont that flows into New York and is a tributary of the Hudson River. The “Battenkill” barn that houses our brewery in Poulsbo, Washington is reminiscent of the Yankee Style barns that have been built throughout the Battenkill Valley and is the perfect size for either a small craft brewery or dairy milking house. We chose the brewery!

name: Beggars Brewery
description: Beggars is a small production brewery and taproom located in the Chums Corners area of Traverse City, MI. Expect beer Fall of 2012.

name: Beltane Brewing
description: We are a start-up brewery and beer cafe located in Novato, CA (Marin County).  We are not open yet, however!  Planned opening date is on Bastille Day, July 14, 2012.  Please click on the Brewers Blog or contact us and stay in touch with our progress towards opening.    We proudly produce artisinal small-batch ales for the discerning consumer.  The cafe  will also offer chartucerie, cheese plates, pannini and snacks, sourced from local producers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat 11:30am until 10pm  Sun 11:30am until 8pm

name: Beltway Brewing Company
description: Beltway Brewing Company is a brewery in Sterling, Virginia (Loudoun County, a Washington D.C. suburb) built exclusively as a host for partner brewing, contract brewing and production of private label beers. The mission of Beltway Brewing Company is to professionally produce high quality craft beer for those who cannot build or expand their own breweries.    Brewing operations started in September 2013 and the Tasting Room is expected to open in Spring 2014.

name: Berryessa Brewing Company
description: Berryessa Brewing Co. is a 20 barrel craft brewery located just outside historic Winters, California. We take pride in producing fresh quality beer available for wholesale or to enjoy at our taproom.    The tap room is located at the brewery, a relaxed atmosphere in a country setting. There we have indoor seating, scenic outdoor seating, games, occasional entertainment, good company and most importantly, excellent fresh beer. We offer full pints, half pints, and sample trays. More often than not, you will find cask conditioned and barrel aged beers drawn off a cask engine exclusively at the tap room. You can also purchase 64 oz. growlers to go of any of our six rotating taps filled with a counter pressure growler filler.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun:	12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Big Choice Brewing
description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun:	2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Tap Room
description: Birdsong Brewing is Charlotte’s newest microbrewery.  Birdsong was founded in 2011 with a quest for better beer and a 5 gallon soup kettle. Our vision is similar to many of our favorite craft brewing mentors who have inspired us to open our own brewery: We strive to brew flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers for distribution in the Charlotte, NC area.       We are located in NoDa at 26th & North Davidson and we started retail distribution and tap room sales in December 2011.  Our goal is to create outstanding beer, to have a low impact on the environment, and to create personal relationships and ties to the local community.      We have 7 owners and an extremely talented brewer - Conor Robinson.      Our inspiration comes from the popular and innovative styles of the West Coast brewers and is fueled by Conor's Passion and ability to construct unique yet sessionable recipes.  We're excited to add to the growing craft beer movement in Charlotte and the Carolinas.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday:  5pm - 10pm  Friday:  5pm - 10pm  Saturday:  2pm - 10pm  Sunday:  Noon - 4pm

name: Black Heart Brewery
description: We are Black Heart Brewery; we are a home brewery located in Binghamton, New York, and we are in the process of becoming a nanobrewery. Coincidentally, these web pages are in the process of becoming our website. We are overhauling the whole thing, adding much more content, as well as many more new sections.     Black Heart Brewery was founded many batches of home brew ago between two high school friends, Brett Martin and Jay Maslar. See what happens when you seat people in alphabetical order? We currently brew 10 gallon all grain batches on our custom, hand made heat exchange recirculating mash system; it is named HERMES. It is capable of fully automated brewing and extremely accurate data display and recording with our cutting edge Brewtroller 4.0.

name: Black Husky Brewing LLC
description: Making the world a better place one beer at a time, and to promote the joys of jodeling. Hoping to one day have a reality show called "Jodeling with the Stars."

name: Blue Blood Brewing Company
description: Blue Blood Brewing Company is a new craft brewery to Lincoln Nebraska. The day to day operations are run by Brian Podwinski with the help and support of family and friends.    All of our wonderful ales will be named with a three or four digit number simply because numbers are easy to remember. Every beer will have a reason it is brewed and a person who inspired the beer. We feel having inspiration for our beer helps us make even better beer!    Please Consume Our Products Responsibly!!!

name: Blue Mountain Barrel House
description: Blue Mountain Barrel House was founded in 2011 by the Smack family as a sister brewery to the original Blue Mountain Brewery, in Afton (Nelson County). The original Blue Mountain Brewery was created in 2007 by Taylor and Mandi Smack, Matt Nucci and a group of fearless shareholders. Blue Mountain introduced the concept of the rural brewery to our corner of the world and set the standard for great beer in Virginia. As the first production arm of the Blue Mountain family, the Barrel House focuses on the higher-end beers from Blue Mountain that require special processes, special ingredients, and a whole lot of patience.

name: Boatyard Brewing Company
description: Boatyard Brewing Company is on a journey to create superb craft beers through the exploration of artistic fermentations    We are focused on creating the best possible craft beers while keeping with tradition and adding our own artistic flair. Boatyard Brewing Company is also committed to making a positive impact on our community.

name: Bolero Snort Brewery
description: We are one of NJ's latest upstart craft breweries. In order to get "No BS...Just Ragin' Good Beer" into your glasses sooner rather than later, we will be contract brewing our beers to start with a full production site planned to open in late 2013.

name: Boom Island Brewing Company
description: Boom Island Brewing Company opened fall 2011 on the shores of the Mississippi, a hops throw away from of our namesake island. Inspired by traditional Belgian recipes and brewing techniques, our beers are handcrafted using pure Minnesota water and the freshest, natural ingredients. Head Brewer Kevin Welch has won numerous awards for his creations, including our flagship beers, Thoprock, Hoodoo, Silvius and Brimstone.

name: Borderlands Brewing Company
description: Borderlands Brewing Company is a devoted to crafting unique beers using local ingredients and traditional brewing methods. Founded in 2011 by two friends, Borderlands just completed a major expansion and is now providing beer for dozens of bars and restaurants in Southern Arizona. We look forward to sharing a pint with you soon!
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  4:00pm - 9:00pm  Wed - Sat: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Brew & Brats at Arbor Hill
description: Crafted Beer on Tap "Growlers" available, Good Ole Fashioned Root Beer on Tap, Specialty Sausages "Brats" with fresh baked rolls, Condiments Extraordinair including the Winemasters Wine Based Sauerkrat, and glasses of Arbor Hill wine.

name: Brew Wërks Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2011, our passion for great beer has driven us to carve out a niche wherever possible as we strive to bring our own sense of innovation to a very informed local beer consumer. We recognize that the bar has been set high, and we are excited by the opportunity to earn your admiration amongst so many great breweries.    We strive to make beers that push the boundaries of common conception, bursting with flavors and aromas that encourage brew fans to relish in the lush sensory experience. Unfiltered and unrefined, our lineup is designed to encourage the drinker to embrace change as our robust signature mouth feel stretches the palate beyond its previous expectation.

name: Barrel House
description: BricktownE Brewing Company's Barrel House in downtown Medford is quickly becoming the local favorite with 8 different beers on draft, soon to be 10, and very soon to be tripling in size.    BricktownE focus's on English style beers and especially loves to barrel age their beers in local wine barrels, as the local wine scene is getting quite extensive in the Rogue Valley.
hoursOfOperation: Mondays : 2pm-10pm  Tuesdays : 2pm-10pm  Wednesday-Saturday : 1130am-10pm  Sundays : 12pm-6pm

name: Brickyard Brewing Co.
description: "Not Just Another Beer On The Wall"
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School
description: Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School is a unique seasonal brewpub and teaching facility located on the grounds of the Texas Renaissance Festival in Plantersville, Texas. To our knowledge we are the only functioning brewpub located on the grounds of a renaissance festival brewing using both period specific equipment and modern equipment to brew hand crafted ale and then serving it back to the public.    What does that actually mean? Well eight weekends a year we don our garb and brew beer using equipment, ingredients, techniques and recipes that would have been available during the 1400's through the 1600's. We then give samples of ale away and sell pints to visitors that pass through our booth allowing them the opportunity to taste a piece of living history. To our knowledge we are the only renaissance style brewery or brewpub operating at a Renaissance Festival using period recipes, equipement and methods to brew ale and then serving it back to the public.
hoursOfOperation: October - November 9:00 am to Dark (6:30 to 7:30 depending on the time of year.)  Features 10 house brews and multiple Texas craft brews.  Offering tours, tastings and educational classes.

name: BRU
description: Our beer isn’t just a beer. It’s great beer, and a great beer isn’t just about barley, water, yeast, and hops. A great beer is about the people that make it; it is an expression of who we are. Our craft, our passion, and our love captured in a bottle (or a glass) for you to enjoy. First, it starts with writing the recipes and the thoughtful selection of the ingredients that go in them. Ingredie...See More

name: Bull City Burger and Brewery
description: Bull City Burger and Brewery is a locally owned, independent restaurant located at 107 East Parrish Street in downtown Durham, NC. We opened on March 25, 2011. The restaurant serves lunch and dinner with approximately 90 seats inside plus 35 seats of outside patio dining. We offer family friendly dining with a children’s play area, as well as a private meeting room for business gatherings and presentations or private events, all within full view of our own brewery.      The restaurant is very much “farm-to-fork,” working closely with North Carolina pasture raised beef farmers supplying beef with no hormones added and antibiotic-free meat that we grind daily to make our hamburgers and all-beef hotdogs.  We work with other farmers growing vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers for pickles, and lettuce. The menu is streamlined with most items produced on-site including house made buns, sauerkraut and bacon. We use no artificial sweeteners, no high fructose corn syrup, and no hydrogenated oils.  We like to say we are like fine dining in a burger joint.  We make the mustard, the slaw, the pickles, the mayo, the aioli, the hotdogs, the relish, the...    We are also a full scale working brewery and brew our own beer.  We have up to eight beers on-tap at any given time creating fresh ales and lagers rotating seasonally throughout the year. We use just malt, hops, yeast and water to craft our beer, leaving out adjuncts and additives. We take wine seriously and feature farmer made, estate grown and bottled wines from around the world, which are served on-tap via the Enomatic self-serve wine-dispensing machine.    Central to Bull City Burger and Brewery’s core values is sustainability; our attempt is to operate while leaving the smallest energy footprint possible.  Our long term goal is to become part of a cycle of energy with the restaurant playing an integral role in the farms we source. Grain left over from the brewing process will feed locally farmed pigs that provide pork bellies to make our bacon, and the fry oil will become bio-diesel to fuel vehicles.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11:11am to 10pm  Friday & Saturday:  11:11am to 11pm-ish  Closed Sundays

name: Burley Oak Craft Brewery
description: Hi there! We have been hard at work building this brewery keeping in mind sustainable practices and using local materials and craftsmen. We love our town of Berlin, Maryland and hope you join us in our taproom for a couple of pints and growlers. Our goal is to produce distinctive beers whose quaility is unsurpassed using new and traditional brewing methods.    Why "Burley Oak?"    The inspiration for our name Burley Oak Brewing Company was derived from the name of the town, our traditional brewing methods and the history of our brewhouse.     Berlin, Maryland in Wikipedia   The town of Berlin had its start around the 1790s, part of the Burley Plantation, a 300-acre (1.2 km2) land grant dating back to 1677. The name Berlin is believed to be derived from a contraction of "Burleigh Inn", a tavern located at the crossroads of the Philadelphia Post Road (now South Main Street) and Sinepuxent Road (Tripoli Street).    It just so happens, that our building was originally a Cooperage - making oak barrels to fill with local produce and seafood to ship off to Baltimore in the early 1900's. And we are bringing barrels back to the building, aiding us in the aging of our hand-crafted ales.
hoursOfOperation: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday 11am-11pm   Thursday, Friday, and Saturday 11am-2am  Sunday 12pm - 9pm

name: Castle Danger Brewery
description: Castle Danger Brewery is a one-man production brewery located in Castle Danger, Minnesota, 12 miles northeast of Two Harbors off of Highway 61 at Castle Haven Cabins resort.  Clint & Jamie MacFarlane started the brewery journey in March 2010.  Clint brewed his first batch of beer on March 1, 2011.  His love of homebrewing finally turned into a dream-come-true.  He is brewing beer that he loves and knows others will enjoy, too.

name: Charter Oak Brewing Company
description: In an era of extreme everything, the Charter Oak Tree quietly stands apart as a patriotic symbol of strength and truth. That’s why we chose Connecticut’s beloved tree to be the symbol of our dedication to brewing the most honest, freshest and un-hyped beer possible.  Our ales are handcrafted from 100% natural ingredients: select malted barley, choice hops, special yeast, and using only the purest water for a unique and delicious taste. We never use any adjuncts or preservatives.   Each varietal is carefully brewed to be the ideal balance   of flavors for that style beer.  But also our beer is entertaining and enriching. For the enjoyment of our beer lovers, we have extensively portrayed the true events of the Charter Oak legend. Each variety and seasonal ale will share different parts and characters of this enduring story.  We hope you enjoy our beers as much as we enjoyed brewing it.

name: Chocolate City Beer
description: Two friends and avid homebrewers, Ben Matz and Jay Irizarry, had an idea to bring their love of hand crafted micro-brewed beer to the masses via a small scale manufacturing and production facility. No small task when you consider this “dream” was taking form during the latter part of 2008, when the financial markets were set to implode, credit markets were freezing, and good economic news, especially for entrepreneurs and business start-ups, was hard to come by. The two pressed ahead and, with the financial assistance of Brian Flanagan as a third partner and business development specialist Don Parker, launched Chocolate City Beer in November of 2009.
hoursOfOperation: Sat:  12:30pm - 4:00pm  Every Saturday:  12:30pm - 4pm

name: Church Street Brewing Company
description: The Church Street Brewing Company is bringing lagers and ales from around the world to Chicagoland. Using the finest malted barley and hops from North America, the UK, and Germany, there's something for every beer lover. Using traditional German brewing methods, Church Street will break new ground with beer-lovers by making an expansive range of both new and old beers and ales, pleasing all palates!    While we currently have several year-round beers, our tap rotation will continue to evolve, with special releases and seasonal brews. We love hearing from customers, so let us know what your favorite styles are — we might just try a batch!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm  Thursday: 4pm to 7pm  Friday: 4pm to 7pm

name: CIB Brewery
description: A limited production artisanal nano brewery located in Carson, Iowa. Opened December 21, 2011.    To produce full flavored, real beer with the highest quality from local ingredients and sell that beer to our friends and family.    CIB is a small batch, production only nano brewery with an emphasis on flavor, evironmental responsibility, local artwork, ingredients, and distribution.

name: Circle Brewing Company
description: At Circle, all of our brews embody the concept of purity through simplicity of design.  You won’t find chemicals, stabilizing or clarifying agents, cheap additives or adjuncts, or even gimmicky fruits or spices in any of our brews.  At Circle, we embrace the German Purity standards of 1516 and continually brew better beer with that in mind.  To us, the circle is a symbol of perfection in its most basic form.  We share that perfection with you in every pint of Circle.

name: City Island Beer Company
description: Founded in 2011, the City Island Beer Company produces hand-crafted beer inspired by a local ship building tradition of craftsmanship and quality that produced seven America's Cup winning yachts.     Our mission is to bring you the best beer made with the finest ingredients.

name: Civil Life Brewing Company
description: We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales.     We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!

name: Coastal Empire Beer Company
description: Artisan ales and lagers.

name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub
description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: Monday-Thursday 11am-10pm, Friday & Saturday 11am-11pm

name: Copp Brewery
description: Relax.  You shouted. We heard you.  Copp Winery of Crystal River Florida is now Copp Winery and Brewery.     We are proud to be the first and ONLY winery to also hold a brewpub license in the State of Florida!    With that distinction comes a responsibility that we have not taken lightly.  In addition to continuing to offer you the best selection of hand-crafted wines produced on premises from the finest domestic and imported varietals and blends of grapes and juices, our craft microbrewery now produces and offers the highest quality selection of hand crafted beers made on premises from the finest domestic and imported ingredients, like quality English barley malt and the freshest dried hops.     Because our beers are produced in smaller quantities, we can offer not only the highest quality but diversity in our craft beers.  Like our extremely popular True Grit pale ale with corn grits, our brown ale Center Field or our English style porter Inaugabrew.     While some of our craft beers will always be on tap, others will be limited production.  Don't miss out - visit often and enjoy!
hoursOfOperation: Monday & Tuesday: Closed to public  Wednesday & Thursday: 12-9  Friday & Saturday: 12-11  Sunday 1-6  (Please note the kitchen closes 1/2 hour before the Brewpub and the Winery and Wine Bar)    HOLIDAY HOURS / CLOSINGS  Wed., December 26th - CLOSED.  Wed., January 2nd - TBA

name: Copper Kettle Brewing Company
description: Copper Kettle Brewing Company is a locally owned Mom and Pop brewery, established in 2011. Built on the foundation of craft beer, quality ingredients and the idea of re-creating the local neighborhood pub feel that America seems to have lost. Come on in and enjoy a pint or two and take a growler home with you to share with your friends and family
hoursOfOperation: Wed: 3:00 pm - 9:00 am  Thurs - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Cornel's Brewing Company
description: Beaumont's first Mirco Brewery, located in Bevil Oaks. Look for our tasty brews in a restaurant or store near you!

name: Cotton Brewing Co.
description: An LLC started by Brett Cotton and Krista Cotton in January 2011. The microbrewery license was issued to Cotton Brewing Company in August 2012. Build out of the brewery has been completed, inspections are finished, and we have begun building our tap room on Oak St. in Adrian.    Cotton Brewing currently has a production facility that is not open to the general public. Beer may be purchased directly from the production facility by appointment only.

name: Country Boy Brewing
description: Country Boy Brewing was founded in late 2011 by three country boys who like beer and had a similar goal of making and drinking good beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed: 4PM - 10PM  Thu-Fri: 4PM-Midnight  Sat: Noon - Midnight  Sun: 1PM - 9PM

name: Brewpub
description: Darwin Brewing Co. is a production brewery with a beer tasting room.  Co-owner and Brewmaster Jorge Rosabal is in charge of the brewing operation.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 5:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 5:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sat: 5:00 pm - 1:00 pm  Sun: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Deluxe Brewing Company
description: Deluxe Brewing Company is a production brewery located along the Willamette River in Albany, Ore. Deluxe Brewing produces fine German-style lagers. Its lineup includes a Pre-Prohibition pilsner, Amber Lager and Schwarzbier and seasonals.   Come in and sample! Deluxe Brewing’s Tasting Room hours are Fridays 4 to 8 p.m. and Saturdays 12 to 6 p.m.  Deluxe Brewing is located in the Borden Building, 635 NE Water Ave. For more information on Deluxe Brewing visit www.deluxebrewing.com.

name: Denver Beer Company
description: Denver Beer Co. was born in our garages with a few batches of homebrew and a love for the craft of brewing. Serving only premium artisan ales and lagers, we utilize fresh ingredients and embrace both innovative and old world styles of beer. Similar to a farmer’s table, our beer selections change with the seasons. By brewing in small batches, we can ensure that a few old favorites are always on tap, but new goodies greet visitors each month.    Our brewery is founded on passion for high quality, flavorfully crafted beer and the belief that the best pints are those shared with good company. Drawing inspiration from beer gardens of Bavaria, we designed Denver Beer Co. to be a place where new and old friends can share a table and pint out of doors.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Champaign
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 10:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 10:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 10:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 10:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 9:00pm  Reservations, call-ahead seating and   walk-ins are accepted for Lunch or Dinner.     For parties of 6 or greater, please call us directly to make your reservation.

name: Discretion Brewing
description: Discretion Brewing is a family-owned brewery dedicated to producing handcrafted organic beer of consistent high quality. We are known for quality and elegance in both our products and our presence in the community. Our name speaks to our desire to be wise and full of care as we go about our business. We encourage the notion that we all have the freedom to decide what we consume.     We have defined "Discretion" with the words, "wisdom," "wit," and kindness." These are qualities that we hope will define our interactions with each other, our customers, and our community.     Choose Goodness. Have Discretion.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: Doylestown Brewing Co
description: Doylestown Brewing Company at first wanted to brew a specialty beer for a event which is held every year by the Doylestown Porch Society called Rib Feast. But soon we realized that the Doylestown bars, pubs and restaurants needed a local flavor and style they could call their own.    DBC opened its corporate office on Union St right here in downtown Doylestown and it soon became clear and obvious choice for the name of our Flagship IPA, Union St IPA.     DBC is making the finest craft beers, and we plan on putting a brand and style that is a bit different than most. With flavors like Fountain House Light, R5 Lager and Union St you are sure to find a style and flavor that you will think has been specially brewed for you

name: Drop In Brewing
description: We'll be producing a flagship beer that a lot of people will love to drink. We'll also be producing a range of beers that a few people will enjoy sipping.    We operate a tasting room for beer samples and growler fills. You can stand in one place and see the whole brewery but if the brewer is there the door is always open
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Dubrue
description: Duluth is an old industrial city and a thriving tourist destination. A city that used to boast 3 major production breweries among its ore docks, wheat granaries, and timber barons is now home to at least 5 microbreweries and brewpubs. Maybe it’s the water – fresh, cold, and right outside our door.       Dubrue is building on this rich and local brewing history with a 15 bbl system located in the heart of downtown Duluth. And we’re brewing in the established tradition: start with great ingredients – fresh water, barley, and hops – and end with a satisfying brew. Our Duluth roots, combined with west-coast training and 10 years of brewing and building recipes, help us focus on consistency in our flagship beers: an irresistibly drinkable Pub Ale, and a hoppy and inspired India Black Ale.

name: Echo Brewing Company
description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 2:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: El Segundo Brewing Company
description: El Segundo Brewing Company was created out of a love for beer. Well, hoppy beer at least. Rob Croxall, proprieter and brewer, was a longtime aerospace finance guy who left a cushy corporate job to risk it all on craft beer. He says all the time, “My worst day here, still beats my best day there.”  By our measure.. THAT is success.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Elevation 66 Brewing Co
description: Uniquely crafted beers and fresh local foods for the bay area.

name: Evil Czech Brewery Culver
description: Evil Czech has been operating since 2011 and just opened it's doors to a new 20 barrel facility this year. Head brewer, Scott Ciampa, brews up a little bit of everything, ranging from pilsners to barrel-aged sours, all rotating through the brewpub's tap list...    ... sometimes for beer to be good, it has to get evil.

name: Exit 6 Brewery
description: We offer 70 different craft beers and 5 made right here in house. We are non smoking and do not have a kitchen. However, if you’re hungry, bring food with you or we have a bunch of menus of places that will deliver right here to the bar!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 4:00 pm - 1:30 am  Sat:	12:00 pm - 1:30 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 12:00 am

name: Fargo Brewing Company
description: Fargo Brewing Company is a microbrewery starting up in Fargo, North Dakota. The four founders are Fargo natives who care about bringing hand crafted, artisan beer to the heartland.    Opening in 2011, the brewery will be devoted to crafting a premium product from bushel to bottle.    Join Fargo Brewing Company at their local events for free beer tastings and more information.

name: Fiddlehead Brewing Company
description: Fiddlehead Brewing Company is located on Route 7 in beautiful Shelburne, Vermont. Our mission is to produce high quality beer, use as many local ingredients as we can, and create recipes with the true beer connoisseur in mind.  We use a 15 barrel brewery and will distribute in the regional market.

name: Fort Bend Brewing Company
description: Fort Bend Brewing, Fort Bend's First Craft Brewery, combines creativity, the Texas state-of-mind, with high quality ingredients to make exquisite craft beers.

name: Fountain Square Brewing Company
description: Back in the Summer of 2011, we got the crazy idea to startup a brewery, not because we wanted to be on the bandwagon, but because we wanted something different, something our talents and passion for beer could make happen. Out technical background in Microbiology, Chemistry, and Automation, made up the perfect storm needed to produce quality beer with a higher level of consistency and with improved shelf stability. Our passion for beer and diversity of tastes allowed us to craft carefully refined recipes that we know will delight you.    We chose Fountain Square because of the community. Since we will be the first to admit our creativity and talents exist on a side of the brain that has little capability to draw, we have this admiration and attraction to those whose talents reside in the arts. We have connected to this community over the past year and look forward to being a vehicle for expressing its artistic nature. Fountain Square is a community of hard working, creative, fun loving, and genuine people. They are probably the most helpful people we've ever met. We are truly honored to be a part of the community and will strive to be worthy ambassadors and stewards.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday - 4pm to 9pm  Friday - 4pm to 10pm  Saturday - 2pm to 10pm  Sunday - Noon - 6pm

name: Freak'N Brewing Company
description: Freak'N Brewing Company has been established to bring quality craft beer to Phoenix's west valley and beyond. We are committed to brewing quality beers in unique & creative styles that are not typically found in brewpubs and resturants. We are a brewery that loves not only the science of brewing, but also the art of making a great beer. If you are a beer enthusiast, like we are, then come on out have a Freak'N Brew!!

name: Free Will Brewing Company
description: We are a production brewery located in bucks county PA.  Look for our beer on tap at finer bars and restaurants throughout eastern and central PA. We strive to create unique and delicious beer using traditional ingredients.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm    Tastings are held Thursday-Friday 4-7pm and Saturdays 12-4pm.   Saturday tours are at 1 and 3pm.

name: Frog Level Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is named for its location and its attitude. Until the railroad came in 1884, Frog level was swampland.  By the 30’s and 40’s Frog Level was the hustle & bustle in Waynesville. This was the place where blue collar folks worked hard in factories and warehouses to raise families…to do their part to make Haywood County what it is today.    Ours beers are distinct in their attitude and ingredients, by brewing as much “Haywood County” as possible into each batch!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 2:00pm - 6:30pm  Thur - Sat:  2:00pm - 8:30pm

name: Geneva Lake Brewing Company
description: Local micro brewery in Lake Geneva Wi.    Founded by father-son duo, Pat and Jon McIntosh, Geneva Lake Brewing Company are proud to be on tap at many locations! Check out our web page for the location closest to you!
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat - Sun:	11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: Golden Road Brewing
description: Golden Road is a brewery located in Los Angeles, California.  Founders Tony Yanow and Meg Gill share a vision to bring fresh beer to locals, bolstering the greater LA craft community.  Located off of the 5 freeway, north of downtown, our pub is open daily, offering great food and a wide variety of our latest brews.

name: Pub
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Sunday: 11AM-11PM

name: Good Fences Craft Beer
description: Good Fences Craft Beer is a Brewery in planning in Chattanooga, Tennessee. Good Fences will bring award-winning, complex, flavorful beers to Chattanooga.    Brewery is In Planning

name: Grey Sail Brewing of Rhode Island
description: Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's newest microbrewery.    Proudly located in the seaside city of Westerly, Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's premier microbrewery equipped to produce up to 4,000 barrels of handcrafted beer per year.
hoursOfOperation: Sat: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Gunpowder Falls Brewing
description: We are a small brewery that brews authentic German-style lager beer in New Freedom Pennsylvania - where Gunpowder Falls begins    Please come visit us at our tasting room with food provided by Juliana's in the Village.    You can also buy six-packs, cases, and kegs to go.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Half Full Brewery
description: The Half Full Brewery is a “lifestyle” brewery and the concept behind our brewery is as simple as its name and motto sounds:  whether your glass is literally or figuratively “Half Full”, you can “look forward to more…”   What makes Half Full different is the “…” because that ellipsis is unique to you.  It can be anything in the world and most often, it has something to do with what drives you, your passion.  For me, it is very simple — I always look forward to more of my dream, Half Full, and spending time with the people that have inspired me to take this journey.  Passionate beer and passionate people, is there any better pairing?    What’s your “…”?  If you don’t know, then it’s time to step back like I did four years ago (story to follow in the near future), have a beer with a friend, and figure it out because life doesn’t get any more rewarding and exhilarating than when you pursue what you are most passionate about, when you pursue your “…”

name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
description: Our Mission is to become one of the most respected brewers in the United States through integrity in our ingredients and in our business practices, through respect for brewing heritage, and through the inspired creation of extraordinary beers.
hoursOfOperation: Public hours vary, but the tasting room opens at least once a week for sampling, growler fills, tours, etc. - visit www.hardywood.com/tasting-room for details.

name: Haw River Farmhouse Ales
description: Haw River Farmhouse Ales will handcraft traditional French- & Belgian-style ales with a little southern flair, using local and organic ingredients where possible in each of our beers. Located in Saxapahaw, NC, opening Memorial Day Weekend, 2012.

name: Hawcreek Brewing Company
description: We strive to make delicious, fresh, hand-crafted beer and refuse to produce anything less. we are looking forward to becoming your brew of choice when we open late this fall.

name: Heathen Brewing
description: Heathen Brewing is a small craft brewery that was created from the soul of home brewing. The realization that we as a people want to break the corporate strong hold on the beer industry and get back to using local ingredients in small craft batch brewing has demanded the formation of Heathen Brewing. At Heathen Brewing we make small batches of "Progressive Ales for the Promiscuous Palate". It all ...See More
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Helm's Brewing Co.
description: Helm's Brewing Co. is a community brewery. It's a place where people stop by after work to check out what's new on the menu and have a quick taster before heading home. Our facility is a place to take the edge off while enjoying a fine beer with neighbors and friends. Helm's Brewing Co. is a place where everyone is welcomed.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: HenHouse Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2011, we crank out awesome beers 2 barrels at a time in uncompromising and fearless pursuit of our goal: creating new and interesting kinds of delicious. HenHouse is the work of our hands, hearts and brains and we hope you enjoy the beer as much as we enjoy making it.     We love beer, people, and Petaluma.

name: Heretic Brewing Company
description: Be a Heretic. Don't drink ordinary beer. Embrace your inner heretic and join us to push the boundaries of beer flavors. We are crazy about beer and passionate about making it. Wanna be a heretic too? There’s always room for one more.

name: Hilliard's Beer
description: We opened our doors in October, 2011 with focus on beer in cans.  Founded by Ryan Hilliard and Adam Merkl, we now have a much larger crew and even more beer.    We self-distribute canned and draft beer to bars and restaurants within Seattle and have a 1 case minimum.  Please contact Adam Merkl at 206-915-3303 or adam@hilliardsbeer.com for info.  Off-premise sales within Seattle as well as on and off-premise sales of our canned beer outside Seattle is handled by our distributor, Noble.
