hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	4:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Wed - Fri:	4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Intergalactic Brewing Co
description: We are a San Diego Based Pilot Brewery, currently operating on a Nano-Scale brewing system.

name: Iron Goat Brewing
description: Iron Goat brews are now being served in some of Spokane's best bars and restaurants. Taproom will be open the first week of June.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: Chestnut Hill
description: Welcome to Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant, where you'll find fine handcrafted beers, creative yet informal cuisine, and friendly, attentive service in a casual, upscale atmosphere.    We're passionate about producing distinctive, full-flavored handcrafted beers, accompanied by fresh–from–scratch New American cuisine in a comfortable, casual atmosphere. Our goal has always been to provide food and beer that is inspired, consistently crafted and presented by a knowledgeable and courteous service staff.    Our commitment to support the communities in which we do business goes to the heart of what differentiates Iron Hill from other restaurants. But it is because of you, our guests, that we have been able to make this all happen.
hoursOfOperation: Opening late 2011

name: West Chester
hoursOfOperation: Sun:  11:00am - 11:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 12:00am Wed:  11:00am - 12:00am Thu:  11:00am - 12:00am Fri:  11:00am - 1:00am Sat:  11:00am - 1:00am  Kitchen Hours  Sunday – Wednesday: 11:00 am – 10:00 pm; Lite Fare after 9:00 pm  Thursday – Saturday: 11:00 am – 12:00 am; Lite Fare after 10:00 pm  Sundays – Prime Rib Dinner: 1:00 pm – 9:00 pm    Reservations  Reservations and Call-Aheads are accepted for Lunch and Dinner

name: Ironfire Brewing Company
description: Ironfire Brewing Company was founded in 2011 by John Maino and Gregory Webb. The two spent many years working/brewing together at Ballast Point in San Diego before venturing off on their own. They plan on a Spring 2012 opening.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Island Hoppin' Brewery
description: Our Island Hoppin' crew consists of Becca Gray, Jim Parker and our brew master Nate Schons.     Everyone of us brings something else to the brewery. We truly believe that to make an excellent brew you need to put a lot of heart and soul into your work.   We love brewing and it shows in every pint poured.

name: Jack's Abby Brewing
description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

name: Jackalope Brewing Company
description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday: 4PM - 8PM  Friday: 4PM - 8PM  Saturday: 4PM - 8PM

name: Kane Brewing
description: Kane Brewing Company is a new craft brewery located on the coast of New Jersey. Our focus will be on American style and Belgian influenced ales. All of our handcrafted beers will be unfiltered and brewed locally in our custom built two-vessel brew house located in Ocean in Monmouth County. Our beers will be self-distributed and available on draft at restaurants and bars in coastal and northern New Jersey. We plan to launch in the spring of 2011.

name: Keg Creek Brewing Company
description: Keg Creek Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in Glenwood, IA that produces small batch craft beer.     We will have an on-site tasting room, serving pints and offering growler purchase and refill. Additional products offered for sale at our location will include 5 gallon kegs, 22 oz bottles, T-Shirts and Caps. Our beer will also be available at many bars and wineries in the local area. Opening planned for August 2011.

name: Kilted Dragon
description: Kilted Dragon’s New location will continue to provide a unique line-up of hand-crafted beers in Garden City and can be found at other pub and restaurant locations around the Boise region. Kilted Dragon joins the Boise craft beer revolution with a new spectrum of flavor.  Partnering with businesses in the Boise area and beyond, Kilted Dragon Brewing is a part of the hand-crafted beer community, the Boise Business community and regional art and music groups. In addition to excellent beer, you’ll find live music, art and food as a standard sustenance feature at the Tap House Tasting room in Garden City.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Kinetic Brewing Company
description: Kinetic Brewing Company is the premier microbrewery in Lancaster, CA, located just 50 miles north of Los Angeles in the heart of the historic and newly gentrified downtown, The BLVD.  Featuring international pub cuisine and fine American craft beer from Southern California and beyond.
hoursOfOperation: Monday 4PM - 10PM  Tuesday 4PM - 10PM  Wednesday 4PM - 10PM  Thursday 12PM - 11PM  Friday 12PM - 12AM  Saturday 12PM - 12AM  Sunday 12PM - 9PM

name: La Cabra Brewing
description: Over the next few years, our headbrewer will develop both the business and brewing skills to establish a nanobrewery outside of Philadelphia. From Manayunk to West Chester, this swathe of land boasts some of the most well-informed, enthusiastic, and--frankly--fanatical beer fans. It would be our honor and pleasure to provide them fresh, small batch, artisanal beer with an emphasis on seasonality and occasionality.    La Cabra is a nanobrewery in the planning, a porfolio of beers over the last 7 years of homebrewing. Small-batch, labor intensive, and patient brewing produces ale and lager styles of distinct quality, integrity, and creativity.

name: Lake Bluff Brewing Company
description: We're a quaint craft brewery in the Chicago's North Shore suburbs. We strive to create the finest beer while minding the rich traditions of brewing.

name: Lakewood Brewing Co.
description: From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers.  Brewery tours are offered every Saturday from 12:00 Noon to 3:00pm. Schol!
hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours every Saturday from noon to 3:00pm.

name: Lazy Monk Brewing
description: Lazy Monk Brewing LLC was created out of desire to serve local people with good quality beers. We specialize in brewing Bohemian and German Lagers but we do not shy away from British or American beers.    Craft Brewery that will be focusing on Bohemian and German beer styles but will not shy away from ales.

name: Lone Tree Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery and tasting room: Small and family friendly, with an emphasis on sampling small-batch brews and sharing the experience with fellow beer lovers.

name: Loomis Basin Brewing Co
description: Serving Handcrafted Premium Ales
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Loop Brewing Company
description: Enjoy the historic building, unique atmosphere, fresh brick oven pizza and smooth craft beer. Loop Brewing Company is the perfect place to dine with your family and friends. Share a pint of fine, handcrafted beer within sight of the very brewing tanks that produced it.    Loop Brewing Company was established in 2011 in McCook, Nebraska. The brewery is situated along the railroad tracks that shaped the town nearly 130 years ago. Loop Brewing Company pays homage to its roots through an age-old tradition of quality, handcrafted brewing. Our beer is as rich as our heritage
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Lore Brewing Company
description: We are a full service homebrew, vintner and soda supply store that has all of the ingredients and equipment you need to make great beverages at home.  Our microbrewery will be opening sometime in late 2011.  10% discount on most supplies and equipment for AHA members, Police, Fire and Active Duty or Retired Military!

name: Lost Rhino Brewing Company
description: Lost Rhino™ is a new craft brewery in Ashburn, VA with deep roots in Loudoun County. Brewers Matt Hagerman and Favio Garcia, formerly of Old Dominion, are back together and now creating some of the finest beers found in the local area!    The name Lost Rhino™ represents the strength and attitude of the rhinoceros. The five species of rhino each has its own distinct persona, ranging from laid back to aggressive. Our brews will also span a range of personalities from hoppy Pilsners to rich, malty IPAs.    "Rhino chasers" are big wave surfers on a continuous journey to find the next perfect wave. At Lost Rhino™, we are on a similar journey to create a continuing line of distinctive, enjoyable, memorable beers.

name: Lucky Town Brewing Company
description: Living in Mississippi, the selection of beer has always been limited compared to the rest of the country – but that does not stop those of us who seek out the diverse supply of the world’s greatest beers. Some drive across state lines to acquire the finer choices at festivals and suppliers alike, while others exchange trades with those from other states in search of the locally forbidden. But for those who truly take matters into their own hands, homebrewing beer becomes the purest form of gratification.    Driven by an extreme passion for both innovation and beer, our Brewmaster took what was once just a dream and decided to create a beer that would not only break state laws but also help change the very same laws that Mississippi has let fall behind. For eight years, he brewed beers of many different styles as a hobby - and with each tasting that he would hold at his home, the crowds grew larger. Eventually, he would be convinced that this beer should be available to those patrons who also appreciate the finer beers of the world.    Lucky Town Brewing Company was founded on this very notion – to craft beers that break boundaries between the working men and women of Mississippi and their wish for locally produced premium beer. With that mission, Lucas Simmons decided to grant those wishes by sharing his passion for crafting beer in 2011.

name: Lumina Brewing Company
description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday-Saturday: 11:00AM-6:00PM  Closed on Sunday & Monday

name: MacDowell Brew Kitchen
description: MacDowell Brew Kitchen, the newest nano brewery in the area, introducing the finest in craft beers that are brewed on premises under the direction of several master brewers.  MacDowell Brew Kitchen has some very special beers on draught and bottles brewed by other nano breweries, around 150 to choose from.  Our menu includes BBQ, American Cuisine, and other surprises!
hoursOfOperation: Tues-Thurs: 11AM - 10PM  Fri-Sat: 11AM - 12AM  Sun: 11AM - 9PM  Mon: Closed

name: Machine House Brewery
description: At Machine House Brewery, we produce traditional English style Ales in small batches at our historic location in Seattle's Georgetown neighborhood.    Our goal is to deliver the authentic session beer experience to Seattle, meaning particularly drinkable ales with moderate levels of alcohol and bitterness.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Macon Beer Company
description: Macon Beer Company, LLC is a craft beer company focused on innovation, sustainability, philanthropy, and developing a strong connection to our employees and community. We expect to maximize profitability without sacrificing quality, purity, or attention to detail through the use of engineering principles that improve value and efficiency beyond industry standards. We will strive to become a source of knowledge held in high regard by the craft beer industry. In addition, Macon Beer Company will become a respected business in the Macon area via investment in the community and promotion of an inviting and supportive business personality.

name: McHale's Brewhouse
description: McHale's Brewhouse is a Scotch-Irish Pub with an attached nanobrewery. We have amazing food. We make our own beer batter from our Dixie Blonde. We have 5-8 rotating house beers on tap at all times.

name: McKenzie's Hard Cider
description: McKenzie’s Hard Cider was founded in 2011 by Lenny Ciolek in Buffalo, New York. Lenny played a crucial role in the success of the Mike’s Hard Lemonade brand and was able to secure distribution for McKenzie’s utilizing existing relationships and a grassroots method of marketing.    McKenzie’s currently produces 5 different varieties of hard cider; Original, Black Cherry, Green Apple, Seasonal Reserve (cinnamon and nutmeg) and Lazy Lemon (lemonade blend). Its varieties have received several awards including Double Gold Medal for Black Cherry, and Silver Medals for Original and Green Apple at the 2012 New York Wine & Food Classic.    McKenzie’s can be found at a bar near you, or at Wegmans and Tops grocery stores, where it is the best?selling hard cider.

name: Midnight Brewery
description: Midnight Brewery is Metro Richmond’s newest micro brewery, located in Rockville, VA (just west of the city). We are extremely creative with our work and brew several limited edition beers. So stop in frequently; you never know what will be on tap.    We are family owned and operated; we answer to ourselves and ourselves alone. Craft brewing the best beers possible is our passion. We brew beers that we love, and we know you’ll love them as well. We’re proud to continue the great tradition of locally brewed Richmond beers. Be sure to come to the brewery, or stop in one of the stores or restaurants that serve Midnight. And check out our events page; you never know where we’ll pop up around town. You won’t be sorry.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Midtown Brewing Company
description: With our local roots, we take pride in our good relationships with local providers in the area.  Stop in for Locally Crafted Beers and more!

name: Monkish Brewing Co
description: A small craft brewery in Los Angeles (Torrance), California creating artisanal beers inspired by Belgian-ish farmhouse and monastic brewing traditions and philosophy.

name: Mother Road Brewing Company
description: Driving on a dark stretch of two lane road, founders Michael and Alissa  Marquess were pondering how to better live their creed of ‘finding joy in the adventure’. They came up with a plan that brought together their passions of craft beer, travel, Arizona and the enjoyment of life;they decided to create a brewery. We hand craft each of our beers along Route 66 in Flagstaff in a 1920s era building with a small staff. We found craft beer, where does your road lead?
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room Open Daily  Tours by Appointment

name: Mother's Brewing Company
description: Mother's is a growing family that's all about heady craft beers. So we started our own brewery, and we're producing as much love per barrel as we possibly can. In the short time that we've been open, we've made a helluva lot of different, fun, and innovative beers. Stop by and see what we brought with us. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri:	4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat:	1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Mystery Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to create a cornucopia of high-quality rustic ales for the discriminating consumer, to test the boundaries of creativity and style. In short, to make outstanding beer.    How do we plan to do it? It involves using fresh, high-quality ingredients and a steady hand at the kettle. But that’s just half of it. The other half of it is right here. The power of the internet, social media, and networking is here to see. Think of this as your own internet brewpub where you can sidle up next to the brewmaster and ask a question — because you can.    What’s so Mysterious?    It’s a bit of a throwback. “Mystery” in its original definition meant the “art and craft of a trade.”  Brewers were among the first organized trade groups; there is evidence of a guild of brewers as early as 12th Century London: “the Master, Keepers or Wardens and Commonalty of the Mistery or Art of Brewers of the City of London”. So, it’s a tribute, it’s recognition that there is just as much art to brewing as there is science, and it’s a gentle reminder that to move forward and create a truly excellent future, sometimes you have to look at the past.
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room:  Friday 6pm - 11pm  Otherwise, By Appointment Only

name: Naples Beach Brewery
description: The Naples Beach Brewery is a family owned craft brewery founded with the sole purpose of helping beer drinkers who are disappointed with their current beer selection and are also frustrated with not being able to drink high quality local craft beer. We will make it a point to source local ingredients and products for use along the path from grain to glass. The brewery will begin brewing on modest sized equipment handcrafting small batch ales for the local community and surrounding areas.
hoursOfOperation: Friday, Jan 4: 4pm-8pm  Saturday, Jan 5: 3pm-7pm

name: New Braunfels Brewing Company
description: Founded in early 2011 by the Meyer family, we're inspired to brew our locally hand-crafted beer by old-word German recipes. What goes in our beer is as much local wheat, local water and local passion as we can get our hands on.     Our beers go right up to the edge of the style and take one defiant step over it. We make beer that tastes great and refreshes the soul. we don't care whether or not it 'fits the style'.     Order a glass of NBBCo and experience something different

name: Newburgh Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Newburgh Brewing Company, which is the Hudson Valley's newest Craft Brewery!    Founded by Chris Basso and Paul Halayko, both from Washingtonville, NY, and later joined by an accomplished Charlie Benedetti, Newburgh Brewing Company is proud to join the rich history of brewing in New York State.     We began brewing in March 2012, launching our beers on April 19, 2012.

name: NoDa Brewing Company
description: NoDa Brewing Company opened its doors to the world on October 29, 2011 and is one of Charlotte’s newest home-grown microbrewery for beer lovers in the Carolinas! This unique production brewery in Charlotte’s NoDa neighborhood crafts small-batch premium beers, offering something for nearly every beer drinker. The North Davidson (NoDa) neighborhood is known as the creative center of Charlotte: as a natural extension of NoDa’s artistic spirit, there isn’t a better place for a microbrewery to call home.    NoDa Brewing is a 15 barrel brewery creating the highest quality beers for local restaurants and pubs, as well as our tap room.  Our beer styles will have a Northwestern feel, showcasing American Pale Ales, India Pale Ales, and Porters.  Our small size gives us the flexibility to introduce many unique and artistic recipes as well as our renditions of classic varieties such as Imperial Stouts, Wit beers, and Winter Warmers.  Our Head Brewer frequently traveled to Europe over the past couple years.  He has been fortunate to have experienced the wonderful beers that have historically defined many current craft beer styles.  As we pay homage to these great and historic beers, we’ll add an American Flair that will be embraced in the Carolinas and beyond.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - 4 - 8:30  Tuesday - 4-8:30  Wednesday - 4-9  Thursday- 4-8:30  Friday - 4-9:30  Saturday - 12-10  Sunday - 1-6

name: Nowhere Brewing Company
description: Nowhere Brewing Company is not quite an official brewery...yet. With 10 years of local brewing behind us, it's our goal to establish a nano brewery and taproom where the great people on the North Shore can enjoy local beer. Until then look for us at local beer events and remember, great beer comes out of Nowhere.    Nowhere Brewing Company is looking to build a great group of investors that are excited about our beer, and bring more small batch beer to the North Shore. Know of someone that is looking for an incredible investment opportunity? Send them my email, chris@nowherebrewingcompany.com. We are eager to share with our community and enthused about involving all of you in our journey.
hoursOfOperation: Still in planning.. Look for us at festivals.

name: Microbrewery and Eatery
description: It all about the freshest and best in local beer, great food and top service. This all happens at Obed and Isaac's Microbrewery & Eatery. Directly across the street from the President Lincoln's home and neighborhood.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am	- 11:30 pm

name: Odyssey Beerwerks
description: Back when the world was a much different place, filled with grunge music, loose fitting clothes, and Wayne’s World movies, two shady characters fell in together and started doing various sketch and wonderful things. One of these was brewing . . . beer. Not the tasty, modern, complex craft beers flowing in today’s market, but the goofy and “just OK” beers that home brewers in the 90’s seemed to know how to build. These guys (we’ll call them Chris and Josh for lack of anonymity’s sake) got better at brewing over the years, even as they moved apart.    Chris went down a corporate marketing path; Josh seemed to prefer engineering and operations; both still enjoyed beer and, with lots of practice, the homebrew got better and better. When Y2K sputtered out before it even came to life, the two had their first discussion about opening a brewery. More life happened. More of the guys’ improving craft beers were served at more home parties. When they got together again more recently, the topic resurfaced, but this time it wouldn’t go away. And gradually a brewery was born.    20 years since the start of their homebrew hobbies, Odyssey Beerwerks was formed to do the impossible: take an enjoyable hobby of creating fine craft beers and make it into a dreary job, with the benefit of bringing new and exciting hand crafted beers onto our vibrant planet.
hoursOfOperation: M-Th 3-9  F-Sa 2-10  Su Noon-7

name: OHSO Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sat: 9:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 9:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Olvalde Farm and Brewing Company
description: Olvalde Farm and Brewing Company is a small, traditional brewery located on a family farm in Rollingstone, Minnesota. We aim to craft fine ales that honor ancient brewing traditions and culture.    Ale is a beverage made from the fermentation of cereal grains, accompanied in ancient times by other fermentable materials such as honey and tree saps. We aim to create ales that focus on the flavors of the fermentation, accentuate the flavor of the source material, and use herbs and spices only as complements. To this end, our ales are warm conditioned on their lees, unfiltered, and refermented in the bottle.

name: Overshores Brewing Co
description: Connecticut's own Belgian style brewery.

name: Patchwork Brewing Co.
description: Patchwork Brewing Co. opened it's doors on July 15, 2011.  A tiny brewery in a village of 2,200, we're living out our belief that every town, village, and city, regardless of size, should have its own microbrewery/brewpub.      Historically in America, this was the case.  Many of the early meetings involving the planning of the American Revolution, the Declaration of Independence, and the Constitution were held at local village pubs.  Now with the growing interest in the local, the homegrown, and the handmade, it's the perfect time to resurrect that tradition.
hoursOfOperation: Thurs 3-9 pm  Fri & Sat 3-10 pm  Sun & Mon 3-8 pm  Closed Tues/Weds

name: Pateros Creek Brewing - Main Brewery
description: Pronounced: Puh-tare-os and is the original name of the Cache la Poudre River. We are the second generation of craft brewing in Northern Colorado! We specialize in session ales and lagers but always have a 4-5 rotating taps as well. Come check out our tap room with a patio to enjoy Colorado's 300+ days of sunshine!
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Tue:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm  Closed Sundays.

name: Perennial Artisan Ales
description: Perennial Artisan Ales - Coming soon!

name: Phat Matt's Brewing Company
description: Located in beautiful Central Oregon, in the town of Redmond, Phat Matt’s brewery benefits tremendously from the purity of its pristine natural water source, the majesty of the Cascade mountain range and the people that call this high desert oasis home. Originating in the snow capped peaks, the purist glacial fed water flows completely submerged into the volcanic aquifer, allowing us to brew the most flawless of beers.    The entire brewing process is overseen by founding partner Matt Mulder. Building on his talents as both chef & restaurateur, Matt’s canvas is no longer a plate of food but a pint of beer. Blending the purest water with the finest Oregon hops Matt then filters the beer for clarity, resulting in the perfect pint.     Here at Phat Matt’s we fully embrace the philosophy that beer is for every occasion, anytime, anywhere.

name: Pikes Peak Brewing Company
description: We established our Monument, Colorado brewery in 2011 as a place for our community to connect and come together. We believe the best beers are ones shared with friends and we hope that wherever you find a Pikes Peak Beer, it finds you in good company.    We would rather brew for our neighbors than notoriety, so our beers are personal expressions that stay faithful to classic styles. We’re lucky to be at the source of some the country’s finest ingredients. From our abundant grains and fresh hops to our pristine waters, we’re inspired by our landscape to make beer as solid and iconic as our namesake mountain.    Since receiving such an overwhelming response, we’ve made it a priority to give back to the community that’s been so good to us. Our seasonal beers support organizations that make our corner of Colorado such a great place to live. At Pikes Peak Brewing Company, we’re elevating the craft of beer and invite you to join us on our trek to the summit.
hoursOfOperation: Mon -Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Ploughshare Brewing Co.
description: The brewery identity authentically reflects Nebraska history… homestead ideals of hard work, self-sufficiency, simple pleasures and wholesome refreshment. We are currently in final phases of fund raising.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Port City Brewing Company
description: The historic port city of Alexandria, VA has a proud tradition of brewing beer for the region that dates back to the 19th century.     Port City Brewing Company is proud to revive, celebrate and continue this rich brewing history in our modern artisanal brewery right outside of our Nation’s Capital.      We are an award winning brewery,  committed to producing world class quality beers without compromise for the DC and Mid Atlantic market.    Our mission is to be a reliable and innovative regional brewer of top quality beers that are delicious and well balanced, made from the finest ingredients available, and which celebrate their raw materials.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday 5–8p.m.  Thursday 5–8p.m.  Friday 3–9p.m. TOURS AT 6:30PM  Saturday 12–9 p.m. TOURS AT 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 & 6:00 PM  Sunday 12–6p.m. TOURS AT 2:00 & 3:00 PM

name: Port Jefferson Brewing Company
description: Port Jeff Brewing Company is located at 22 Mill Creek Road, within the Chandler Square walking mall. The brewery features a 7 barrel system which is capable of producing 217 gallons (about 86 cases) per brew. Beers are packaged in keg, 22 ounce and special release bottle formats for distribution throughout Long Island, NYC, and West Chester County bars, restaurants, and other retail beer outlets.    The facility opened for production in October of 2011.
hoursOfOperation: Daily Summer Hours: Noon-9PM    Tours   SAT Noon-4PM FREE (first come, first serve)

name: Prohibition Brewing Company
description: We are a full restaurant and brewery! We brew on sight and have other local brewery's on tap.

name: Prost Brewing Company
description: The Brewery was made by the Ziemann GmbH in 1963. It was installed at the Bucher Bräu in the German city of Grafenau and used there until 1984. In 1984 it was overhauled and sold to Brauerei Hümmer of Breitengüßbach, Germany, a village in the Franconian region of Bavaria.    Brauerei Hümmer started brewing beer in the Franconian village of Breitengüßbach in 1642. The brewery served the town for over 350 years until the spring of 2011. It made several styles including Altfränkisches Dunkel Bier, a rare specialty beer that we will revive in Denver.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Republic Brewing Company
description: RBC brews and serves world class beer in community minded little pub.  Four local restaurants deliver to your table. Enjoy the outdoor beer garden, hand-crafted sodas and sip award winning beer.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Reuben's Brews
description: We are a small family ran brewery in the Ballard district of Seattle, crafting tasty small batch brews.    Our story by grace!    Although only a month old at the time, our clever, thoughtful son, Reuben, came up with the idea of giving Adam a homebrewing kit for his birthday.  When Reuben and I took Adam to Bob’s (our friendly, neighborhood homebrew supply store) to pick up his kit, I was expecting to pick up a little tin of “beer mix” and a bucket to brew.  We were a bit surprised and overwhelmed by the seriousness of this beer-brewing business.  I thought, “Oh great, there’s more storage space gone once Adam gives up on this little hobby in a month’s time.”  Even though I rarely admit to being wrong now that we’re married, I couldn’t have been farther from the mark thinking that this would be an easily discarded hobby.  The first brewing system has been dwarfed by the upgraded and supersized brewhouse, and there has been no chance for the mash tun, brew kettle, or hot liquor tank to gather any dust!  Adam’s hobby turned into full-blown obsession, and in tribute to the little man who started it all, Reuben’s Brews was born!

name: Revival Brewing Company
description: Brewers of fine malted beverages headed up by award winning brew master Sean Larkin.

name: Revolver Brewing
description: Revolver Brewing is located thirty-five minutes southwest of Fort Worth in historic Granbury, TX. We are a Texas family owned business founded by father and son, Ron and Rhett Keisler, along with seasoned Master Brewer and Cicerone, Grant Wood. We don't take ourselves too seriously, but we take extreme pride in our craft. We believe we can brew world-class beer in the Texas countryside. We start with fresh water from our own Trinity Aquifer well and brew our beer incorporating seasonal local ingredients. We brew on custom made equipment built for us in the U.S. by proud craftsmen. We oversee our beer to the tap to ensure you are drinking the same beer we are. We believe that our knowledge of brewing, hard work and attention to each detail is evident in every beer we craft.

name: Rip Current Brewing
description: We believe Rip Current is the right name for our brewery as it reflects our vision for the brewery being a strong force that goes against the conventional beer style flow so as to change the entire beer landscape. We plan to brew uncompromising, assertive flavored ales and lagers bringing maximum variety to the southern California beer community.    At Rip Current Brewing, we plan to listen closely our customer’s preferences and use this to drive the wide variety of beer available at our tasting room and keg accounts. We will challenge drinkers’ pallets to enjoy new flavor experiences while not losing sight of what beers people demand on an ongoing basis. Our tap room will feature a rotating selection of seasonal and experimental styles complementing San Diego favorites like the IPA, Imperial IPA and hoppy amber. Rip Current will lever our extensive recipe library of award winning beers to maximize our customer’s enjoyment.

name: Roc Brewing Company
description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery Production  Monday – Saturday: 8am – 4pm    Tasting Room/Tap Room  Thursday – Friday: 5pm – 11pm  Saturday: 3pm – 11pm

name: Rockaway Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri:	4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 4:00 pm

name: Rolling Meadows Microbrewery
description: Rolling Meadows Brewery began as an appreciation of good beer and a desire to create a fine product utilizing the abundance of natural resources on our family farm. When Caren Trudeau and her son, Chris Trudeau established the brewery in 2011, they drew upon their combined experiences of homebrewing, craftsmanship and design detail to create the Rolling Meadows brand. Together with Connie and Dustin Regan they have been crafting Rolling Meadows' signature beers- Lincoln's Lager, Springfield Wheat and Abe's Ale- and bringing them to the Springfield area.

name: Rough Draft Brewing Company
description: We like beer. And word on the street is you do too. So you’ve been petitioning with your boss for beer breaks instead of smoke breaks, and trying to get a tap handle installed in the lunch room. There’s nothing wrong with that. That’s thinking outside the box right?     Here at Rough Draft, we like to reward that forward thinking with handcrafted beers that are as unique in character as those who drink it. We favor style over perfection and take joy in sharing our great-tasting creations with those who simply love to try new beer.     The beers that prove to be winners in our tasting room will be the ones we put into distribution.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 7:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 6:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Rushing Duck Brewing Company
description: Rushing Duck brewing Co. is a small craft brewery based out of Orange County, NY. Our plan is to produce a wide variety of tasty beers. Hoppy, malty, American-styled, Belgian influenced, barrel aged, sours, you name it. First and foremost we will be brewing beer that we like to drink. We hope you do too.

name: Saw Works Brewing Company
description: Traditional Beers Brewed For Today! Knoxville, Tennessee    Marble City Brewing Company became Saw Works in May 2012.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday-Friday 4-8pm and Saturday 2-8pm

name: Sawtooth Brewery
description: Sawtooth Brewery is Ketchum's local brewery. Come see us in the tap room for a pint from one of our 13 craft beers on draft!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Shades of Pale Brewing Company
description: Shades of Pale beer is all about the recipes, and adding subtle twists to classic styles.  Our goal is to create uniquely-brewed, handcrafted beers, with a consistent quality that brings people back.

name: Ship Bottom Brewery
description: Our humble beginnings started in the Summer of 1995 in Ship Bottom, NJ. Back then we made our first batch of beer using a home brew kit that consisted of a plastic bucket, large spoon, bottling bucket and some bottle caps. We hardly knew what what would be ahead of us 16 years later! We learned a lot over the last 16 years and feel that we really refined our craft. We are a small (Nano) brewer...See More

name: Side Project Brewing
description: A 100% barrel-aged, mostly barrel fermented, gypsy brewing project.

name: Smith Rock Brewing Company
description: Smith Rock Brewing is actually located about 9 miles south of its namesake in the town of Redmond. It’s Redmond’s 3rd brewery which originally opened up as a brewpub with a half-barrel brewing operation. In addition to it’s own brew, this neighborhood brewery serves up some food and boasts a pretty good gust tap list. If you live in Redmond and love craft beer, there’s no doubt you’ve already stopped in – but if you are passing thru, or visiting the town, stopping in is a must!  Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:30 am - 8:00 pm  Fri: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Smog City Brewing
description: Smog City Brewing is a Los Angeles based brewery devoted to putting its mark on the craft beer scene with exceptionally balanced and creatively inspired beers.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday - Friday 4:00pm - 9:00pm  Saturday 12:00pm - 8:00pm  Sunday 12:00pm - 6:00pm

name: Societe Brewing Company
description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner.  In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community.  The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego.  Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales.  The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future.  Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Solera Brewery
description: The brewery resides in an historical building that was built and operated as a movie theater from 1930 to the 1950's. Come join us for a pint, delicious food and the most spectacular view of Mt Hood's craggy North Face from our back patio.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Somerville Brewing Company
description: Slumbrew is all about the synergy between craft products and every day consumption. Well conceived, locally-sourced, quality products should be an every day part of our lives – not a unique occurrence. This is the spirit of Slumbrew.    Slumbrew is the research & development brand and concept of Somerville Brewing Company. Our mission is to brew unique, ingredient-driven beers that challenge common notions of what a beer should taste like. It is the result of nearly 15 years of beer travel and research by Caitlin Jewell and Jeff Leiter; and a decade of Jeff’s homebrewing recipe formulation.    We produce a lot of small-run, pilot beers at the Slumbrew Beerlab, but only a small number make their way to commercial production. The Somerville Brewing Company contracts with regional breweries to make the best recipes for wide-spread commercial release, but each recipe is an evolving process of refinement. This model for beer production provides an opportunity to experiment with innovative local ingredients to produce craft beers that stand apart from typical formulations.

name: Southern Appalachian Brewery
description: We are a local micro brewery based in Hendersonville, North Carolina (about 20 miles south of Asheville). We look forward to seeing you in the tasting room!
hoursOfOperation: We’re open Wednesday – Sunday  Wednesday – Friday 4pm-close  Saturday & Sunday 2pm-close

name: Spider Bite Brewing Co.
description: Beers are being distributed around Long Island and the city now. We will be posting new locations as the beers go on tap so keep checking back.

name: Steel String Brewery
description: Steel String Brewery is coming to Carrboro, North Carolina. A small brewery committed to producing consciously crafted, locally committed, superior quality ales.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Steel Toe Brewing
description: Here at STB we believe in working our ass off for what we believe in, following our passion, giving back to and working with the community that supports us, being conscious of the world around us, producing the best quality product we can and kicking back with great beer at the end of the day.    We are a small MN craft brewery with big dreams of staying small.

name: Tall Tales Brewery
description: We are a small, premium brewery based in Parsonsburg, MD. It is with pride that our brews are themed on folk lore. Tall Tales have been told for years, stories of real and fictitious people who do unbelievable and amazing things. These stories have become part of our culture and heritage. The legends of Paul Bunyan, Blue Ox, Calamity Jane, John Henry, Red Headed Step Child, Annie Oakley, Buffalo Bill and Excalibur. These are just a few of the legendary stories that have been told over the years. Stories that have been passed down from generation to generation. Our brewers have carefully developed beers that would be worthy of each legendary tall tale. These brews appeal to many different tastes. We are certain you will find something to delight your palette!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Tanglewood Branch Beer Co.
description: South Fayetteville's friendly neighborhood pub featuring fine house made ales and slow cooked seasonal pub cuisine.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Ten Fifty-Five Brewing
description: Ten Fifty-Five Brew Works was founded in 2011 by a couple of local Tucsonans, who share a few core beliefs. We'd like to share those with you.    So...we like beer, and we really like good beer. We want to put good beer in reach of those that want to enjoy it, and help nurture the developing brew culture in Tucson. We want to make beer for beer drinkers like us; adventurous beer drinkers that are just as likely to try something new as they are an old favorite. We are committed to the idea of the local nano-brewer; a small batch company using fresh ingredients and open minds to make some great tasting brew. Look for us soon, we'll be looking for you.

name: The Ale Apothecary
description: Producing the finest hand made beer using our own innovative brewing process, which melds the ancient art of brewing with traditions of wine & champagne production. With great ambition and intention, we open the window to mystery with every fermentation!

name: The Beer'd Brewing Co.
description: The Beer'd Brewing Co. is a nano brewery located in Stonington, Connecticut. We will welcome visitors into our tasting room to sample our offerings and purchase half gallon growlers for takeaway. Also an exclusive selection of local bars and restaurants will offer our ales on draft.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: The Bronx Brewery
description: We're a small craft brewery in the South Bronx, New York and have a maniacal love for two things in this world: beer and the Bronx. Cheers!    The Bronx Brewery is a craft brewer and distributor based in the South Bronx. It launched in 2011 by a small team with two things in common: a maniacal focus on creating high-quality beer and a passion for the Bronx. Its traditionally-crafted ales use only premium and minimally-processed materials to create fresh, bold beer from a borough known for its own uniquely bold character. The team is enthused to bring a rich brewing tradition back to the Bronx and craft a beer that the people of the Bronx and New York City can be proud to call their own.

name: The Independent Ale Works Company
description: As Denton's first craft brewery, we hope to brew great beer and bring it to everyone we can!

name: Third Street Brewhouse
description: The Third Street Brewhouse is a state-of-art craft brewery. Great facility, great brewers, great ingredients combine for great craft beers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 7:00 am - 5:00 pm  Fri: 7:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 pm

name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
description: Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.  Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Three Angels Brewing
description: Grow local, Brew local, Drink local. Great beers should be distributed on the backs of their followers, not on the trucks of distributors. Three Angels Brewing is a nano scale operation, focusing on the production and development of brews utilizing predominantly locally grown inputs. Economics is an after thought, Quality is a requirement, and Excellence is determined and awarded by consumers, not judges.

name: Track 7 Brewing Company
description: The Graham and Scott families established Track 7 Brewing Company as an outlet for creative expression through unique and artisanal beers. The name, Track 7 Brewing Company, was selected in part due to the brewery’s proximity to the old Western Pacific railroad tracks, west of Curtis Park, and as a nod to the integral role the railroad has and continues to play in Sacramento’s rich history.    Track 7's approach to beer is in the vein of the firmly-hopped West Coast tradition, but without fidelity to a singular “style”. This unfocused approach allows Track 7 to experiment with all varieties of beer, regardless of American, Belgian, English, or German inspiration.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Treehaus Brewery
description: Treehaus Craft Brewery is a start-up family owned and operated micro brewery located in Charlottesville, VA. Curious about our name? We were planning to start our brewing operation in a tree house! We lost the ability to acquire Treehouse as an LLC so we switched "house" to "haus" and voila! Treehaus Craft Brewery was born!    The treehouse fell through but we have started construction on our BrewHaus to house our test system so that we can perfect our recipes.     Our master brewer, Christoph Reinicke, attended Seibold Institute for brewing and interned with Starr Hill Brewery in Crozet, Va from 2011-2012. His mother Ann also attended Seibold, studying brewery management. Make sure you follow us on Facebook for the latest happenings! Thank you for checking us out and we hope to serve you soon!

name: Trickster's Brewing Company
description: We are a production brewery nestled in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho just doing draft right now with bottles to follow by December 2012.  We have 5 year round brands which are as follows: Blonde Ale, Amber Ale, Brown Ale, IPA, and Extra Pale Ale along with seasonal beers that are always changing.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Triple C Brewing Company
description: In October 2011 Triple C Brewing Company incorporated and our beer dreams started coming true. Triple C are Chris, Chris, and Christina. Chris and Chris met while working at a local bank and quickly realized we weren't cut out for banking and dreamed of owning our own business. While home brewing late one evening, the three Cs had a crazy idea to start a brewery. All of our hard work is finally paying off and we anticipate an early summer 2012 opening of our South End microbrewery! We can't wait to share our beer with Charlotte and beyond and look forward welcoming everyone to our spacious tap room very soon.
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY - closed   TUESDAY 5 - 9 pm  WEDNESDAY 5 - 9 pm  THURSDAY 5 - 9 pm  FRIDAY 4 - 9 pm  SATURDAY 2 - 9 pm  SUNDAY 1 - 6 pm

name: Tuckahoe Brewing Company
description: Tuckahoe Brewing Company was established in January of 2011 by four friends who had been brewing beer for fun for several years. We were brewing five and ten gallon batches while we barbequed and enjoyed drinking beer with family and friends. Going to the next level and brewing commercially was a thought that was always in the back of each our minds, but after we heard enough of our friends say ...the same thing, we decided to take the idea seriously.     We expect to begin with four recipes, a Belgian Wit, an English Style Porter, a Pale Ale. Cape May County is a beautiful place, and brewing a beer that captures that beauty in both its ingredients and the finished product is one of our goals. We want to provide the people of Cape May County beers that will always remind them of home.    Please look for our beers on tap in bars and restaurants around Cape May County, and bottled for take home as well. Also, please stop by and see us this fall at 9 Stoney Road in Dennis Township.

name: Twelve String Brewing Company
description: Located in Spokane Valley, WA, 12 String Brewing Company marries the brewer’s love of music, especially the 12 string guitar, with his passion for brewing spectacular beer. Our goal is to craft a variety of great beer in the Northwest tradition. We will also feature several other beers from our brewing friends.    Yes, 12 string brewing company crafts great beer in the Northwest tradition. This is an example of a small scale brewing company at its best! The brewery includes an onsite tap room with plenty of seating and from time to time, great live music.  And when not brewing one of his great beers, you just may just find the brewer hanging out, playing his 12 string guitar.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri:	3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Adam's NW Bistro & Brewery
description: Adam's Northwest Bistro & Brewery focuses on taking Northwest ingredients, and turning it into something good and comforting on your plate. We pride ourselves in making our dishes from scratch, from our slow cooked braises and hand formed burgers, to our hot soups and even our Bacon! Not only is our food from scratch but we brew our own hand-crafted beers next door also. Our goal is to provide you with service and atmosphere as if you were eating in our home.

name: Twisted Crew Brewing Company
description: A micro-brewery that offers quality craft beer for carryout in half gallon refillable glass containers. Also, check back in the future to find out where and when it will be available at your nearby bar or store.

name: Union Craft Brewing Company
description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

name: Upstate Brewing Company
description: Upstate Brewing Company is a new production micro-brewery in the Southern Tier (Finger Lakes Region) of New York state. We are open Saturday afternoons 1-4 & you can watch our brew team in action most Saturdays. Our beers are currently on tap at restaurants and bars throughout the Southern Tier.
hoursOfOperation: We are open Saturdays from 1-4 & ALL tastings are FREE! ANY growler will be filled for $8 (Cash/Check only for now)

name: Urban Family Brewing
description: We are a family-run brewery located in the heart of Ballard, Seattle.

name: Van Houzen Brewing Company
description: Van Houzen Brewing Company is a small operation focused on bringing you high-alcohol Artisan Ales.  Founded in early 2011, we completed our build out and became licensed on Oct. 31st, 2011… Halloween.  We are a family owned and operated business set up in the lower level of Sugar Grove Gathering Place in Newton, Iowa.      Our story began as many others had: a fascination with beer, the many different styles and processes of brewing, the extensive history of this versatile beverage, home brewing, and of course, consumption of beers big and small, from every corner of the world.  The eventual result of all this has evolved into a commercial nano-brewery.      While our capacity is quite small, all our beers are hand crafted and unfiltered, offering you the most true and pure representation of traditional beer styles.  VHBC employs an all natural brewing process incorporated from Belgian, German, and American brewing practices, executed on a custom designed brewhouse.      We are excited to offer four styles to the public, available through reputable Cafes and Alehouses in Eastern and Central Iowa.  Ask your local pub to give it a shot, support Iowa beer, and Prost!

name: Virtue Cider
description: Virtue works in partnership with local farmers, using the highest quality Midwestern heirloom apples, to produce ciders that combine old world traditions with modern craft cider fermentation and aging techniques. Our cider house is located in Fennville, Michigan.

name: Westport Brewing Company
description: Westport Brewing Company is the first microbrewery on the Washington Coast since 1944 when Pacific Brewing Company closed its doors. Emulating traditional brewing conditions, we brew our beer with local water without amendments, regionally grown hops, and domestic malts. We take advantage of our unique location, on a peninsula between the Pacific Ocean and Grays Harbor, to ferment our beer in polyethylene fermenters at ambient temperatures. This results in smooth, clear, unhurried beer with sparkling clarity, deep, complex flavor profiles, and remarkable consistency between styles.    We currently brew 19 styles of beer and are always exploring new recipes to appeal to the craft-wise thirsty palates of the region.    We currently brew in a 3-Barrel brewhouse but have plans to expand in the near future.    Our brewery welcomes visitors Thursday through Monday, noon to 6PM, each week to sample our wide variety of beer, visit with Mark and Robin and enjoy the beauty of Westport and the Washington Coast!
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Main Cidery
description: We are the first, and only, licensed and bonded cidery in the Piedmont of the Carolinas.  We produce various types of Award Winning Hand-Crafted Hard Ciders with a commitment to sustainable agricultural practices.     As an extension of Windy Hill Orchard and Cidery, we are family owned and operated and located in York, SC.     Please be sure to visit our facebook page and our orchard website for details about upcoming events, product news, and hours and directions.

name: Wrecking Bar Brewpub
description: The most exciting new brewpub in Atlanta! A cornerstone of both Little Five Points and Inman Park at the corner of Moreland and Austin Ave. Brewpub on lower level facing Austin.

name: 1188 Brewing Company
description: Grant County's first brewery, we are nestled in the city of John Day, Oregon surrounded by beautiful mountains, rivers, and ranchlands. Stop by for a cold pint, or to fill a growler or two. In addition to our own beers brewed on site, we also offer a number of guest taps from small breweries around Oregon.

name: 3rd Wave Brewing Co.
description: 3rd Wave Brewing Co. is a dream between to friends who love the beach and love to brew beer. We hope you visit us often and enjoy Good Friends, Good Waves, Great Beer!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 6:00pm

name: 4 Brothers Blended Beer
description: 4 Brothers Custom Blended Craft Beer evolved from a combination of passion, innovation, experimentation, configuration and fermentation; followed by extensive libation and imbibition. Yep, brewing blended beer is damn hard work. Especially the tasting part. Cheers for Libations!    Until we 4 Brothers started the process of evolving our avocation into our vocation, there really hasn't been a true innovation in the beer industry in years. Maybe since the monks first put their quills to parchment and recorded their initial beer recipes.    IPAs, Porters, Pilsners, Lagers, Browns, Reds, Blondes. All magnificent purebreds. 4 Brothers is the World Class Custom Blended Craft Beer, combining the best qualities of each.    Our signature beer, Sibling Rivalry, combines the taste profiles of a darker beer, a lighter beer and a hoppier beer to produce an incredibly drinkable and delicious beer.    4 Brothers custom blended craft beers are perfect for enthusiasts, fun-lovers and those who don't take themselves too seriously. Yep; drinkability, flavor and authenticity. And we think that is something to shout about, despite the monk's vow of silence.

name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery
description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  8:00am - 4:00pm Tue:  8:00am - 4:00pm Fri:  8:00am - 4:00pm

name: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro
description: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro is located in Greenville Michigan. We are excited to bring this new establishment to our community. We feature our own locally brewed beers on site, and our Bistro features a full menu of American Cuisine from appetizers, soups & salads, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrees & Desserts. We opened in late October 2012! Stop in and see us soon

name: 7 Devils Brewing Co
description: The 7 Devils Brewing Company is a small craft brewery on a mission to bring the inspiration of our coastal area to the tap. Walking through our doors should create the same restorative feelings of walking toward the shore. We wish to be a sustainable business that is socially, ethically and environmentally responsible and provides a place where passionate people converge to create a positive environment and inspired products. Our goal is to enhance the community in which we live and succeed financially so that we can provide family wage jobs for creative people in a progressive workplace. With core values of efficiency, ingenuity, pride in craftsmanship, environmental and social responsibility and superior customer service, the 7 Devils Brewing Company is crafting the change we wish to see in the world.

name: 7venth Sun Brewing
description: Belgian-style beer, IPAs, second use spirit barrel aged beer, oak aged sour beer.

name: Abandon Brewing Company
description: Overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, we brew many different Belgian and Farmstyle craft beers for the Penn Yan and surrounding Finger Lakes areas.

name: Abigaile Brewery
description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.

name: Aftershock Brewing Company
description: After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.    At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Tue:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Tue: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Wed - Sun: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Against The Grain Brewery
description: Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.    Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.    Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

We use exclusively the hops consciously grown on our own farm, as well as any other farm bounty we can put into our mash tun, brew kettle, or fermenter! Our ultimate goal is to grow every ingredient that goes into our beer.    We are on 25 acres North of Eugene near the beautiful Willamette River. We make beer that reflects our connection to the Earth.

name: Aloha Beer Company
description: Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha.    We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.

name: Alphabet City Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 and proud to be one of the few New York City breweries. NYC has had a rich brewing history that reaches back over 100 years. This has given ACBC a strong foundation on which to build and offers a challenge we enthusiastically embrace everyday. We started as two roommates in the Alphabet City neighborhood of the East Village of NYC brewing beer in our kitchen and are excited to be on the verge of opening a brew pub there in the near future. We love beer and love sharing our beers with friends and that's what our style of brewing is all about. It's about camaraderie and the group experience. We provide brews for the table that everyone can gather around; brews perfect for the meal you're about to have or the story about to be shared - brews for celebrations and brews for collaboration - we brew for you.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  12:00pm - 2:00am Sat:  12:00pm - 2:00am  Sun thru Thu: 12 noon to 12 midnight  Fri & Sat: 12 noon to 2 am

name: Washougal
hoursOfOperation: Wed, Thurs 3pm-close.  Fri, Sat, Sun 11am-close.

name: Amplified Ale Works
description: Alex Pierson and JC Hill got their noses in the restaurant business in 2009, opening the first California Kebab at San Diego State University. After a few years, it was clear they needed to spread the kebab love elsewhere, and decided on a run down old resturant site with an ocean view..    Craft beer has been a part of the concept since day 1, and JC's severe homebrewing addiction ignited the need for their own brewing system at the new establishment - Amplified Ale Works was born. Why Amplified you ask? Two parts – one, our obsession with live music (a band was formed between CK staff in 2009, playing in JC’s garage ever since), and two, our take on the meaning of Amplified- to us, it means intensifying the craft beer experience by staying true to our homebrewing roots. We hope to see you soon at CK Brewpub enjoying a fresh ale on our biergarten patio at the beach. Prost!

name: Antietam Brewery
description: Our journey began with the opening of Benny's Pub 5 years ago. We have become known for our excellence in customer service and our strong passion for creating the best experiences and memories for our patrons. We are an American version of the throw-back 'Public Houses' that were the forefathers of today's 'Pubs'. We create delicious soups from scratch, unique sandwiches and dinner entrees using the best local ingredients.    Crafting delicious beer was the next natural step for Benny's Pub. Our loyal customers are passionate about the food and beer they drink- and we promise to deliver. Consumers want healthy, organic produce and food- and they want it to be local. Our menu highlights local meats, fresh cheeses and now hand-crafted beer brewed right in front of you.

name: Apocalypse Ale Works
description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!

Open four days a week, you can come in and enjoy various sized tastings of all of our current beers, get growler fills to-go, and relax and enjoy the atmosphere with friends and fellow beer fans.  We're a 21+ facility, but can make limited exceptions for designated drivers and certain other cases (on Thursday & Sunday) if you check with us ahead of time.  Drink well and do good work!

name: Argilla Brewing Co. @ Pietro's Pizza
description: We first opened our doors in Prices Corner in 1978, later settling in Pike Creek for over 20 years. After Homebrewing for several years, we've decided to expand to our new location (2667 Kirkwood Highway - Newark, DE) and install a 1.5 barrel brewery, making us the smallest brewery in the state of Delaware. We brew beers to please all kinds, including an Amber Ale, Rye Stout and an IPA that recently won a ribbon at the Delaware State Fair Battle of the Brews.    Since we're so small, we'll be sure to experiment with several different styles of beer, so there will always be something new to check out.  Along with the beer, we'll have the same great pizzas we've been serving up for over 33 years. We'll also have soups, salads, pub sandwiches and select entrees. Also be on the lookout for our occasional beer dinners and pizza beer dinners.   We're just as passionate about our food as we are about our beer.

name: Back Alley Brewery
description: Back Alley Brewery was established in 2012 as a privately owned brewery and sports bar. It offers several hand crafted beers and ales. Come join us for great brew and watch your favorite sporting events.

name: Back East Brewing Company
description: Back East was formed by Edward Fabrycki, Jr. and Tony Karlowicz, two cousins with a passion for great-tasting, high-quality beer. Back East brews several different styles of high-quality ales and lagers and distributed on draft and in 64 oz growlers and 750 ml bottles at fine establishments throughout the Greater Hartford area.     Although originally from Connecticut, Edward began to home-brew while living in San Diego in the early 1990s. He eventually moved Back East to Connecticut in 2000, with the dream of someday operating a Craft brewery. As a Professional Engineer, Edward enjoys the technical aspects of brewing. Tony developed his appreciation for Craft beer during his college years in Vermont, and always imagined launching a brewery. An entrepreneur at heart and a CPA with extensive experience in accounting, auditing, and insurance, Tony loves building a successful business from the ground up. Tony and Edward began homebrewing and experimenting with different recipes in early 2006, and immersed themselves in all things Craft beer.     Over this time, we have developed several exciting recipes that we are proud to put the Back East name on. Our beer will be brewed at our small, but state-of-the-art brewery in Bloomfield.

name: Backpocket Brewing
description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

name: Backshore Brewing Company
description: There's something about the beach that feeds your soul, keeps you young, and demands your return. Of the millions who visit, a few are distracted by romantic visions of life at the beach and are left behind, never to return to the "real world." It's an existence unaffected by time or authority. Days and nights blend together, signaled by sunrises over the ocean and sunsets in the bay. Their hearts become gorged with rebellion and pride, inherent in all Americans but enjoyed by few. It is with the same celebration of freedom and togetherness that we have conceived this beer. We brew our beer in the salty air with our toes in the sand and the sun on our faces. Lucky for you, we can't finish it all. Please have as much fun drinking Backshore Beer as we have making it. We've spent serious time creating it. Have a ridiculous time enjoying it.

name: Backwoods Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned, and locally brewing in the Backwoods.    We are a 10 BBL Brewery in our first year of operation. The Brewery is nestled in the Heart of the Gorge. The Waters Family operates the brewpub and loves to serve our customers. We cannot wait to serve you and show you what our beer and the Gorge has to offer!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  3:00pm - 9:00pm  Thu - Sun: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: BAD Brewing Company
description: BAD Brewing Company is a small Microbrewery locatedin downtown Mason, MI that opened in the Summer of 2012. We will offer a wide selection of hand crafted beers. We will have at least five house beers on tap, with several more on a rotating basis. All of the beers are hand crafted on site by the owner, and new recipes are always in the works! BAD Brewing looks forward to serving Mason and the Greater Lansing area the finest hand crafted beers possible. Have a BAD day!

name: Badger Mountain Brewing
description: We are Wenatchee's largest craft brewery. We have 12 taps that pour our beer, guest beer, and cider. Together with Country Boys BBQ you can't go wrong.

name: Baeltane Brewing
description: Baeltane Brewing is a small production brewery and tasting room located in Novato, CA (Marin County).    Our Marin brewery proudly produces artisanal ales for the discerning consumer. The beers we produce feature the artistry of our Head Brewer, Alan Atha, specializing in Belgian, French and West Coast Ale styles.    We might be small but our impression is huge.

name: Bainbridge Island Brewing Company
description: Making a great beer requires a combination of art and science.  Science, in knowing what the gear and the ingredients can do.  Art, in imagining what beer can be.  Whether it's excellent versions of classic styles, or boundary pushing experimental brews, we strive to blend the art and science of beer.    But beer is also a social beverage.  The pub is part of our culture, and here in the Northwest that means locally brewed craft beer.  The local brewery is part of the fabric of the community, giving it character, individuality, and indeed, an air of hometown pride.  Bainbridge Island is certainly a great place to live, but it's been lacking one thing: our own craft microbrewery.  Well, no longer!  Bainbridge Island Brewing is the island's brewery, and the island is as much a part of us as we are of it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 9:00pm  Tues - Fri: 3:00 - 9:00 pm  Sat & Sun: 12:00 - 9:00 pm   Mon: Closed for Brew Day

name: Brewery and Beer Gardens!
description: Barrelhouse Brewing Co. is nestled in the rolling hills of San Luis Obispo County on the edge of Paso Robles and in the heart of wine country…what will our neighbors think?    As you turn off Ramada Drive and onto Marquita Way, you will meander around a majestic oak tree.  This majestic white oak stands in the middle of where the road would have gone, if not for this tree’s historical significance.  If you look closely at the trunk of this old oak, you will notice the mark of an equal armed cross carved into its bark. The cross was carved sometime between 1775 and 1776 when Spanish Lt. Colonel Juan Batista de Anza led more than 240 men, women and children on an overland journey from the frontier New Spain to settle in Alta California. During that 1,200 mile journey, the very thirsty Colonel carved the cross to signify the perfect location for a brewery…well, that’s our story at Barrelhouse and we can’t exactly prove it, but we’re sticking to it!  Historians believe that Juan Batista de Anza or someone on his team carved the cross to indicate a safe place to camp.  We think it makes a sweet logo, too!    After you pass the old oak, make a left on Limestone Way and look for the dragon fly…you can’t miss it.     Stop by, grab a brew or two and relax.  Enjoy our glorious beer gardens with friends while you listen to the waterfall and experience the central coast the way it was meant to be enjoyed…outside.  You can also pull up to the bar inside the brewery where you’ll feel like you’re part of the brewing action. Along with our amazing line-up of beers, we will also feature our very own custom crafted rootbeers.  If you ask nicely, we can even float a scoop of ice cream in your favorite sarsaparilla or stout.

Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

We are an independent, traditional style brewer bringing innovation to craft beer design.    At Beer By Design, we believe that fresh quality beer produced locally, using the finest ingredients and without chemicals in processing or for preservation is the key to success among beer drinking enthusiasts.
