name: Beerded Brothers Brewing
description: Beerded Brothers Brewing Company is started by two step-brothers, Gabriel Pedersen and Max Scudder.    Beerded Brothers Brewing is a 1BBL nanobrewery located in a newly built shop in East Vancouver. Utilizing a mire 540 sq. ft., Beerded Brothers might compete for the smallest nanobrewery in Vancouver, and maybe the country!

name: Begyle Brewing
description: Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.    Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

name: Production Facility & Tasting Room
description: Micro Brewery in Vista, CA - North San Diego County

name: Below the Radar Brewing Company
description: Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!  Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.    BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.    BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.    BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.    An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.

name: Bemidji Brewing Company
description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.

name: Benchmark Brewing Company
description: Benchmark Brewing is all about delicious beer, beer that we want to take home and drink. We want consistently awesome beer that you can rely on to be the gold standard of the style.  Our year round beers are low in alcohol and high in flavor; we often find that it is nice to be able to enjoy a beer or two and keep your wits about you.  We also know that there are times when a ten percent beer is just what you need to keep you warm at night; to that end we will celebrate the seasons, months, weeks, or whatever we feel needs celebration with specialty releases that will vary wildly in alcohol content and style.  No matter the style or strength all Benchmark Beer will set the standard for its kind.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Big Bend Brewing Company
description: To give West Texas a brand of beer that embodies the qualities of liberty and persistence that make the people of Big Bend exceptional.    A Microbrewery Coming to Alpine Texas with Head Brewer Steve Anderson from Live Oak in Austin

name: Big Elm Brewing Company
description: Big Elm Brewing is a production brewery in Sheffield, MA. Bill and Christine Heaton, former owners/brewers for Pittsfield Brew Works are canning and kegging their beers which are available all over Berkshire County.

name: Big Head Brewing Company
description: We are a local craft brewery crafting the finest craft beers. Our brewery is in start up mode. We will be on tap in local establishments around Milwaukee in early 2013.

name: Big Rip Brewing Company
description: The Big Rip was founded by two friends who caught the beer and wine making bug years ago and decided to throw in together to start this brewery. We don’t have goals of taking over the world or creating beer that only appeals to a select few. Instead, we want to create unique beers that appeal to both beer-nerds and beer-curious people.
hoursOfOperation: Friday: Noon – 10pm  Saturday: Noon – 10pm  Sunday: Noon – 4pm

name: Bistronomy B2B
description: New Mexican products from grass-fed beef to fresh craft beers!

name: Blind Squirrel
description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday - 11:00am- 8:00pm  Friday & Saturday- 11:00am - 10:00pm  Closed Sunday

name: Blue Bee Cider
description: Virginia’s first and only urban cidery, Blue Bee Cider is located in the heart of downtown Richmond’s Old Manchester district at the fall line of the James River. The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia’s native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate apple blossoms.    At Blue Bee Cider, we aim to create balanced ciders true to their Virginia roots from a culinary perspective and true to the fruit from a cidermaking one. Each apple variety ferments differently, creating its own flavors which vary year to year depending on weather conditions. Blue Bee Ciders are never chapitalized (it’s so sunny in the South, who needs to add sugar?) and never watered down. We use raw juice and ferment it straight off the press.

name: Blue Stallion Brewing Company
description: Blue Stallion Brewing Co. is the newest craft brewery in Lexington, Kentucky. We make the finest German lagers and British Ales focusing on traditional brewing techniques and ingredients. We want to bring Lexington an experience in beer not available anywhere else.

name: Bombshell Brewing Company
description: Bombshell Brewing Company is a family-owned start-up brewery in Philadelphia, producing hand-crafted traditional and not-so-traditional ales and lagers.

name: Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant
description: Great Beer - Great Food - Great Service - Great Friends - Great Value    Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant's goal is to provide a fresh, unique and engaging destination that will not only attract new visitors to West Jefferson and Ashe County but will also be a place that residents are proud to call their own.     We are Ashe County's first and only Commercially licensed Craft Beer Brewery and we brew small batches of hand crafted beers weekly that are only available in our Tap Room.    With two fully stocked bars we have over 30 craft beers on tap that are constantly rotating along with a large selection of bottled beers with a strong focus on North Carolina craft beers. You will be hard pressed to find a better craft beer selection.    We have an affordable menu featuring casual-upscale high-quality items using fresh and locally grown ingredients prepared by our talented Chef and kitchen team.    Come and see what all the excitement is about in wonderful West Jefferson.    Committed to Excellence- Dedicated to Community
hoursOfOperation: Lunch Mon-Sun 11:30 - 2::30  Dinner Mon-Thu  5:00 - 9:00  Dinner Fri-Sat 5:00 - 11:00

name: Brevard Brewing Co.
description: The world of beer is increasingly one of two extremes.  While large macro-breweries compete to produce the lightest, most flavorless, adjunct laden beers possible, craft breweries strive to out-do one another by making each beer hoppier, bolder, and stronger than the next.  At Brevard Brewing Company, we have set out to give beer lovers the best of both worlds – beer that is both drinkable and flavorful.  We are the only brewery in Western North Carolina to specialize in lagers.     What’s the big deal about lagers? Lagers are cold-fermented and aged over twice as long as ales.  They are more costly to produce, and take more patience to brew. Unlike the big flavors of ales that hide imperfections, lagers demand a higher standard of quality and care, making them a rare find in the craft beer world.  But the result is worth the attention to detail--this painstaking process creates a beer that is clean, smooth, and crisp as opposed to the bold, complex flavor of ales.  The imported German barley, hops, and yeast delivers delicate and refined beers that are delicious and flavorful, yet supremely drinkable.    While German-inspired lagers are my specialty, I will never forget the wonderful contributions that American home brewers have made to the beer world over the past thirty years.  I typically find myself drinking a cold, smooth, Pilsner, but every now and again, my taste buds crave a bold, hoppy American IPA.  This is why Brevard Brewing Company offers American ales in addition to German lagers.  No matter your mood or what you are craving, we have the right beer for you.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Tue:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 12:00am Sat:  2:00pm - 12:00am Sun:  2:00pm - 9:00pm  Monday-Thursday:  4:00pm - 10:00pm  Friday & Saturday: 2:00pm - 12:00am  Sunday: 2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: Brewery Ferment
description: Ferment is an inviting, casual, neighborhood brewery that is truly all about the beer. We blend traditional styles and techniques with a new world approach to brewing, influenced by traditions throughout the world while remaining true to Northern Michigan.    We believe in emphasizing our Midwestern roots  This area has ample farmland, and hops grow perfectly here. We aim to make the most of what local growers have to offer, brewing with Northern Michigan ingredients as much as possible. We also have a small menu of unique bar snacks and outside food is welcome. We have five flagship beers on draft along with rotating specialties and bottled conditioned beers. Stop in, have a pint and you will notice the local difference.

name: Brewery Rickoli
description: We are proud to announce the recent opening of Brewery Rickoli, The Premier Brewery in Wheat Ridge Colorado, serving freshly brewed craft beer and offering a relaxed and friendly space to gather. We are located by the Southwest corner of 44th Ave. and Wadsworth Blvd.    Our take on beer is simple – Use great ingredients and brew for flavor!  Rickoli’s respects the liquid in the glass and wants to help elevate beer to a refined drinking experience. That’s why we use the finest ingredients and brew in a leisurely manner. The beer tells us when it’s ready. We refuse to be a slave to production deadlines.  Wheat Ridge Colorado is a relaxed community just west of Denver with easy access from I-70. Wheat Ridge was one of the few remaining enclaves along the Front Range without a microbrewery. This changed in November 2012!  We are dedicated to providing our local neighborhood with a place to relax and have a pint close to home.    Our Brew master, Rick Abitbol has been professionally brewing award winning beers along the Front Range for over a decade.  Rick is respectful of beer styles and traditional brewing technique.  And has long been an innovator of style and not afraid to color outside the lines. He was one of the first brewers to explore the Black IPA which has since come to be regarded as a new style in judging guidelines.   We love hops! That’s not to say you won’t find any wonderfully malty creations on tap there are many, but what you will notice is the variety in our hoppy selections.  Be on the lookout for Rick’s special brews!    We’re Talking Much Better Beer!  We are pleased to feature a great selection of Gluten Reduced Beer.  All Rickoli’s brews that do not contain wheat are considered gluten reduced.  Making great craft beer more accessible to everyone.      Our glass rinsing stations insure a beer clean glass every time! We want you to drink beer not sanitizer! We hope you will stop by for a pint or two!

description: Copper Harbor's first and only microbrewery, and the first in Keweenaw county in over a hundred years. Bringing hand crafted beer to you is our goal while infusing it with the fun and beauty of the surrounding area.    We'll have our beer on tap, growlers to go, and bottle sales from the cooler ( Sometime in late June early July the bottles will be available). You'll also be able to buy it in stores through out the area ( Once we get the labels approved, again hoping to get distribution going by July ). Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase in the brewery

name: Broken Bottle Brewery
description: Broken Bottle Brewery is what we like to refer to as a "nanobrewery", which basically means that it is smaller than a microbrewery, but bigger than Donavan's garage (and more awesome)! We have a small brewing area in the back and a taproom up front (also known as the Lair of Deliciousness). Our goal is to create the small neighborhood bar feeling that Albuquerque is lacking. Most importantly, we concentrate on producing small craft batches of the unique recipes that we have developed over the years.

Please come see us at the brewery in Angola – any Chapman’s employee you meet will also be an owner of the company and wants to hear what you think of our craft.

name: Cheaha Brewing Company
description: Cheaha Brewing Company is a brewpub in the 1885 L&N freight house. We currently serve hand crafted beer produced in Alabama and nearby. Soon, we will begin brewing our own beers and have them on tap. Our beer is paired with uniquely prepared dishes incorporating as much locally produced and all natural food as possible.

name: Chelsea Alehouse
description: Located in Chelsea’s historic Clocktower Complex, the Chelsea Alehouse Brewery opened its doors in December 2012.  Featuring American and English style Ales, we aim to provide a wide variety of choices for the beer connoisseur and occasional beer drinker as well.    In our pub, enjoy a view of our American-made tanks at the bar, get cozy in a booth or enjoy a pint outside in our beer garden.  Our deli-style kitchen features delicious grilled sandwiches, wraps, housemade hummus and salsa, or try our meat cheese plate featuring local cheeses.    We’re family friendly with menu options for kids and have changing tables in both our restrooms.

name: Claim 52 Brewing
description: We are a 3 1/2 barrel small-batch craft brewery located in Eugene, Oregon. Our beers are European influenced styles made in the Northwest tradition with the best Northwest ingredients. We focus on quality, flavor, and community.     We love beer, and we love food. And we love what happens when friends get together and enjoy great beer alongside fantastic local food. Our beers will be available at restaurants and bars in the Eugene area that share our philosophy on quality, local ingredients, and community.

name: Claremont Craft Ales
description: Located in eastern Los Angeles County in a picturesque college town, Claremont Craft Ales is dedicated to bringing premium hand-crafted ales to the local community.  With a focus on freshness and variety, CCA has quickly become a favorite watering hole for a clientele that places a strong value on locally-made authentic products.  As CCA grows into the future, we are excited to bring this beer philosophy to a wider audience.

name: Brewpub
description: Crop believes in simplicity…..    We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.    We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.    We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.    Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Culture Brewing Co.
description: We can all agree, it’s a great time to be a beer lover. There are more quality beers to enjoy than ever. More new flavors and interpretations of styles. And more people dedicating their lives to the craft of brewing. Culture Brewing Co began with their own long-time passion for beer. Culture’s three owners, John Niedernhofer (Owner), Steve Ragan (Owner/Brew Master) and Dennis Williams (Owner) began brewing together long ago. From their earliest brainstorms about taking things to the next level, the goal was always to create more than just great beer. Bringing their approachable style to the already rich community of the craft beer industry, they opened their brewery in February 2013.    Our modern and rustic microbrewery is the ideal showcase for our beer. The brewery is our tasting room, with everything you need and nothing you don’t. The tasting room features an inviting beer service counter, ample indoor and outdoor space for visitors with an ocean breeze. The tasting room’s 12-tap serving system (including Nitro) allows us to deliver a large variety of our crafted beers. The on-site Brewhouse is equipped with a 10 barrel Premier Stainless System including a boil kettle, mash tun, 5 fermenters and 3 brite/serving tanks. With our beers gaining fans every day, we couldn’t be more excited about what we’ll brew next, and who we’ll get to share it with.

name: Dangerous Man Brewing Company
description: Dangerous Man Brewing Company’s mission is to be a destination tap house brewery in Minneapolis, focusing on high-quality small-batch production beers. With ever-changing taps, we will be the hub for lovers of beer and those seeking everything from the traditional to the extreme in their glass.
hoursOfOperation: Friday: 3pm-Midnight  Saturday: Noon-Midnight

name: Daredevil Brewing Co
description: Daredevil Brewing Co. is an independent, central Indiana based craft brewery that was founded by two award winning craft brewers, Bill Ballinger and Michael Pearson, and a talented craft beer enthusiast, Shane Pearson, to bring their  flavorful interpretations of craft beer to market. We know from experience that brewing eclectic, aggressively fun beers is not for the timid. Fortunately, the only thing we like better than a challenge is drinking the end result.

name: Camden Yards
description: In celebration of the ballpark’s 20th Anniversary season, Delaware North Companies Sportservice, the food, beverage and retail partner of the Baltimore Orioles, has partnered with beloved former Oriole Rick Dempsey to create Dempsey's Brew Pub & Restaurant.   The longtime catcher, a member of the Orioles Hall of Fame and 1983 World Series MVP, is also a member of the Orioles broadcast team and will make frequent appearances at Dempsey’s.   The full-service brew pub, with a décor featuring plenty of Rick Dempsey and Orioles memorabilia, accommodates 150 in the dining area, 100 at the bar,   and another 80 in outdoor seating on its Eutaw Street patio. We serve lunch and dinner seven days a week, year-round, featuring broad menus that are sure to hit every taste.   And then there’s the beer! Dempsey’s features more than 20 bottled beers, including 10 local and regional craft brews, as well as four distinct draft beers brewed onsite, all featuring baseball-themed names.  Please stop in and see us for lunch, dinner or to host a special celebration.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Desert Eagle Brewing Company
description: Desert Eagle Brewing Company, the brainchild of brewmaster and co-owner Joe Campbell, was founded not only upon his passion for home brewing while in college, but also upon his German heritage and inherent knowledge of quality beer.     After perfecting the process of creating a great craft brew, this dream finally became a reality in 2011. Partnering with co-owner Jeff Bryant, the team became committed to creating great Craft Beers. Vowing to maintain the integrity of their product by using the best ingredients possible, they include whole cone hops in every step of the brewing process. Seizing the opportunity to participate in the downtown revival, which is slotted for light-rail expansion, Desert Eagle Brewing Company saw the opening of its taproom in October 2012 in Downtown Mesa – an important location of focus for the two Mesa residents.     Desert Eagle’s commitment to both quality, and its patrons, is a true testament of the team’s mission and dedication to serving great beer in an even greater community.

name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm

name: Dirty Bucket Brewing Company
description: Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. started over exactly that...a dirty bucket. Brewing in the garage and pondering the idea of creating a place where we can share our beers and passion for creating them. After we took that leap of faith towards brewing as a profession we needed a name. Holding true to our "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up and the more we thought about it the more we realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion.    By creating smaller batches we are able to maintain an intimate level of craftsmanship and rotate different styles of beers more frequently giving our customers a wider range of beers to choose from
hoursOfOperation: Friday:  4:00pm - 9:00pm  Saturday:  12:00pm - 7:00pm  Sunday:  Closed

name: Double Dizzy Brewery
description: We started with a man and his dream. Our founder, Leigh loved sampling beers but felt that something was missing. After some encouragement from his friends, and a loving and understanding wife, he decided to start making his own. As it turned out, he was a natural Brewmaster. That was 3 years ago.     Today, the brewery has grown from a single pot on a stove, to a three vessel BCS system and continues to expand.     ?At Double Dizzy we’re passionate about making beer and drinking beer!

name: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks
description: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks is dedicated to making hand crafted artisan beers for the central Pennsylvania area.    We are a 'nano' brewery that is founded on the idea of bringing beers of all styles to the market as dictated by our customers.  We brew what our followers want and what we like. There is no style of beer we won't attempt, but we will always have our standards on hand. We take pride in being a local business and being eco-responsible. This is all about enjoying life and having fun.

name: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery
description: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery features craft beer, wine, soda and pizza. We also make our own Pizzas, Paninis, and Salads!
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday thru Thursday: 3PM - 10PM  Friday and Saturday: Noon - Midnight  Sunday: Noon - 7PM

name: ENKI Brewing
description: ENKI Brewing is the 20+ year culmination of the friendship between two beer lovers. John Hayes and Dan Norton met working for NIKE in the early-80s. Training and competing in track and road running events brought them together. They soon found another shared interest--experiencing the world of beer. The two made many friends spending spare evenings in New England pubs offering European beers, which, before the emergence of American craft beers, were the best beers available. The two often discussed their dream of opening their own brewery over the years. In August of 2012, John and Dan decided to take the keg into their own hands, and ENKI Brewing Company was born. Just a few months later, their dreams came to fruition at 7929 Victoria Drive. ENKI’s mission is to “Make the World a Friendlier Place – Two Beers at a Time” just as John and Dan have been enjoying and sharing beers with old and new friends, alike.

name: Fairhope Brewing Company
description: The Fairhope Brewing Company will serve the craft beer needs of Lower Alabama by operating a taproom in the brewery and selling our beer throughout Baldwin and Mobile counties.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday-Saturday 5:30-8:30pm

name: Fall River Brewing Company
description: At Fall River Brewing Company, we create handcrafted ales and lagers. We brew our beer on a small 1/2 barrel system which allows us to put our personal touch into every pint. We hope you enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Falling Down Beer Company
description: Falling Down Beer Company (FDBC) is the newest craft brewery in the state of Michigan. Continuing the tradition of Michigan and Craft brewers before us, we will create unique hand crafted Ales and Lagers, that will challenge expectations and ideas of what great beer really is. With a focus on premium quality, handmade Ales and Lagers, FDBC will present a new unique product to the Detroit area.    Made in Michigan and the U.S.A.    One of the missions of FDBC is to create jobs and spur the economy in Michigan and the U.S. in general. At opening we plan to have 18 positions available with that number doubling year to year. Our long term goal is a bottling factory and additional restaurants that will employee hundreds of local workers.    Keeping with our philosophy of locally sourced goods and services, we will purchase from local companies whenever possible. On the food side this includes local fish markets, meat markets and bakeries; and on the brewery side designing beers that will be made using Michigan grown hops and malt. And it doesn’t stop there! We are actively negotiating and designing the brew house, promotional materials, general construction and website operations with Michigan companies.    Where it is not possible to source a product or service locally or in the State of Michigan, we will be looking first to keep our business in the Mid-West and then United States. We call this an inside-out sourcing philosophy. First source at the city level and slowly work out by county, state, region and country. We feel this benefits everyone in this endeavor where we support the community that is supporting us. A Win-Win for everyone!    It’s All About the Beer!    We are going to be creating quality; handcrafted beers that we believe will be some of the best beer you have ever tried. We are also going to push the envelope and make beers with unique and far-out ingredients that will invite you to be different and maybe live a little on the edge. We already have over 20 recipes waiting for people to try and enjoy.

name: Brewing House
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Wed: 11am-12am  Thur-Sat: 11am-1am

name: Fanning Brewing Company
description: Fannin Brewing is a hometown brewery in a real place - beautiful Blue Ridge, GA. We combine our love for German beer, our experience making wine and our passion for the mountains to create world-class beer with a local focus. Local isn't just a word - we use local ingredients,name our beers for the beauty around us, and support our local community.

name: FarmHouse Brewery
description: FarmHouse Brewery wil be located in Newark Valley, NY, where we will operate as a Farm Brewery, growing and processing our own hops and grains grown here in Tioga County, NY. Come tour our on-site malthouse and learn how local handcrafted beer is engineered from ground to glass.    A NYS "Farm Brewery" with a Tap Room location in Owego, NY and a malthouse/brewery location in Newark Valley, NY. In our Tap Room we offer craft ales, hard cider, old-fashioned sodas and revolving taps for other NYS "Farm Brewery" libations.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Fat Bottom Brewing
description: Fat Bottom’s full-flavored brews are bigger and more exciting than other beers in town. Our signature brews represent a sophisticated array of styles perfected over many years, with a few unique twists. Ben has refined each recipe and sourced the highest quality ingredients for every batch of specially crafted Fat Bottom beer.    Our beer is unfiltered, so you can savor the unique cloudy appearance and subtle flavors that truly bring craft beer to life. We like the bolder hops flavors, distinct body of aromas, and the beautiful color compounds that come from the natural grains. Unfiltered beers also have more nutrients from yeast and barley malt, including B vitamins which have been shown to reduce the effects of hangovers… a little added benefit for those of us who seriously love beer.
hoursOfOperation: Tues - Sat: 4:00pm - 10:00pm  Sat: 2:00pm - 10:pm

name: Fate Brewing Company
description: We do things a bit differently at Fate. Our beers are brewed in small batches, which means you'll find steadily rotating traditional favorites, experimentals, seasonals and cask conditioned ales on tap exclusively at the brewpub. At Fate you'll be offered a nifty opportunity to develop and expand your taste profile with our ever changing distinctive beers and wood-fired pizzas. Join us for a pint and a pie at Scottsdale's very own micro brewpub and put Fate in your hands!

Local ingredients are featured on the lunch, brunch, and dinner menus and the full bar with 30 taps feature house drafts and rotating guest beer. Stop by for a pint and a bite at 1600 38th Street and Arapahoe Road (one block west of Foothills Parkway) in Boulder, Colorado.

name: Freedom's Edge Brewing
description: Stop in and enjoy one of our hand crafted beers. Come out and enjoy one of our hand crafted ales and take a trip back in time.    The Tivoli Building was built in 1892 and was operated by the Richardson brothers as a saloon (and reportedly a brothel) during the period when Cheyenne was known as the "Paris of the west".     The Tivoli has been completely restored and is ready to once again become one of the finest establishments in Cheyenne Wyoming.

name: Frey's Brewing Company
description: Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.    We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

name: Frothy Beard Brewing Company
description: The Frothy Beard Brewing Company is a nano-brewery set in Charleston, South Carolina focusing on producing full flavored ales and lagers for the region.

name: The Full Moon Cafe
description: The Full Moon Brewery specializes in British and Irish style beers. We use Marris Otter malt as our base and then add various combinations of Black Patent, Brown malt, Crystal malt, and Roasted Barley depending on the individual beer. We use Fuggles, East Kent Golding and Challenger hops. Our brew house is a one barrel RIMS system filling one and two barrel fermenters.

name: Ghost Runners Brewery
description: Ghost Runners Brewery is a Vancouver Washington craft brewery dedicated to the individual who enjoys premium quality Northwest beer.    Hand crafted, production only nano brewery that offers 1/2bbl, 1/4bbl, 1/6bbl beers to local and regional bars and restaurants. We also offer growler service and bottled premium ales. Beer offerings change randomly.

name: Gigantic Brewing Company
description: Gigantic Brewing Company is an independent, crafty brewery located in the Southeast quadrant of the Peoples Republic of Portland. Brewer/Owners Ben Love and Van Havig are veterans of the Oregon brewing community.    At Gigantic we only do two things: make the best damn IPA in Portland, Oregon and produce seasonal, exciting, flavorful beers, most of which will be brewed only once. Our goal is simultaneously to create new interpretations of classic styles and to ignore those same style guidelines completely and brew whatever our creative natures produce.

name: Beaverton
hoursOfOperation: Monday 11:00 am – 10:00 pm  Tuesday 11:00 am – 10:00 pm  Wednesday 11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Thursday 11:00 am – 10:00 pm  Friday 11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Saturday 11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Sunday 11:00 am – 9:00 pm

name: Great Storm Brewing
description: About Great Storm Brewing    Just like you, we love beer. We've been making beer for many years now and wanted to share our love of beer with as many people as we could. With that in mind, we founded Great Storm Brewing in 2010, and opened our doors and our taps to the public in March 2012.    Our name? Well, for us, there's a lot of anticipation in tasting a new beer. The way the foam settles in a glass of dark stout, or the raining effect you can see in a pint of IPA served on nitro... they remind us sometimes of the expectant feeling we get watching powerful storms roll in over the mountains in our home town of Colorado Springs. Yes, we tend to wax poetic over a pint glass. I told you we love beer. But anyway, that was part of the inspiration. The other part was our beloved half Husky, half Aussie brewdog, Storm. He's a little... wild. Like our beers.      We hope you'll find the same passion for drinking our beers as we do for making them. Come in and see us, we'll be pleased to pour you a pint.    And maybe wax a little poetic about it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Green Room Burgers & Beer
description: People around here love a local, handcrafted beer, and that is what we aim to provide. Bringing you the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on, we strive for flavor and good prices.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Tuesday: 11:00 AM - 11:00 PM  Wednesday - Saturday: 11:00 AM - 1:00 AM  Sunday: 11:00 AM - 10:00 PM

name: Hall Brewing Company
description: We are a traditional farmhouse brewery based in Parker, Colorado. Everything we do–from building our brewery to making the beer–we do with our own hands. We make true craft beer. We take pride in not only producing the best craft beer but also putting enough in it to suit our custom four-thousand-square-foot building we made from Colorado beetle-kill pine. That means big, ornate beer. And why not? The best isn’t always for everyone!    We are a family-owned business. Under the guidance of master brewer and construction engineer Aubrey Hall, our family has pulled together to make something special.

name: Harmony Brewing Company
description: A neighborhood brew-pub for Eastown. A comfortable place where conversation is the primary entertainment. Offering our own beers, as well as a full bar. Our menu consists of wood fired pizzas that will knock your socks off! Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Heist Brewery
description: It’s going down right now. There’s a Heist happening in Charlotte. Except at this robbery everybody’s going to get their share of the loot, er…brew. After over two years of planning, Charlotte will now be called home to the Heist Brewery.

name: Hillcrest Brewing Company
description: The Hillcrest Brewing Company (HBC), The World’s First “Out and Proud LGBT Brewery " is set to open in June of 2012 in time to celebrate the 43rd anniversary of the Stonewall Inn Uprising. We specialize in handcrafted beer and stone oven pizzas with bottles, growlers & kegs to-go.     The restaurant, managed by Joey Arruda, serves paired pizza that is perfectly orchestrated with a focus from the water and flour to create its crust, to the fresh Italian Roma tomatoes with fresh toppings and cheeses before it is fired in stone lined ovens.   We are located at 1458 University Avenue, in the colorful and vibrant LGBT community of Hillcrest in San Diego. HBC features four initial microbrews with plans for up to twelve more to come. Pouring only grains and grapes- our 24 beers on tap and assorted selection of wines are paired with specialty pizzas, by our talented breweristas. The remainder of the taps pours “Guest” brews from other local micro breweries.     Our tap-room, designed in-house features an open ceiling with sealed concrete floors and a 15 foot chandelier made with 97 sustainable 22oz beer bottles that will hang within a 23 foot copula. Additional clusters of hanging beer bottle chandeliers give life to a total Frankenstein set up, with much of the equipment home-made including a steam punk style bottling machine built from scratch by David White, Brewmaster/Artist/Mad-Scientist who lives, breathes and dreams beer. A 13 foot garage door opens to an L-Shaped outdoor patio with cushioned keg barrel seating and planters with local varietal hop bines (hop vines) that can grow up to 25+ feet along horizontal trellises.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat - Sun:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: HooDoo Brewing Company
description: HooDoo Brewing Company makes world class ales, right here in the heart of Alaska. Come by for a glass of beer, and take a growler to enjoy at home! Prost!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Hop Dogma Brewing Company
description: Hop Dogma Brewing Company is proud to bring you creative hand-crafted ales and lagers made from the highest quality ingredients. We specialize in small batches and adventurous brews! Come on by and taste the difference!

name: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co.
description: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co., is a micro-brewery located on "the Bend", of Lake of the Ozarks, a 7-mile long peninsula. It's named after its horseshoe like shape, as the lake follows it's natural shoreline.     Chris and Carrie Case transformed a Firehouse from the 70's into a 7-barrel brewhouse.  Carrie had some roots in the Ozarks, but both moved from Colorado with a passion for craft beer. Chris worked previously as a Chef for over 20 years and Carrie with many years of Marketing and Graphic Design experience.  They figured that should be a good start for owning their own brewery.  Come to find out, Chris was really good at developing flavors and Carrie was really good at finding out what people liked...and several years of practice in the garage helped too!      They focus on traditional brewing methods along with new techniques to produce distinct full-flavored beers!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: I & I Brewing
description: We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.     One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday 4 PM to 8 PM  Wednesday 4 PM to 8 PM  Thursday 4 PM to 8 PM  Friday 4 PM to 10 PM  Saturday 2 PM to 10 PM

name: Indeed Brewing Company
description: Indeed Brewing Company has a penchant for adventure, both in the beers we brew and the way we go about brewing them.     We offer two flagship beers: Day Tripper Pale Ale & Midnight Ryder American Black Ale. We also brew seasonal offerings like Shenanigans Summer Ale, and Stir Crazy Winter Ale.     Visit our taproom to to buy 10, 16, or 20-oz. beers, or take home 750 mL bottles of beer. Our tours are available on Saturday's, to sign up, visit our website at IndeedBrewing.com.    Indeed Brewing was founding in Feb. 2011, and began production in July 2012, and opened taproom in August 2012.    We distribute kegs, 12-oz. cans, and specialty beers in 750 mL bottles.

name: Infamous Brewing Company
description: The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts.   We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.  We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.  Much more information will be coming on our planned initial beer selection. In the meantime, continue to check back for updates and continue to spread the word!

name: Iowa River Brewing Company
description: Iowa River Brewing Company is a craft brewery specializing in small batch beers. The brewery feature a tasting room and sells beer for take out in growlers or for consumption in the brewery. Beer is available for sale in kegs to restaurants, bars and for special events. Iowa River Brewing is also planning to offer private label brewing.

name: Kauai Island Brewery & Grill
description: Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!    Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for.     After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.    We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm

These tasty brews are created in-house, using only the finest ingredients and Lake Chelan’s glacier fed water.    Make Lake Chelan Brewery your vacation destination. Relax and sample some of our beers, or grab a snack and growler to bring with you on the boat!

If you’re up for it, we’d like to invite you to come along. Just meet us at Latitude 33.

We don't limit ourselves to brewing a certain style of ale. We brew what we like, but we're sure to share the rewards.

name: Martin House Brewing Company
description: Martin House Brewing Company is a team of brewers, explorers, and dreamers. We avoid tradition in favor of adventure both in brewing and in life. We value good ingredients and good people. Each of our beers pairs perfectly with the memorable moments in life. We want to be your hand-crafted beer of choice that's there with you and your friends whether you're celebrating your most recent adventure or planning the next one. Martin House - Made in Texas by Texans."

name: Mayday Brewery
description: Mayday Brewery opened 11/30/2012 in an abandoned blanket factory built in 1923. Mayday's 900 sq ft tasting room is the original boiler room for the blanket factory. Mayday has another 600 sq ft of bar area and a large outside deck. Mayday packages beer for distribution and their tasting room is open Thurs-Friday 4-8 and Saturday 1-8. Brewery tours are offered Saturday on the hour from 2:00-6:00. At Mayday our motto is, "We try NOT to suck."
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm    Tours Saturday only 2:00 - 6:00  On the hour

name: Miami Brewing Company
description: Miami's first production brewery.  After years of hard work we've finally started our own brewery. Using Miami as our inspiration we challenge ourselves daily by unlocking new tasty combinations using fruits, spices, and herbs. Built from scratch using local ingredients.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday 10:00am – 5:00pm  Fridays 10:00am-11:00pm *Cover charge to attend nightime event  Saturday 10:00am-11:00pm *Cover charge to attend nightime event  Sunday 12:00pm-5:00pm

name: MobCraft Beer
description: MOBCRAFT IS THE WORLD’S FIRST COMPLETELY CROWDSOURCED BREWERY!    MobCraft Beer is a small craft brewery making custom craft beer. We produce small batch “custom craft beers” based off of users submitted recipes and ideas which end up in our recipe vault. Each month, you can vote on a wide variety of beer styles and flavors. Cast your vote by pre-ordering the beer you want us to brew. MobCraft will produce the beer with the most orders and ship out a 4 pack of 22oz “bomber” bottles to your doorstep! Or if you're near the brewery come pick it up in our tap room location in Madison, WI!

name: Modern Times Beer
description: Modern Times is a 30bbl production brewery and tasting room in the Point Loma neighborhood of San Diego. Modern Times is named after a beautifully crazy utopian community founded in 1850, and (almost) all of our beers are named after real utopian experiments or mythological utopias.    The brewery was founded by the guy writing this (Jacob McKean), a beer geek, former Stone Brewing Co. employee and long-time homebrewer, along with crack team of consultants consisting of illustrious graphic designers, vicious attorneys, a slightly unhinged kombucha-obsessed real estate agent, one faraway brewing prodigy, a pricey architect, a gregarious general contractor, and (a bit later in the process) three outstanding brewers.     Today, we're distributed throughout Southern California and have a fully awesome tasting room at our brewery, along with a super rad tasting room in North Park. You should totally come check it out.

name: Molly Pitcher Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Monocacy Brewing Co
description: At Monocacy Brewing Company we focus on crafting fresh, great tasting beer. The quality of our products is a direct result of our passion for the craft combined with our selection of choice and local ingredients resulting in beer that we are proud to brew and package in historic Frederick, Maryland. Join us for one of our regularly scheduled brewery tours and enjoy a taste of a flavorful and genuine Maryland beer.

name: Most Wanted Brewery
description: Hand Crafted Brews with Most Wanted Ingredients

name: Mountain Madness Brewing
description: In 2011, the current owners answered their calling for the mountains and relocated to Durango from Phoenix, Arizona. They soon bought this restaurant with the idea of creating a true neighborhood pub in the heart of the Animas Valley where none currently exist. A new pub that focuses on a simple but tasty menu with a high energy atmosphere where everyone is welcome and comfortable. Our specialty is handcrafted gourmet brick oven pizzas complimented with great apps, salads, and sandwiches, all washed down with quality craft brews. We have a full bar, free Wi-Fi, and several HDTV's for all your sports viewing pleasure.     At Mountain Madness we can best be described as passionate. We're passionate about people (and dogs), we're passionate about great craft beer and gourmet pizza, and we're insanely passionate about the mountains. Mountain Madness is the culmination of a life long dream of its founder to create an experience that combines these passions.     We will continue to remodel, tweak, and enhance Mountain Madness as we strive to perfect your neighborhood pub. We are simple, casual, and unique by design...and we love dogs! During the summer bring your furry friends with you and enjoy our fantastic deck with the best views in town!     We are your apres ski destination as the closest "in-town" location to Purgatory right on Hwy. 550. We are located 2 miles north of downtown directly across from the Iron Horse Inn with plenty of free on-site parking.     On behalf of our entire staff, we hope to see you soon at Mountain Madness Pizza & Pub. Our people make the difference!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Mountain Madness Brewing

name: Mraz Brewing Company
description: Michael Mraz started brewing as a hobby.  Now after winning many awards with his innovative beers, he is bringing his style of amazing tasting beer to you.

name: Neshaminy Creek Brewing Company
description: Neshaminy Creek Brewing Company is a new local craft beer brewery located in Croydon, PA. We hope to launch with our flagship beers in the late Spring/early Summer of 2012.    To make great tasting beer that challenges not only beer drinkers, but ourselves as brewers as well.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Nevin's Brewing Company
description: Nevin's Brewing Company opened its doors in December 2012. Like all breweries, we use grain to make our beer. But unlike other breweries, we do not simply discard our used or "spent" grain. Instead, we deliver our spent grain to local farmers to use as feed for livestock and compost to enrich the soil for vegetables. We then, in turn, purchase this well-fed livestock and nutrient-rich vegetables to make our steaks, burgers, salads, side dishes and so many other items on our menu.    Our goal is not only to bring you the freshest, most flavorful food and beer possible, but also to aim as high as we can for true sustainability.

name: Newburyport Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2012, the Company is Massachusetts' only exclusive all-can and keg craft brewery. Co-founded by two local Newburyport entrepreneurs, musicians, and home brewers - Chris Webb and Bill Fisher - the company aims to capture the essence of Newburyport's quaint seaside character across a line of great tasting handcrafted ales. Newburyport Brewing Company uses premium quality natural ingredients in its Newburyport Pale Ale™, Plum Island Belgian White™, Green Head IPA™ and 1635 Series™ beers.

name: Take Out Beer/Growlers
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday, 11am to 5pm;   Friday & Saturday ,11am - 6pm   Sunday, Noon - 4pm

name: Noble Rey Brewing Company
description: Noble Rey Brewing Company is DFW's newest Craft Brewery. We aim to produce the highest quality hand crafted beers for our community.  Chris Rigoulot, owner and head brewer, brings with him the knowledge he gained at the American Brewers Guild and puts that into every beer he creates. We cannot wait to share his dream with you!  Be Noble. Drink Noble. is not just a slogan to us, it's a way of life. We are deeply committed to DFW and the people that live here and hope to be the best neighbors we can be. Whether we are volunteering at local relief agencies or at one the area great festivals, you'll definitely see and feel our presence.

name: Nosdunk Brewing Company

name: Offbeat Brewing Company
description: Offbeat Brewing Company is a small collective of like-minded people who believe that well-crafted beer, untethered art, and the communities that support them are what make life worth living. We have a cute, little building in an industrial park as well as some beer that we'll sell you, but we think that's just the starting point for something much more vital, unique, and important, and we'd love it if you'd be part of that with us. Let's get together, drink some beer, and make some stuff!!

name: Old Mill Brewpub & Grill
description: Here at Old Mill Brewpub & Grill, we strive to provide quality food and drink in a relaxing atmosphere, using only the freshest quality ingredients in our products.We believe in sourcing locally and naturally whenever possible. Listed on the National Registry of Historic Places, the Historic Eesley Mill provides our patrons with a truly unique venue to enjoy the best beers, wines, spirits, and food, served to you by a passionate team of Old Mill Brewpub & Grill associates. We hope you enjoy your experience today and ask you to tell your friends about us. See you again soon!  Cheers!

name: One Barrel Brewing
description: Madison's smallest brewery opened on Friday, July 6 2012. One Barrel Brewing Company is at the intersection of Atwood and Winnebago streets, a.k.a. Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Thu: 4:00 pm - 1:00 am  Fri: 3:30 pm - 1:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Opposition Brewing Company
description: Opposition Brewing isn’t about doom and gloom, it’s about enjoying the time we have, while we have time left. It’s about great beer made simply. It’s about good friends, good times, and knowing that we should always live for the moment because it may all be over tomorrow.    At Opposition Brewing we love BIG beers. Be they brews with huge hop presence, big malt backbones, or prominent and unique flavor profiles, we prefer brewing and drinking beers that are approachable, but with the character necessary to challenge the mundane.    We offer a consistent selection of quality, small-batch, beers as well as rotating specialties. We brew weekly, guaranteeing some of the freshest beer on tap in the Rogue Valley. And we offer a truly unique, local, artisan experience.    We also hail from the great Pacific Northwest and choose to honor the ingredients produced here as much as possible in our brews. And while we enjoy the technology available to us now, we know that it could all go away tomorrow, so we believe in a brewing process that is distilled as far down as reasonably possible while still achieving consistently excellent results.     So sit back, raise a pint, and let us ride this long black train together!
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Brevard
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room  Monday-Sunday: 12pm-8pm    Free Brewery Tours  Monday-Thursday: 4pm  Friday-Sunday: 2pm, 3pm, 4pm, 5pm

hoursOfOperation: Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Our Mutual Friend Malt & Brew
description: Our Mutual Friend is a brewery and taproom located in the Five Points neighborhood of Denver. For us, brewing beer began as an excuse to gather with our friends and ruminate on life, philosophy, music, food, and of course, beer. Once we got started, we grew more curious about the brewing process, honing our craft and experimenting with different methods and techniques. Along the way a fundamental question to our process was, how can we do more of this ourselves? Our desire to participate in every step of the grain to glass process led us to open Our Mutual Friend.    At OMF, our goal is to use local sources to brew local ales. This is why we malt and roast as much of the grain we use in our beer as we can. As a small maltstery, we have more influence over the quality and freshness of the beers we pour in our taproom, and more opportunities to source our ingredients locally. 100 percent of our barley is grown right here in Colorado. And as much as possible, we source our hops and specialty ingredients from farms in our state.     Part of what we love about beer is its power to bring people together (hence our name!). We’re excited to be a gathering place in the Five Points neighborhood where locals and visitors alike can meet in camaraderie alongside a quality pint of ale. We believe in the power of neighborly acts and the spirit of neighbors taking care of one another within the local community. We at OMF support and strive for the Denver community to know each other better and enjoy a good pint in the same process.     We are excited to see our city developing a local, world-class brewery community, and look forward to building relationships with our friends and neighbors, and collaborating with other breweries to cherish our Denver home and protect our collective local influence.

name: Brewery & Pub
description: We are a very small-scale brewery and pub specializing in foreign and unique beers and eats.  Our brewery is a 1 barrel system (two kegs) which we use to create hand-crafted, more often than not, specialty ales.  Our brewery is based around experimentation, so our taps change frequently.  We usually do not brew the same beer twice, but will do so if enough people ask.    By definition, an outlander is a stranger, a foreigner, but here he is much more. This is how we see him: The outlander is the innovator; he is the one who drives change. It is the outlander, whether in mind or origin, who represents the ambitious, passionate pioneer who is willing to put everything on the line in order to make his dream come true. It’s often a simple dream, a dream to share his knowledge, his expertise with the ones who call him stranger. And certainly the public may reject his ideas, they may cast him back to where he came from. But does this ever worry the outlander? Never. Because the outlander believes in his ideas. He knows what he is offering is great and he knows others, once they put aside their prejudice, will know this too. He knows that someone who has invested their time, their life, their hopes and dreams behind something cannot fail. And he knows one last vital piece of information– that there have been many outlanders in this world before him and there will be many more to come.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Closed  Tuesday – 4pm – 10pm  Wednesday – 4pm – 10pm  Thursday – 4pm – 12am  Friday – 4pm – 1am  Saturday – 2pm – 1am  Sunday – 2pm– 10pm

name: Pacific Plate Brewing Company
description: Pacific Plate Brewing Company will create a unique canon of historic and Latin-American inspired Ales and Lagers. We utilize a combination of age-old techiques and modern scientific approaches to create a premium artisan product. Ultimately, we will beget a new reign of beer drinking experiences. After all, our motto is Nil Satis Nisi Optimum.
hoursOfOperation: Monday & Tuesday: Closed  Wed. - Fri. 4pm - 10pm  Saturday 12pm - 10pm  Sunday 12pm - 6pm

name: Peabody Heights Brewery
description: The Peabody Heights Brewery, located in the heart of Baltimore, MD is among the first breweries to be opened within the city limits of Baltimore in over 30 years. Its name comes from the original name of the Charles Village neighborhood in which it now sits. The brewery is the work of three entrepreneurs who hope to bring back to life Baltimore's long and storied tradition of brewing. Stephen Demzcuk, owner of the Baltimore Washington Beer Works and their popular, Raven Special Lager, has joined forces with J. Hollis B. Albert III, a local Baltimore businessman, and Patrick Beille of France, to bring this dream to life. Together, they hope to turn an old 48,000 square foot soda bottling plant into the largest production brewery in Baltimore.

name: Pedernales Brewing Company
description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.

name: Petoskey Brewing
description: A Michigan Microbrewery. Join us in our Tap Room to experience made-on-premiss hand-crafted beer and light food offerings!

Join us at our brewery and try as many as seven of our own beers including SOUTHY BITCH SLAP American Irish Red, BLUE COLLAR American Wheat, HOPCORE American Pale Ale or anything else we may be brewing at the time.

name: Pike 51 Brewing Co.

Still, who doesn’t like a good, handcrafted beer?  So, as we all still have our full time jobs, we’re launching Pike 51 Brewery to bring our passion to you.

description: Pinthouse Pizza is a craft brewpub serving Austin's finest pizza and world class beers. The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.

name: Pints Urban Taproom
description: PINTS Brewing Company opened in 2012 as Oldtown/Chinatown’s first brewery since Henry Saxer’s original Liberty Brewing Co. opened in 1852. PINTS Brewing Co. is dedicated towards old school Northwest and British inspired ales using the best quality base and specialty malts along with Oregon grown hops. Brewed in small 3.5 barrel batches, our beers are designed to be complex, yet focused, and ultimately beg another pint.

name: Refuge Brewery
description: The brewery is currently set up to brew 10bbl (310 gallons) of beer at a time. It may seem like a lot of beer (and it is!), but brewing on this relatively small scale allows us to maintain quality at a finite level that would be increasingly difficult on a larger system. However, our five fermentors, with a capacity totaling 80bbl, allows us to maintain a variety of beers on tap all year long.     The tasting room is situated right in the middle of the brewery and allows people to experience beer and what goes into producing it. Often times patrons of the tasting room get a front row seat to the actual brewing process as our brewers are working!

name: Rinn Duin Brewing

name: River North Brewery

We focus on brewing Belgian-style ales and American style ales with a Belgian twist, but the truth of it is that we just brew the kind of beer we like to drink!    The brewery was founded by Matt Hess (with a lot of help from his wife Jess). Matt is a former engineer who now spends his time engineering the latest recipes for River North.

name: Roadhouse Brewing Company
description: Located in historic Jackson Hole, Wyoming, The Roadhouse Brewing Co. brews beer as bold as the Tetons. Our brewers started out as homebrewers and we remain true to our roots. We’re passionate about our beer, the brewing process, history and culture and embrace the many flavors and styles from around the world that define the craft beer family. The same thirst for adventure and exploration that brought us to the Tetons resides in every batch we brew. Beer by beer we strive to cultivate and enhance the local craft beer experience in Jackson Hole and our neighboring communities. Beer to the people.

Check out our facebook and Twitter pages for the latest news and updates on our new brewery.

Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!

Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.

name: Sante Adairius Rustic Ales
description: Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is a small, but daring, brewery located in the coastal city of Capitola, CA, just south of Santa Cruz.    Sante Adairius is a brewery founded on respect for quality and authenticity. We focus our attention on producing well-constructed beers with an eye towards simplicity and character. SARA takes liberty in emulating those memorable beers, their brewers, and the experiences they foster, never forgetting those giants on whose shoulders we stand.    Our approach to beer making is one of whimsy, highly inspired by the Belgian tradition, but also in harmony with brewers all over the world who push against boundaries of style with a nudge, not a shove. Often our beers are barrel-aged, usually in wine barrels, with various yeast and bacteria. As often as not though, Sante Adairius brews beers more approachable and traditional in nature, yet no less flavorful or distinctive.    Owned and operated by us, Adair Paterno and Tim Clifford, Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is our attempt to bring people together over great beer. SARA is an expression of our many years of beer geekery, the rabbit hole of tasting every beer we could get our hands on, and trusting we could contribute to the canon of those beers of the highest esteem. We believe great beer comes first. We stay true to our brewing roots. We take seriously the fact that we are brewing for you, and for ourselves. We appreciate your interest in our efforts. Sante!

name: Scantic River Brewery
description: Established in 2012, The Scantic River Brewery introduced the crowd pleasing Hampden Pale Ale. This year will bring plenty of excitement to beer lovers, with the introduction of our new line of IPA's, "The Trail Ale IPA" series. With several months of testing and sample runs, we have finally finished and fine tuned the first of four IPA varieties.

name: Scars & Stripes Brewing Company
description: The name really says it all. Four Army veterans got together one day to brew beer and talk about movies, music, video games, and life which then turned into a regular home brewing event. Not too long afterwards, it was noticed that the city of Waco, Texas didn't have a microbrewery to call its own to accommodate a growing music scene and its relaxed college atmosphere. It only seemed obvious what the next move would be.    Even though the brew-masters and owners are Army Veterans, the name Scars & Stripes stands as tribute all military veterans as a thank you for the sacrificing that has been done so everyone can live free. The mentality behind this company is not your Captain America patriotism, but rather one that embraces Independence and freedom for all with no judgement for lifestyle choices.    We will be Waco's only micro brewery! Our beer will be self distributed around various stores and restaurants in the Central and Northern Texas area but we will also have regular taste testings for anyone who is of legal drinking age to take a tour of the brewing facility and to get a free try of the craft beer we are creating. Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase.

name: Scorpion Brewing
description: Scorpion Brewing is a startup brewery in Calvert County Maryland.  Our beers should be ready in 2013!     Brian Dailey has had a passion for brewing and beer for many years and since the world will end in 2012 I figured, hey lets just start brewing and selling my craft beers to the great people of southern Maryland.

name: Selkirk Abbey Brewing Company
description: Why open a Belgian themed brewery in North Idaho? Well, we live here. We love it here and we’re not moving. Second and most importantly, we love Belgian beers. From a refreshing, spicy Saison to a tongue twisting sour or a rich malty Trappist and everything in between, Belgian beers have something for every palate.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Sick N Twisted Brewing Co.
description: Sick N Twisted Brewery selects local ingredients for our unique beers. Join us and relax on our patio with your friends or sit by the fire and indulge in some twisted fun!! Come lube your palate with us; after all Micro Brews are the new Social Lubricant...
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sat: 10:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sun: 10:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: SingleSpeed Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to brew beers built for the venturesome beer drinker, those unafraid to stray from the beaten path of simple flavors established by breweries much larger in size but not in creative energy.    As our name implies, we will be brewing at a slower rate of production than any of these monstrous breweries-designing and creating our hand crafted ales at one relatively slow pace, our "single speed", allowing each to emerge as a small artisanal batch formulated from recipes that include fresh, local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

name: Skull Camp Brewing
description: Craft beer is exploding across the nation and across our own state of North Carolina. Skull Camp Brewing is very excited to bring the love and passion of craft beer to the Elkin area.

name: Sky High Brewing & Pub
description: You've noticed the sky reaching beams coming out of the old Avalon Cinema building... You noticed that the street was blocked all day as we installed our brew tanks... You've noticed Sky High Brewing & Pub!    The Tasting Room is officially open on the mezzanine level; we will open the whole space in sections as each new level is ready. We plan to install as many bike racks as we can... and encourage two-wheeled transportation. :)
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
description: Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. The Partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken has financed the start-up of this venture.    Slanted Rock plans to start Operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Production volume will be packaged in kegs initially with hopes of adding bottle or canning in the future.    Keg Sales will be self-distributed initially, with future distribution outside of Idaho. Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the location at a discounted keg price. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL    The brewery location will open a tap room where Slanted Rock and other selected craft brewers will be on tap. Sample flights, pints, half pints & growlers will be available for sale.
hoursOfOperation: Tues-Thurs: 4:00pm-9:00pm  Fri & Sat: 12:00pm-10:00pm

name: Sloop Brewing
description: Sloop brewing is a true nano brewery located in the Hudson Valley region. A Nano brewery is a licensed brewery using a brewing system of less than 4 barrels.  Brewing at this level allows us to spend more time crafting each and every beer to be exactly as it should be. Additionally, our local distribution ensures that every Sloop beer you drink will be fresh out of our brewery.

name: Smartmouth Brewing Company
description: Smartmouth is a 20 barrel brewery focused on brewing a wide variety of the highest quality beers with the goal of giving beer lovers new tasting experiences to savor. Our beers are crisp, clean and smooth.

name: Solemn Oath Brewery
description: Debuting in 2012, Solemn Oath Brewery features an array of American, Belgo-American, traditional, wood-aged and experimental beer styles. We're excited to join our Illinois craft brethren in providing you with another quality-focused, local option to satisfy your craft beer needs.

We have three screens with a Direct TV sports package for all the games and we are open for Monday night football with great food and $4.00 Imperial pints.

Starkey's will feature SencaHayes and Twisted Screw wines, G.C. Starkey beer, and a variety of appetizers and hor 'doeuvres that will pair well with one or the other.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Stumblefoot Brewing Co.
description: Stumblefoot Brewing Co. has set out to make some of the most interesting styles of beer we can think of. We want our beer to be an artisan experience of local flavor.     Stumblefoot Brewery is in its second year of joining the ranks of new breweries. We have setup in San Diego's North County - in San Marcos, CA. This area has become known as a mecca for beer. And all you need to do be a part of it is ... Represent!    Stumblefoot is a name that personifies the boot strap and prototyping format we have gone about creating our brewery. The name pays tribute to our willingness to experiment.    We decided to come up with a definition that incorporates the essence of our experience:  Stumblefoot – \’st?m • b?l • fut\ (noun)   1) The art and science of gaining new knowledge through the happenstance of interesting encounters. Fortune favors the prepared.  See also: Organic, sharing, open-minded, kismet, lucky
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Sunken City Brewing Company
description: Sunken City is the new brewery at Smith Mountain Lake. We will start pouring beer in May!
