name: Sunriver Brewing Company
description: We love our beer. In a region that has taken microbrews to a whole new level, we pride ourselves on brewing awesome craft beer that includes the lighter side of brewing as well as the killer hoppy fare.    We’re just as proud of our outrageous service. Great beer needs to be shared. We’re positioned to do just that here in Sunriver and beyond. Whether we’re serving customers in our brewpub or working with our distributors and their outlets, our awesome beers are brewed to be relished. You’ll crave our high-quality, easy-drinking beer and we’ll do whatever it takes to share the love.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Tacoma Brewing Company
description: Featuring small, handcrafted batches of beers. Specializing in beers that apeal to non-beer drinkers, beer drinkers, and foody types.    Our promise to you is to not make boring beer! We are located within the Amocat Cafe in downtown Tacoma.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Tap Brewing Company
description: Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!    The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri, 8am-4pm

name: Ten Ninety Brewing Co.
description: Our mission is to brew unique and flavorful beers that break through traditional style guidelines and enhance the beer-drinking experience. Come along with us as we explore new flavors and create new styles that will have us all celebrating the good days.    Craft beer transforms four simple ingredients into something great. At Ten Ninety, we further this transformation to produce refreshing yet complex and challenging beers from unique ingredients and processes. As we reach beyond traditional combinations of water, malted grain, hops, and yeast, we are unapologetically proud to say that we brew extraordinary small batch beers meant to be thoughtfully enjoyed. Simply put, Ten Ninety is craft beer elevated.

name: THAT Brewery & Pub
description: THAT Brewery, just off the Arizona Trail in Pine, AZ is a place for people who like beer! We like beer – like to drink it, brew it, tip it and sing songs about it. Opened June 2012. THAT Brewery craft brews are available in many of your local pubs. Come up to Pine to see it all in action - great craft brews (THAT Brewery concoctions and other locally brewed guest craft beers), food, wine, volleyball, horseshoes and good times in the great Northern Arizona cool air. It’s a beautiful drive along the Mogollon Rim with an awesome destination - great craft beer from the source! By the way, we're good people too - actively a part of many charity groups in the area including: Friends of Tonto Natural Bridge, Mountain Village Foundation, Pine Strawberry Business Community, Pine Strawberry Fuels Reduction, AZ Trails Association, RiffRaff Club and the Justice McNeeley Foundation (childrens medical needs charity). We reach out and do all that we can in order to help these and many more groups in the area with fundraising, donations, organizing events and are always happy to give our time!  Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co.
description: An experimental microbrewery for the Pittsburgh region and beyond. Creating exceptional craft beers for a growing community of people that share our constant sense of curiosity.

name: The Brew on Broadway
description: Craft Brewery and Coffee House with a great south faced Brew Garden that is  Dog friendly
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 7:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri: 7:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sat: 8:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 8:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: The Brewer's Cabinet
description: Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.    Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.    With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.    The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!
hoursOfOperation: Monday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Tuesday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Wednesday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Thursday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Friday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Saturday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Sunday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm

name: The Filling Station Microbrewery
description: The Filling Station Microbrewery is located in the historical railroad depot with beautiful views of the Boardman Lake and directly on the T.A.R.T. bike trail. Our flatbreads and microbrews use the freshest ingredients available. David Cannizzaro, head brewer, uses a 10bbl & 3bbl brewing system which allows him the freedom to create small batches of craft brews in a variety of styles.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: The Granary 'Cur & Brew
description: We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.    At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.
hoursOfOperation: Lunch from Tuesday - Saturday:  11:00am- 2:00pm    Tuesday - Thursday:  6:00p.m - 10:00p.m.  Friday - Saturday:  6:00p.m. - 11:00p.m.

name: The Hourglass Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sat: 12pm – 12pm (or 2am)  Sunday: 12pm – 11pm

name: The Mitten Brewing Co
description: The Mitten Brewing Co. is a new, vintage baseball-themed nanobrewery that expertly pairs handcrafted beers with gourmet pizzas.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: The Workshop Brewing Company
description: The Workshop Brewing Company: we sustain nature, build community, and honor craft. We do this by creating honest, traditional beers and wholesome, delicious food using ingredients sourced as locally/organically as possible, served with genuine warmth and enthusiasm, in a setting that is welcoming and fun.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: South Monk
description: Asheville's Premier Craft Beer Bar
hoursOfOperation: Daily 4pm - Midnight  Sunday 2pm - 9pm

name: Thompson Brewing Co.
description: The Thompson Brewing Co. has a rich history of brewing high quality Ales, Lagers, Pilsners and more. Quality is our number one priority when it comes to brewing. We take extra steps unique to each of our brews to ensure their excellence.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Thorn Street Brewery
description: At Thorn Street Brewery, we are committed to bringing the neighborhood brewery back to reality and making you that better beer. We can think of no better neighborhood than North Park to begin this project. It’s a neighborhood where folks pride themselves on walking or riding their bike to get locally produced food, where people devote large parts of their property to growing their own edibles, where people love gardening, fishing, and of course brewing their own beers. No where that I have seen in a major city is there such a community where the residents seem so bound together by a common philosophy. Reduce your carbon footprint, eat local, buy local, produce something local, be self sufficient as much as you can, smile, and please try to leave the world a little better than you found it, because, after all, we are just renting it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Charlottesville
description: On June 3, 1781, in the heart of the Revolutionary War, Jack Jouette made his legendary horseback ride to Charlottesville to warn Governor Thomas Jefferson and his legislators of an attempt at their capture by an advancing British Calvary.  Led only by moonlight, Jack rode 40 miles along a backwoods trail marked by three distinct axe notches in the trees, a path later known as Three Notch'd Road.  We here at Three Notch'd Brewing Co. will never be as legendary as some of the most revered characters in Virginia history, but we do aim to leave our humble mark in the world of craft beer.    Jack left his mark, we're leaving ours, how will you leave yours?    Three Notch'd Brewing Company, LEAVE YOUR MARK.

name: Tight Lines Brewery
description: Tight Lines Brewery creates home-crafted beers right in the heart of Brookings, OR. We are family owned and operated and look forward to sharing our family's passion with you and yours.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Tin Man Brewing Company
description: Tin Man Brewing Co. was assembled in 2012, an alloy of production brewery and restaurant. Committed to sustaining a habitable environment for all living and mechanical being, we utilize innovative processes to minimize waste and maximize taste. Forging new ground, we were one of the first small craft breweries in the United States to use a mash filter.

name: Tipping Point Tavern
description: Here at Tipping Point Tavern you will find the finest artisan smoked meats, local beers, good friends and a relaxed atmosphere. We use as much local meats and produce as possible in the kitchen. Whether you are from around the world or around the corner we guarantee you will have a good time at the tavern.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30am till Midnight  Fri & Sat: 11:30am till 1:00am  Sun: 11:30 till 9:00

name: Triptych Brewing
description: A triptych (trip-tik) is a work of art, divided into three equal parts and built around a common theme. Triptych Brewing is three guys from three different walks of life sharing our passion for great, local beer with YOU. Built upon the traditional ingredients of hops, barley, and water and serving the communities of Champaign, Urbana, and Savoy, Triptych Brewing is dedicated to exploring the art of craft beer with the community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: TRVE Brewing Company
description: TRVE Brewing is the Denver brewery dedicated to bringing you beer that's beyond the pale. A neighborhood spot where you can hang out and have some killer beer.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Tuesday:Closed  Wednesday-Thursday:4PM-10PM  Friday-Saturday:4PM-12AM  Sunday:2PM-8PM

name: Twelve Bar Brews
description: Balanced. Finessed. Pleasant. Yeah, not so much.    Our beers are dry-tasting and dry-hopped, with a flavor profile that is anything but 'balanced.'  Our beers are like us; boisterous, unpretentious, and fun.
hoursOfOperation: 11-6 Friday  11-3 Saturday  Closed Sunday through Thursday

name: Twelve Rounds Brewing Company
description: Our passion for great brews and great food both began in the kitchen. Dan started brewing around 1990, using extracts. He took up the hobby in earnest which meant taking over the garage 5 years ago and transitioning to all-grain brewing. Both Dan and Elle love to cook and brewing days became a natural outlet for hosting all days BBQs with family and friends. The 5-gallon kettle over the kitchen stove grew to a half-barrel, propane-fueled brew rig. And the backyard gained a pellet-smoker alongside the Weber grill. That’s what we call going the distance with brewing and charcuterie!    With family and friends raving about our creation, it’s time to take it seriously. We entered the 2011 California State Fair and won three medals including first place for our Knock-Out Stout and second place for The Contender – our Pale Ale. The following year we won first place for our Scottish Ale which we plan on featuring as one of our seasonal brews.    In early 2012 we decided to pursue opening our own microbrewery. Our first challenge seemed almost insurmountable: finding a name! We hit trademark snags with our first three names and finally scored with Twelve Rounds.

name: Union Brewing Company
description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Urban Legend Brewing Company
description: Urban Legend Brewing Company makes unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We believe that our beer can make the world and our local community a better place! We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Our goal is to support local businesses and American manufacturing wherever possible. We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy.   The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Pints in the taproom, growlers to go, and small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers on draught plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. We love to rediscover ancient beer recipes as well as spend a lot of time developing a unique styles.  As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.

name: W Brewing
description: We are bringing back the Craft in German Lager's here in the United States. Keeping it exclusive and tasty per every batch we create.

name: Water Street Brewing Co.
description: We love brewing. We offer high quality craft beer, brewed on premises and  served directly from our tanks. Our patrons feel like they’re in the middle of a brewery...because they are. On brew day and during fermentation you will experience all the wonderful sites, smells and sounds of the brewing process.    You will find familiar and not-so-familiar styles on tap. We like to keep things interesting—there’s always something new. While somewhat conservative in the big tanks you never know what we'll put on tap for small batches. Toasted coconut stout anyone?
hoursOfOperation: Tues.—Thurs.  4 pm—11 pm  Fri.—Sat.  12 pm—12 am  Sun.  12 pm—7 pm

name: West Flanders
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: West O Beer
description: Our passion is making high quality craft beer, so we built a state of the art brewery in West Okoboji, Iowa. We have access to some of the best water in the world, and it's a quality you can taste.

name: West Sixth Brewing
description: West Sixth Brewing founders Ben, Brady, Joe, and Robin all came to the same conclusion at about the same time – Lexington, KY needs more high quality local craft beer. Since we came from very different backgrounds with diverse sets of experiences and talents, we joined forces to create beer that can be enjoyed not only by craft beer experts, but also by those who just want something tasty to drink after going for a bike ride.    Though we all got to this point in our lives in different ways, we strongly agree on West Sixth’s goals. We will provide a taproom and beer garden where the beer list is never the same but that is always local. We will be a brewery that measures its success not only by making great craft beer but also by how it helps our community. We will always strive to protect our environment even if it costs us more to do so. And last, but not least, we all share a desire to create the best beer possible and to be an integral part of building a great beer culture for our great town.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Thursday: 3pm – 10pm  Friday and Saturday: Noon – Midnight  Sunday: 1pm-6pm

name: Westbend Vineyards & Brewhouse
description: We are on our final steps to get started and we are very excited. We will have a couple of different beers to choose from. We will also have beer kegs for rent for parties,weddings,restaurants, etc.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting & Sales:  Monday ~ Closed  Tues - Sat ~ 11:00 - 5:00  Sunday ~ 12:00 - 5:00    Tours ($3/person):  Tues-Fri. ~ Available upon request  Saturday ~ 12:00, 1:30 & 3:00  Sunday ~ 1:30 & 3:00

name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery
description: Beautiful views, great food and beer in a fun atmosphere on the water. Brattleboro waterfront restaurant. Roof deck and Bier Garten now open! Full restaurant opening soon!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: White River Brewing
description: As a small batch brewery, White River Brewing Company specializes in traditional European beers, particularly styles from Belgium, Britain, and Germany, all with an American twist. With uncompromising quality, at White River Brewing Company we work hard to make each flavorful, complex sip, a special occasion. With every batch we use only the finest ingredients available, individually chosen to add layers and complexity to each of our products.     Quality Craft BeerDesigned to appeal to the weekend warrior and discerning enthusiast in all of us, our four staple offerings and seasonal rotating beers are adding steam to the craft beer revolution in Southwest Missouri, and delivering a unique experience in every bottle.

name: White Street Brewing Company
description: White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.    While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday, 4pm - 10pm  Friday 4pm - 10pm  Saturday 12pm - 12am  Sunday 12pm - 10pm

name: Wichita Brewing Company
description: Wichita Brewing Company offers a welcoming neighborhood brewpub experience, including 9 flat screen televisions to watch your favorite games, friendly staff, and great entertainment. We are local beer enthusiasts, and we have carefully hand-crafted a variety of unique beers for your enjoyment. We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
description: In 2009 Walt and Luke sat at a craft beer bar and talked about the dream of opening their own brewery that would focus on big West Coast hoppy ales and authentic Belgain ales that would inspire those who drank them. From that conversation forward there would be no looking back. A business plan was developed and hundreds of test batches brewed. In 2011 Walt and Luke’s lifelong friend Ryan Guthy and his parents Rick and Denise all sat down at their house in the mountains of Western North Carolina to taste some of Luke and Walt’s creations while looking over the plans for what would be Wicked Weed Brewing.  After being thoroughly impressed with the full flavor and vision of the project, the Guthys joined the Dickinsons and the team was assembled.  Over the next months Wicked Weed Brewing found a home at 91 Biltmore avenue, a building that seemed destined to be a brewery.  With the creativity of Luke, vision of Walt, dedication of Ryan, exquisite taste of Denise and wisdom of Rick a truly unique brewery was born.  So from the humble beginning of a basement, the dream of Wicked Weed Brewing has come to life. Our beer is bold, full of excitement and flavor.  Always focused on drinkability and pushing the boundaries of what we think we are capable of.  Wicked Weed Brewing will always evolve, always grow and always aspire to be greater.  Join us in bringing something a little Wicked to Asheville.

name: Wiens Brewing Company
description: Wiens Brewing Company is a new Temecula brewery! We were happy to open our doors on November 10th, 2012. You may ask if we are affiliated with the winery in Temecula, Wiens Family Cellars, and the answer is yes. The Wiens family has come together yet again in the community of Temecula to open another fun destination. Along with making wine, the Wiens family has been brewing beer for nearly 17 years. At Wiens Brewing Company you can enjoy tastings of beer, pints, or even have a half-gallon-growler filled to enjoy at home. This Temecula brewery tasting room is very spacious with open areas to see the brewhouse and all of our shiny tanks. Come down and try some of our latest beers while we are open Monday through Thursday from 3pm to 8pm, Friday from 1pm to 8pm, or join us on the weekends from noon to 8pm. Spend a day in Temecula and enjoy Temecula's newest brewery, Wiens Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: M-Th: 3-8, F: 1-8  Weekends: 12-8

name: Wild Donkey Brewing Co.
description: Donkey Punch Brewing Co. features full-flavored craft beers like no others. We hope to see you come out and experience the punch!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:30 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Wild Woods Brewery
description: Wild Woods is a microbrewery in Boulder, Colorado that creates handcrafted beers inspired by the outdoors. Our beers begin with recognizable styles and are brewed to highlight elements of the wilderness.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Wildcard Brewing Company
description: Wildcard Brewing Company was just a dream until experience, encouragement and circumstance made it a reality. The idea behind the name Wildcard is to pursue the unknown. Wildcard Brewing Company’s owners left stability for chaos, moved to England to learn the craft of beer making, and started a business in an uncertain economy, all in pursuit of a dream. You’d call them crazy, adventurous, unpredictable....a wildcard. Our story is one of the unexpected; a place where there are no limits, where perseverance and a free spirit will turn dreams into reality.     It started when Jeff and Jenny brewed two beers to give away as wedding favors at a brewery in San Luis Obispo where they went to college. Homebrew projects and burst bottle explosions ensued in the years after. But a casual passion soon turned career as Jeff and Jenny headed to England. Jeff studied brewing science at the University of Sunderland and Jenny conducted “research” in various local pubs. Once back in the states Jeff headed straight for the most competitive brewing location, the Pacific Northwest. Now 4 years later the pair are back in Jeff’s hometown of Redding building out their production brewery.    Wildcard is small startup business focused on brewing flavorful beers and enriching the communities that enjoy them. Spending dollars locally is just a part of that commitment. We will source products and services within 500 miles of our facility as much as possible and intend to exclusively sell beers within that same area. Supporting local businesses not only has great economic impacts but environmental as well. We don’t want to just do business in the Redding community we want to be a part of it. It is important to give back as much as possible to the community and we will make it a point to donate and get involved in local causes and efforts.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Woodland Empire Ale Craft
description: Imaginative brew creations concocted by husband and wife team Rob and Keely Landerman, Dusty Schmidt, and Tom Dolan.  Handcrafted. Imaginative. Idahoan.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room hours:   Tues- Thurs: 3 pm- 10 pm  Fri: 3 pm-11 pm  Sat: 12 noon-11 pm  Sun: 12 noon-8 pm

name: Zipline Brewing Co.
description: Proudly headquartered in Lincoln, Nebraska, Zipline Brewing Company was borne out of our passion for locally produced craft beer. Visit this page and our website at www.ziplinebrewing.com to learn more about our company and the beers we produce. You can also follow us on Twitter and Untappd. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Friday: 4-7pm  Saturday: 1-7pm

name: 2kids Brewing Company
description: Two Kids Brewing Company is San Diego's newest Nanobrewery! Now open, we're serving the finest in tasty and unusual ales, sans snobby attitude.

name: 612Brew
description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.

name: 903 Brewers
description: 903 Brewers was founded on a simple idea; make great beer for a great community. With that idea in mind Jeremy and Natalie Roberts began building the foundation for 903 Brewers back in 2011.     Jeremy Roberts is not only the founder but also the head brewer. He spent years perfecting his recipes and letting the community decide what beers they wanted from their local brewery. He fearlessly concocted hundreds of different beers to see what new flavors he might come up with. Not all were a hit, but that is how you find a gem. Do you have an idea for a beer you’d like to try? Let him know, he just might try it out.     903 Brewers officially opened its doors in June of 2013 and introduced to the world The Chosen One Coconut Ale and Roo’s Red Ale. Since that time they have released many new and exciting beers. Starting fall of 2014 you will be able to find their beers in 22oz bombers.

name: Absolution Brewing Company
description: As the world grows in its understanding of what beer can and should be, no longer imprisoned by the tasteless, unfilling beers of the recent past, it craves beer made with sincere passion and an unwavering boldness of flavor. And to provide that beer is our mission.    Focusing on Old World styles and New World hops, we are creating a fusion of flavors and aromas to titillate the palate and arouse the olfactory. British, Belgian, and German styles will dominate our taps, while sours will be fermenting and aging from early on.    Absolution Brewing Company is a labor of love for three friends that have a passion for delicious craft beer. Nigel is an English gent that found his way to the West Coast more than two decades ago. Steve is a local boy, born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area with deep ties throughout the community. Wes is from the swamps of Louisiana and discovered Southern California via the Navy. Individually, we are but mere beer drinkers in love with the craft. Together, we are a team dedicated to fulfilling our dreams to bring the best beers to the world that others may feel the passion on their palates.

name: Adventure Brewing Company
description: Adventure Brewing Company makes great craft beer in the Stafford and Fredericksburg, Virginia area.

name: Alpha Brewing Co
description: Aggressive Ales.   Alpha Brewing Company is a St. Louis Microbrewery.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Tue:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 1:00am Sat:  1:00pm - 1:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Tue: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 1:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Andrews Brewing Company
description: Located in the town's first jail at Calaboose Cellars.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  12:00pm - 5:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 5:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 5:00pm  Thu - Sat: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
description: The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.    Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”    We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.    Act Local. Drink Local.

name: Appleton Beer Factory
description: From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.    We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

name: Ashtown Brewing Company
description: Ashtown was conceptualized on a cold morning around a homebrewing setup in Longview Washington by two cousins who found themselves on a map in between two craft beer meccas and knew something needed to change to bring good beer to a vacant area.    In September of 2013 Ashtown opened their doors bringing local hand crafted ales to Southwest Washington. Ashtown believes in its community and the change it can make on a local level.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 10:00pm  WED/TH/FRI 3-10pm  SAT 12-10pm  SUN 1-6

name: Atlas Brew Works
description: A packaging craft brewery in the District of Columbia. Atlas Brew Works focuses on providing D.C. with fresh, craft ales and lagers.

name: Taproom
description: BadWolf Brewing Company is a family-owned and operated nanobrewery in Manassas, VA founded on June 28, 2012. The Co-Founders, Jeremy and Sarah Meyers, are local residents who grew up in the NOVA area and have always dreamed of having a brewery. Jeremy has been brewing beer over 10 years inspired by his trip to Germany. Sarah has a background in business so it's a perfect match. The couple is passionate about craft beer and believes in sharing it with YOU!     The brewing setup is a 1 barrel brewing system so BadWolf can pump out a variety of beers in the taproom. Free popcorn will be offered to cleanse the palate! We don't serve food but you can bring your own or order delivery. BadWolf will offer pints and samples on site and offer growlers to go.

name: Barnhouse Brewery
description: We are a small nano sized brewery that focuses on making great beer for our local community.  We make every effort to use locally grown ingredients from our home grown hops to fruit and honey from our local farmers.     We work hard on our 20 Gallon brewing system and two 80 Gallon Fermenters to bring you beer that is designed to be tasty but not over the top with weird ingredients and trendy gimmicks, just simple tried and true processes with a spark of creativity thrown in resulting in laid back beers for laid back people!
hoursOfOperation: Check Website

name: Beast Brewing Company
description: Beast Brewing offers a unique line of craft beer focusing on robust flavors for the adventurous palate. We are conveniently located on Highway 92 in the San Jose section of Bisbee, just five minutes from downtown. Our facility offers Stunning views of the Mule Mountains in the USA to the north & the San Jose Mountains in Mexico to the south, indoor & outdoor seating, ample parking and entertainment. We are minutes from internationally renowned birding spot – the San Pedro Riparian, as well as many of Arizona’s beautiful state and national parks, including Coronado National Memorial & Forest for hiking, biking, caving, picnicking, and the like. In addition to Beast Brewing’s adventurous beer offerings, we are Proudly continuing a Bisbee tradition, we brew Electric Beer.  Electric Brewing dates back to 1988, making it Arizona’s first microbrewery.  Electric Beer provides a high-quality approachable line of products. Beast Brewing Company strives to reduce our carbon footprint by incorporating locally sourced ingredients into our products when possible, utilizing refurbished equipment, capturing gray water and donating spent grain to farmers. Stop in to Arizona’s first & wildest craft brewery for a cold, refreshing beverage after an active and sunny day in Arizona. Cheers! - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/#sthash.NabirAAL.dpuf
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Tuesday: Closed for Brewing Wednesday – Saturday: 12pm – 8pm Sunday: 12pm – 6pm - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/brewery/#sthash.k9iPJKUV.dpuf

The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.

description: Cradled in the heart of Benson on Omaha’s north side - you will find Benson Brewery, a cozy neighborhood brew-pub welcoming all who look for friendly company, good conversation, house made beers and solid drinks. We believe a bar is what its patrons and community make it, which is why we serve true, locally sourced foods when possible, well-crafted brews, and drinks to please all.    The Benson Brewery is a pub for all times. From its reclaimed wooden flooring, to its warm interiors, modern brewery, and exposed brick walls – Benson Brewery is a place without pretense. Our food, our drinks, our service and our space are inspired by old and new American traditions. We welcome all to come and feel at home in our brewery, a Benson Local

name: Bike Dog Brewing Company
description: Bike Dog Brewing Company is co-founded by four Sacramentans with a love for bikes, dogs and craft beer. The brewers fell in love with the endless flavor profiles available through brewing and the delicate hop profiles only available in incredibly fresh beer and want to share that love with beer drinkers from all over the Sacramento area.    Bike Dog is West Sacramento’s first brewery and the only one in town with a tasting room. We operate a 3 barrel brewhouse (industry speak for really small) on site. Brewing small batches means the beer will always be amazingly fresh and allows for the flexibility to mix it up a little with new recipes getting brewed on a regular basis. Because it will be brewed in such small batches, much of the beer will be available only for purchase in the Bike Dog tasting room — allowing customers to see the beer go from grain to glass and hobnob with the brewers and allowing the brewers to personally nurture the local craft beer community.

name: Brewery Terra Firma
description: Brewery Terra Firma is unique in its approach as a brewery and as an agricultural destination. Through the integration of sustainable production methods, environmentally conscious waste management and innovative water recycling/reclamation techniques, we hope to become a model for breweries and agricultural destinations throughout the nation.    The BrewhouseThe brew house is an engineered mix of new and old technologies and techniques. Whole ingredients are used with traditional brewing equipment which is controlled by state of the art systems that manage temperature throughout the brewing process. These same systems harvest waste BTU's, capturing the energy that would normally be lost and reusing it to preheat ingredients, maintain product temperatures, and even heat the taproom via an in-floor heating system. Waste materials such as process water and spent grain are also captured and stored for fertilization and irrigation of our crops.    The prep table in the brewery quite often looks like the prep area in a fine restaurant. Fresh herbs, fruits and vegetables are a common sight, along with an amazing array of spices, roots and even flowers. Whole foods, fresh frozen or dried are used, artificial flavorings, extracts and coloring agents are not. The beer is unfiltered, its clarity being attained by the addition of natural clarifying agents and allowing ample time for the beer to condition.    Brewery Terra Firma began brewing operations in May of 2013, with the taproom opening to the public in July of the same year.

name: Cellarmaker Brewing Company
description: Cellarmaker Brewing Company has been in the works for quite some time. Look for our beers to start making their way around better known beer bars and beer focused restaurants in San Francisco starting in September.     We have a tasting room in the same building as the brewery and will offer tasters, pints, and growlers. Some beers may be bottled further down the line but for now it's all draft. The only way you can take our beer away is in the form of a growler - which by the way, is a great way to drink beer!     Look for a focus of plenty of hoppy beers, belgian-style saisons, dark beers, and sour beers. We are huge fans of wine and bourbon barrel aged beers as well so it's only natural for us to have a barrel program. Think bourbon barrels loaded with big chewy imperial stouts, excessively hopped IPAs, fruited sour beers, and funky saisons. This is what we love. This is what we are all about. We hope you are too!    Please follow along for the ride as we build San Francisco's next great brewery.    Cheers!

name: Council Brewing Company
description: Council Brewing Company, established in 2013 and opened in 2014, is a small batch brewery, located in the Kearny Mesa area of San Diego.     Our tasting room has been deliberately crafted to create a destination for people from all walks of life to come together, converse, and fellowship over truly fine craft beer. The name "Council" was chosen because it conveys this sense of community; a place where peers come together to deliberate, debate, and make decisions. The tasting room has a warm, inviting feeling, with green, tan, and rustic red toned walls, soft brown flooring and rich Mahogany bar tops. Careful thought was placed into the low music sound levels and decision to not install televisions in order to promote conversations.     We place a tremendous emphasis on creating exemplary beer, crafted to the highest standards. We brew beers that are unique and extremely flavorful, focusing on Ales hailing from American, Belgian, and English origins. No matter what the style, we focus on creating intense aromas and flavors that are very well balanced and drinkable. Click over to "Our Beer" to find out more about our beer offerings.    Council Brewing Company is owned and operated by Curtis & Liz Chism and you can usually find them at the tasting room serving up freshly crafted beer.

name: D9 Brewing Company
description: Proudly serving Fanatical Ales in North Carolina since 2013.    D9 Brewing Company is a craft microbrewery located in North Carolina with the purpose of brewing and sharing outstanding beer that unites people. First envisioned in July 2009 over a pot of boiling wort, the founders believe every person, and beer, has a story and decided to start a brewery where both could be shared.    Our goal is to always keep our community (that's you) as our central ingredient (In a 'sit back, relax and have a beer' kind of way, not the creepy 'To Serve Man' way)!    D9's name is derived from the 9th Congressional District of North Carolina as a nod to the roots that we've grown by both living and working in the Charlotte area over the past decade.

The brewery will feature an onsite taproom, brewery tours, and special events. Our goal is to produce high quality hand crafted ales, while giving the community a brewery they can be proud of. Currently, we are looking for space in the Plaza Midwood community. We hope to be able to open our doors to the world in late 2013 and we can hardly wait until then!

name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
description: Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our  credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not  influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will  push the envelope. We will test theories and create  moments through our liquid in which tones and times  are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and  confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for  nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No  billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.  Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and  the mission is complete. For all of those in search of  something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look  into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you  will find is what you never thought you were looking for.  This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

name: Empirical Brewery
description: Empirical Brewery is a startup brewery in Chicago Illinois.  Our mission is to create high quality craft beers that exceed your expectations.  We are focused on innovation and exploration of unique flavor profiles.  Our customers come first and have a direct impact on brewery operations.  The advantage of a craft brewery is that it can respond to changing market tastes.  To that end, we will endeavor to gather feedback from you and incorporate it into our brewing.  For updates on the brewery, follow us on Twitter, Facebook or our blog. Look for our beer to be available early next year.

name: Factotum Brewhouse
description: Mission Statement: Factotum Brewhouse assists homebrewers in creating a highly-drinkable product by providing professional brewing equipment, guidance and education, and a beer-loving community defined by mutual support, unbiased opinion, and a philosophy that anybody can brew.    Who we are: We are a sibling-owned brewhouse in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Denver. Our German-American upbringing has instilled in us a passion for beer and our background as professional educators compels us to impart our brewing knowledge to the community.    The brewhouse: Factotum Brewhouse is a brewery for the people, by the people. The drinks you enjoy in our taproom were conceived and created by homebrewers and other beer lovers under the tutelage of our head brewer in an effort to guide and teach our customers in the art of making great beer. Drink a beer, make a beer—at Factotum Brewhouse, the choice is yours.     Twitter: @FactotumBrew   4735 Lipan Street, Denver, Colorado 80211

name: Flying Mouse Brewery
description: Secluded in a hollow of the Blue Ridge mountains, the Flying Mouse Brewery brings a new craft beer experience to Botetourt County, Virginia. Our brewery is focused on the experience and enjoyment of craft beer as part of an active outdoor lifestyle, whether it be a cold draft after a long hike or a pint over conversation at dinner after a day of cycling. Join us in celebrating Virginia’s spirit of invention and the thirst for adventure. Go beer!
hoursOfOperation: Friday and Saturday 4:00pm – 9:00pm and Sunday 2:00pm – 6:00pm.

name: Fogbelt Brewing Company
description: Paul Hawley and Remy Martin both grew up in Sonoma County along the fog belt where the redwoods meet the vineyards. Paul and Remy have over thirty years of combined experience in the wine industry. The old saying, "it takes a lot of beer to make wine" rings especially true for these long-time friends who have been brewing together since 2004, when they worked the grape harvest in New Zealand. Remy went on to study brewing at UC Davis and has experience working at a number of local breweries. Paul has been working at his family's winery in Dry Creek Valley since 2005.    Sonoma County was once one of the largest hop growing regions in the nation, but all that remains today are the ghostly shells of old hop-kilns. Paul has been experimenting with growing hops for years. This year, Paul and Remy hope to harvest 500 vines from hop yards in Sonoma County.

name: Fonta Flora Brewery
description: Fonta Flora Brewery integrates the soul of agriculture with the artisanship of zymurgy to create a menagerie of rustic and savory libations. With an emphasis on seasonal flora, Fonta Flora brings English tradition and Belgian inspiration to the Appalachian mountains of North Carolina. Fonta Flora utilizes local artists to help conceptualize the notion that fermentation is yet another medium for creating art. This uniquely artisan approach to beer yields a sustainable product filled with culture from our very own community.

name: Fort Point Beer Company
description: Fort Point Beer Company is a New American brewery - the product of a thriving American craft beer culture, shaped by deeply San Franciscan values: quality craftsmanship and a spirit of innovation. We create balanced, thoughtful beers that reference traditional styles but are by no means bound to them. For us, brewing is the confluence of creative expression and refined technique. We want our beers to tell a story, inspire an idea, and be thoroughly enjoyable.    Fort Point Beer Company was founded in 2014 by brothers Tyler and Justin Catalana in the Presidio of San Francisco. The brewery resides in an historic Presidio building that was formerly used as an Army motor pool. Being situated in this iconic landscape reinforces our pride in San Francisco and in the beer we brew. Head Brewer Mike Schnebeck has developed a deft and impassioned brewing style over the past years at Mill Valley Beerworks and leads the pioneering spirit of our beers.

name: Freewheel Brewing Company

name: Gizmo Brew Works
description: Deep in the Umstead Industrial Park, something stirs. Amid the clank of modern machinery, a group of workers busy themselves with one of the world's oldest crafts: brewing. At Gizmo Brew Works, this meeting of contemporary technology and ancient know-how produces a tempting slate of small-batch beers. Inside tanks that hold the equivalent of 1,000 pints each, brewers prep favorites including the smooth and sweet Black Stiletto Stout and the complex Palisade Wasp India Pale Ale with the same care that has earned many of their past beers medals at the Carolina Championship of Beer. They also save room for seasonals, carefully adding a sweet caramel flavor and spicy Noble hops to their altbier. These beers and more make frequent appearances in the brewery's taproom, gracing pint glasses for impromptu toasts or filling up growlers for at-home sips. Never ones to shy away from curious guests, brewers also open up their facility for Saturday tours, walking groups through the beer-making process during 30-minute explorations.

name: Glass Bottom Brewery
description: Our 1-acre hop farm is visible on route 41 just north of Great Barrington. We produce our own hops, and we are committed to living locally and sustainably.     We brew unique artisanal ales, but more than that, we brew beer that tells a story. The point of each brew is to express an idea, to create an experience for the taster that shares the brewer's vision.

name: Grain Station Brew Works
description: Grain Station Brew Works is Oregon's FIRST Community Supported Brewery (CSB). Located in Beautiful and Historic McMinnville, Oregon, the center point of Oregon wine country where we enjoy superb local cuisine and word class wine.    We are proud to be located in a community that supports local business and agriculture. With several CSA's (Community Supported Agriculture) already calling the area home, our CSB will give it's members a sense of pride and ownership in being part of a locally focused business that they can enjoy.    Many craft breweries have started in recent years with brewers experimenting in their garage. What makes GSBW special is that we bring over 24 years of professional brewing experience to a small, warm and inviting local community.    We're not wealthy individuals laying down large amounts of cash to build an empire. We're two local Oregonians with backgrounds in brewing and agriculture, combining with a goal to create the Best Beer Experience in the region!

hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thurs: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri & Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Granite Falls Brewing Company
description: Granite Falls Brewing Company is proud to be located in the historic Granite Bottling Works (1903-1978) and Pepsi-Cola Bottling (1978-2012) plant. The original 1903 Bolick’s bottling plant still stands as and within the brick walls along the left side of the building and lobby interior. Come celebrate with us 110 years of beverage production and bottling onsite!     History: in December 2012, Mastroeli-MacNeil Equity Investments financed the purchase of this 31,690 square foot configuration of two warehouses, situated on 2.08 acres contiguous to Downtown Granite Falls. A panoramic view of the Blue Ridge Mountains runs the rear of the building. The owners financed a painstaking build-out, and are proud of the adaptive reuse of this warehouse/manufacturing space into a supper club, eatery, and old-style "watering hole."     The Brewery: GFB is a 30BBL/(40BBL) craft beer production facility. We brew onsite and within sight while you indulge your senses in our Southern Gastropub restaurant and attached Tasting Room. Our brewpub features a wraparound 103-foot-long tasting counter, copper/penny-topped wine bar, and serves as a world-class music venue. Eclectic artifacts dress the spaces for those with an itch for the odd or unique.    The owners of Granite Falls Brewing Company invite you to visit our site, indulge in an experience that is In A Glass By Itself, partake of laughter, fellowship and community, lo and behold what we unearthed between the walls and specimens of the original Granite Bottling Works bottles. Become a part of Our History!

name: Grapevine Craft Brewery
description: We seek to be an inclusive community of beer drinkers. Our beer is for you, for your neighbors and for your friends. Though we are a brewery, we believe that beer is never the central figure of any moment. People are the moment makers. And great beer should be part of those moments. Our beers are crafted for good times.    North Texas is becoming well known for producing great local brews and we're excited to be a part of perpetuating that great tradition for years to come. Our beers aren't intended to slap you in the face with outlandish concoctions. But we hope that they become well crafted local classics that you'll come back to time and time again.    Clean.  Crisp.  Approachable.    It's where the good times are.

name: Gravel Bottom Craft Brewery & Supply
description: Once upon a beer consumed, the idea of opening Gravel Bottom was born. We have crossed the country with stacks of recipes kept in journals, sketched business plans on scrap paper, and enjoyed our evolving product along the way. We have landed in the great town of Ada and hope to meet you soon.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 11:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 11:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 11:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 12:00am Sat:  11:00am - 12:00am  Tue - Thu: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Green Lion Brewing Company
description: What is Green Lion Brewing Company?    GLBC is the manifestation of twelve combined years of experimentation in fermentation. More than this it is the product of passion and drive to improve community resilience, bolster local agriculture, and support local businesses.     Through our journey into brewing and fermentation we have discovered a world of endless possibility with beer. The spectrum of beers available today are just a fraction of a taste of what's possible. Beer has been around for thousands of years and with this come thousands of recipes, tales of yore, ancient forgotten knowledge, and a myriad of spices, herbs, and unique brewing styles that have been enjoyed throughout the ages. One of our goals is to rediscover these long forgotten recipes and styles and modernize them for today.    Our passion for knowledge and drive for quality keep us enthralled with the world of fermentation. It is our pleasure to craft quality beer not only for the palate but also to create beer for the mind.

name: Grist Brewing Company
description: Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.    Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.    While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Hailstorm Brewing Co.
description: Hailstorm Brewing Co. is a brewery located in Tinley Park, IL. Our brewery will feature a variety of ales and barrel-aged beers.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Saturday: 12:00 Noon to 7:00 pm

name: HammerHeart Brewing Company
description: HammerHeart Brewing Company is a new brewery in Lino Lakes, Minnesota that opened to the public on August 2nd 2013. Our brewery is built in the honor and recognition of the old Nordic and Celtic cultures, rich with experience and wisdom, literature, and life. HammerHeart represents who we are today because of who came before us.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from 2-10pm.

name: Hard Knocks Brewing
description: Life is hard. At the end of a tough day, there's nothing quite like that first taste of cold craft beer hitting your throat. We're brewing for you.

name: Headlands Brewing Company
description: Headlands Brewing Co. was founded by people that play outside.  We have a sense of adventure and embody the spirit of the place that we live, celebrating the bay, the history, the trails and the mountains that surround us. Outside the brewery you can find us surfing and swimming in the beautiful waters in our backyard or cycling or running through the valleys, parks, hills and mountains surrounding our bay.     Patrick Horn (formerly of Pacific Brewing Laboratory) and Phil Cutti (Southpaw BBQ) create classic beers along with seasonal and experimental brews that push the envelope.

name: Heritage Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Heritage Brewing Co. is a 20-barrel brewery set in the heart of Manassas, Virginia. Heritage Brewing is excited to bring great fresh and unique craft beer to our fellow Americans. From our 20-barrel brew house and oak aging program, to our 1/2 barrel artisan batches, we look to only produce the finest beer. We can't wait to share our passion for great beer with America.

name: Hi-Wire Brewing
description: At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.    We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri: 2:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Historic Brewing Company
description: Historic Brewing Co. is a Flagstaff, AZ based brewery. We believe in making damn good craft beer and bringing the local community together. As a family company established in 2013, Historic Brewing Company is proud to brew in the woods of Flagstaff and celebrate craft beer with local ingredients and a kickass attitude. We are a company rooted in passion, quality brewing methods, and good ol' fashioned hustle.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Hofbräuhaus Chicago
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Hop Alley Brew Pub
description: Georgia's newest Brew Pub. Providing Alpharetta, Ga and surrounding communities with excellent beer, brewed in-house, served right off the tank, along with pouring beers, brought in from world renowned breweries. All while serving fresh, delicious, food provided by local farmers.

name: Hosanna Brewing Company
description: Hosanna Brewing Co’s Brewpub is the greatest place to enjoy beer, wine and coffee with friends. It’s the best escape from normal life in the Triangle. If you’re looking for a great night out you’ll be glad you spend it at Hosanna Brewing Co.

name: House of Pendragon Brewing Company
description: House of Pendragon Brewing Co. focuses on handcrafted artisan made ales and lager.    Nothing is off limits at House of Pendragon Brewing Company. Here, we embrace the flavor. We use modern brewing techniques and the latest ingredients. With no restrictions holding us back, we’re not just thinking outside the box, we’re breaking it down and recycling it!    What does Pendragon mean?   Pendragon is the last name of the famed Arthur Pendragon, otherwise known as King Arthur and The Knight’s of the Round Table. The translation of the name Pendragon literally means "head dragon" or "chief dragon".

name: Hunter's Brewing
description: Hunter's Brewing is a nanobrewery located in Chesterton, IN. Brewed by hand on our one-barrel system, Hunter's Brewing beers focus on flavor and range from the traditional to the creative.    Owner-brewers Justin Reisetter and Amy Gentry take a thoughtful approach to brewing and are delighted to bring high-quality, small-batch boutique brews to the Duneland region.      We offer 32 oz half-growlers to go.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday 5-9pm, Friday 4-9pm, Saturday noon-9pm and most (not all) Sundays 1-6pm.

name: Idyll Hounds Brewing Company
description: Idyll Hounds is a small craft brewery located in northwest florida. The white sand beaches forever blue sky and warm waters of florida give inspiration to the carefully crafted fresh tasty brews. Whether it's the tropical crispness of the Divide N Conch'r DIPA, the refreshing beachablility of our Man O' Wheat or the unique flavors of our seasonal line you can know our beer is responsibly brewed with the freshest and finest ingredients. At Idyll Hounds we brew for the beer enthusiasts and the novice beer drinkers alike. With a local first mind set concoctions are brewed with poetic attention to detail and memories that easily inspire lines of prose.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Imperial Oak Brewing
description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.

name: Indiana City
description: It’s our mission to brew innovative beers for craft beer lovers in Indy. And that is that. We’re focused on Indy. We’re doing all we can to add to the beer culture right here. We’re filling growlers at our taproom near downtown, and we’re on tap at select craft beer bars in Indy.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Infusion Brewing Company
description: Located in the heart of the "Benson Beer District" in Omaha, Nebraska, and built in the historic former home of Olson's Meat Market , Infusion Brewing Company brews up great hand crafted beers with a locally sourced twist! Our beers are available through our on-site tap room and in the Omaha and Lincoln areas on draft only.

name: Institution Ale Company
description: We are a family owned and operated micro-brewery dedicated to crafting uncompromised and unfiltered American style ales. We are committed to producing and serving world class beer to our local community. Our Camarillo based brewery has an on-site tasting room and our beer is available at select local bars/restaurants.

name: Jack Pine Brewery - Taproom
description: Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.    So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.    Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?    This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.    So, stop in and give it a try!
hoursOfOperation: Friday 4-7pm  Saturday 4-7pm

name: Jagged Mountain Brewery
description: Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery is a unique, innovative, and distinctive brewery based out of Denver, Colorado.

We offer 8-12 different styles of beer for purchase by the pint, sample flight and growlers to go. Food trucks are present onsite during normal business hours.

LVB is committed to serving the local community, and we want the  local guest to know that as soon as they hear our name. Our slogan embodies our mission, "Our Beer is Our Bond." We plan to keep the distance between  the brewer and the guest as small as possible to stay responsive to the changing needs and tastes of our community.

Inspired and financed by United States Army Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technicians (Bomb Squad), the Mad Bomber Brewing Company will offer a solid lineup of assertive American Ales.

name: Martin City Brewing Company
description: Martin City Brewing Company is Kansas City’s newest family owned restaurant and pub.  It sits nestled in Martin City, near the train tracks.  Martin City Brewing Company has a one of a kind food menu with top-notch chefs on staff.  There are over 50 different brews to choose from.  Not only will one find a cozy space inside the pub, but one can enjoy the beer garden and live music on any given weekend night.  With chain restaurants taking over the American landscape, this restaurant/tavern is a great escape from “the norm.”  The newly remodeled hundred-year-old building is far from your ordinary place next door.  Make Martin City Brewing Company your next night out and your neighborhood hotspot!!

We offer handcrafted farmhouse ales made in small batches from hops and grains grown on the farm.  Check our web page and face book page for hours.    Check back in the coming months for our grand opening!

name: Miner Brewing Company
description: Located in the heart of the Black Hills, and owned and operated by the same family behind the award-winning Prairie Berry Winery, Miner Brewing Company produces craft beers that are both traditional in nature, and yet truly “South Dakota”.    With five generations of family lineage handcrafting beverages in South Dakota, and with 15 years as winemaker and owner of Prairie Berry Winery, Brewmaster Sandi Vojta is inspired by the traditional brewing styles of her family’s European heritage. By infusing regional and seasonal ingredients into the recipes handed down to her, she has skillfully adapted those traditional styles to create craft beers with a regional character, setting each distinctly apart from other microbrews.    All of our beers are produced in small, 15-barrel fermenters, allowing us to keep each batch small enough to maintain microbrew quality and a close attention to detail at all times. The results are craft beers that are approachable and distinctive, to be enjoyed by craft beer novices and enthusiasts alike.    We invite you to experience Miner Brewing for yourself, as we open our Tap Room in Hill City this fall 2013. Stop on by for a flight or a glass, hang out to enjoy our seasonal selections, and stay a while for a little South Dakota hospitality.     Join us in the Black Hills and discover your own pint of gold.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Mississippi Brewing Company
description: Mississippi Brewing Company LLC plans be pouring beer in late 2013. What sets us apart from the rest is that we understand the need for local “Light Drinkable Beers” as well full flavored Craft beers.

Our beer is handcrafted in small batches and served just a few yards from where it was brewed.  Expect to find 8 to 11 choices at any time, ranging from our standards, Wilbur!, WPA and Sevex to a wide variety of seasonal, creative and collaborative brews (including a new brand of brews every 10-14 days).  And, we proudly pour a full pint.

Stay thirsty and stay tuned for a 2014 opening!

name: Ozark Beer Company
description: We strive to make great beer. Beer that speaks to the quality and character of who we are and also to the region that we represent. We are proud to be in the Ozark Mountains, with its relaxed atmosphere and eclectic population of farmers, craftsmen, and captains of industry. At Ozark Beer Company, we make beer that brings neighbors together, and that all people lucky enough to call the Ozarks home can be proud of.

name: Peddler Brewing Company
description: Peddler Brewing Company is a Brewery in Ballard, WA that will be opening its doors in a few weeks! It is a collaboration of Haley's dream of running her own customer-oriented business and meeting new people every day, Dave's dream of brewing and talking about beer every day, and their shared love of riding bikes. We will strive to be a gathering place for beer lovers and support bicycling as a great way to get around our beautiful city.    Peddler Brewing Company has a 7-barrel brewing system which means it can pump out up to 14 kegs of beer per batch. We plan to have 8 taps in our tap room with a few regular taps and a couple rotating seasonal taps. We also plan to have a guest tap or two of other WA state brews or ciders. Our indoor space will have a large bar and tables for guests to sit back and enjoy a taster tray or a pint. We will also have a growler and 32oz bottle exchange to take beer home, with a small deposit encouraging the return and re-use of bottles/growlers.    Decide to ride your bike to our brewery? Perfect! We have an indoor bike rack that holds 9 bicycles and will have a bike work station for you to do some tune-ups, pump up your tire, or easily fix that flat. The bicycle theme will be seen throughout the brewery from the faucet handles in the bathroom to the gears in our concrete counter top.
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Petaluma Hills Brewing Co
description: A 10 BBL micro brewery in Petaluma, CA working feverishly to open a tasting room.

name: Ponysaurus Brewing
description: Ponysaurus is a new brewery based in Durham, North Carolina, focused on perfecting balanced styles and finding ways to make beers you’ve always imagined.    Yes, our logo is a mix between a mean-looking Tyrannosaurus Rex and a stately-looking Equus Ferus Caballus. What’s better than a pony, and what’s better than a dinosaur? Both.     We look at beer with a kind of childlike wonder. Beer is alchemy, the holiest magic. And even though we take what we do very seriously, we never want to forget how magical it is. The name constantly reminds us of that.    When you glance at our label, it looks classic and refined. Then you take a second look and you realize it's a horse with tiny T-Rex arms.    We wanted the name to have the same effect as the beer. To make you look—and taste—twice.    Also, it's pretty damn unforgettable.    Oh yeah. That guy up there grinnin' like a shot fox? That's Keil Jansen, our Brewmaster. He's alright.

name: Populuxe Brewing
description: Populuxe Brewing is a nano-brewery (1.5bbl) open in the Ballard neighborhood of Seattle.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Public Works Ale
description: WA is brewed in Baltimore.

name: Quest Brewing Company
description: Quest Brewing Company officially started becoming a reality in January 2012.  That is when Don Richardson and Andrew Watts met for the first time; each with thoughts of opening up a microbrewery in Greenville, SC.  Both had put together plans for their company vision and, as luck would have it, those plans mirrored each other!  The two joined forces and Quest Brewing Company was founded.    Once the business was formed, a brewery name was needed.  After weeks of brainstorming, the name ‘Quest’ rose to the top of our list.  We wanted a name that emulates that passionate and adventurous spirit of the Greenville community.    ”People in Greenville are always on some kind of quest.  Whether it is to bike the entire Swamp Rabbit Trail or hike Table Rock, there is a very adventurous spirit here.  We wanted to embrace that.” -Quest’s Andrew Watts    Quest’s beer is meant to be premium and sought-after, much like a goal or quest.  The next time you are in Greenville, make it your quest to visit all our town has to offer.  Head to Falls Park.  Enjoy Main Street.  Most importantly, enjoy one of Quest’s hand-crafted beers!
hoursOfOperation: TUE 4:00PM-8:00PM  WED 4:00PM - 8:00PM  THUR 4:00PM - 9:00PM  FRI 4:00PM - 9:00PM  SAT 12:00PM - 9:00PM

name: Raleigh Brewing Company
description: Raleigh Brewing Company will house a 20 bbl brew system to produce 6 year-round beers, 2 seasonal beers, and various experimental beers. All of our beers will be available in our taproom, which is located at the brewery. The taproom will have dartboards, a comfy lounge, and a few TVs for those days when the game is on.     Our beer will also be available to the public. Ask for it at your local watering hole!     At Raleigh Brewing Company we intend to be a big part of the local Raleigh community. We plan to do that by staying as green as possible by reclaiming our water used to brew with, recycling, and conserving energy, donating money/beer/time to local charities, and opening up our space for local groups/organizations/events as much as possible. If there's anything you'd like to see us do, just shoot us an email!     We look forward to opening our doors and serving you some hand-crafted beers, which will hopefully be at the very beginning of 2013!     Cheers!

name: Rare Bird Brewery
description: Situated in a beautiful 1931 red brick building, Rare Bird’s mission is to provide an unsurpassed dining and drinking experience in Traverse City. From our intimate reclaimed wood booths to the cozy and cool lounge and German bier hall style seating made from massive wood slabs that Nate and Tina sustainably harvested, we have a space for everyone to feel comfortable. The food menu features simple, familiar items served with a unique and exciting flair. Our ingredients are sourced locally when possible. Keeping with the local theme, our beer ingredients will include malt and hops grown in Michigan whenever possible. All of these qualities together make Rare Bird stand out in the crowd.

The craft beers that leave our facility will have the reputation that we strive for, continuing our service by providing those who serve with a craft beer they can be proud of.

Our “Brewers Notice”, the federal license to produce beer, was approved by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau in Feb. 2013. We began making capital improvements to the leased space and assembling our equipment in October 2012. Our opening brewhouse size will be ~1.5 ba...See More

name: Retro Beer Company
description: We are three-retired friends who believe that giving back to others is life's greatest virtue. We were raised on these basic ideals: Love for Community, Importance of Generosity, and the Need for Sustainability. History tells us that the invention of beer inspired the idea of community. When people come together to enjoy beer, amazing things happen: Friendships are sparked, stories are shared, ideas are cultivated. Beer is simply a social vehicle for people to discuss what really matters in life. Together we can be a driving force in giving back to a cause in your community. 20% of this beverage’s proceeds go to [insert charity]. With your help we can shift the purpose behind beer to generously give back to the community
